2016-08-06.abstract: The community school model makes alleviating the ills of poverty part of academic success. So far, it’s working.
2016-08-06.snippet: The community school model makes alleviating the ills of poverty part of academic success. So far, it’s working.
2016-08-06.lead_paragraph: Half a dozen police cars ring the entrance to the Morris Educational Campus in the Bronx. To enter this venerable Gothic-style building, I have to make my way through a phalanx of policemen and be scanned by a metal detector.
2016-08-06.headline_main: To Teach a Child to Read, First Give Him Glasses

2016-08-06.abstract: Is hypertension a defect, or a normal response to social circumstances?
2016-08-06.snippet: Is hypertension a defect, or a normal response to social circumstances?
2016-08-06.lead_paragraph: I teach a medical school course on homeostasis: how organ systems work together to maintain physiological balance. For example, when blood pressure drops acutely, the heart speeds up and the kidneys retain sodium and water, propelling blood pressure back to normal. If body temperature falls, we shiver to generate heat, blood vessels constrict to conserve heat, and we warm up. Homeostasis is about preserving constancy in the face of changing conditions. As a model for explaining human physiology, it does remarkably well.
2016-08-06.headline_main: When Blood Pressure Is Political

2016-08-06.abstract: The days of chasing fire engines may be nearing an end as The Times rethinks how it covers its own hometown.
2016-08-06.snippet: The days of chasing fire engines may be nearing an end as The Times rethinks how it covers its own hometown.
2016-08-06.lead_paragraph: The New York Times gave readers a somewhat longer version of the report above last April. A reporter was sent to the scene. An editor was moved into place. And the Metro pages of the newspaper were torn up to make room for a late-breaking story.
2016-08-06.headline_main: A ‘New York’ Paper Takes a Look in the Mirror

2016-08-06.abstract: With millions descending on the national parks each year, the tension between access and preservation becomes more strained.
2016-08-06.snippet: With millions descending on the national parks each year, the tension between access and preservation becomes more strained.
2016-08-06.lead_paragraph: WALPOLE, N.H. — THOUSANDS of people are expected to gather at the north entrance to Yellowstone National Park on Aug. 25 to celebrate a uniquely American idea. The National Park Service turns 100 years old, and its birthday party will take place under a stone arch emblazoned with the words “For the benefit and enjoyment of the people.”
2016-08-06.headline_main: Are We Loving Our National Parks to Death?

2016-08-06.abstract: More can be done with powers that already exist to deal with the legacy of sentencing policies that have been recognized as destructively unfair.
2016-08-06.snippet: More can be done with powers that already exist to deal with the legacy of sentencing policies that have been recognized as destructively unfair.
2016-08-06.lead_paragraph: President Obama last week commuted the prison terms of 214 federal inmates who were sent to prison under draconian, ’80s-era laws that have since been revised. Among them were 67 people serving life sentences, nearly all of them for nonviolent drug offenses.
2016-08-06.headline_main: Mercy Is Far Too Slow at the Justice Department

2016-08-06.abstract: What should we make of the Republican swoon for Clinton, and what should she do with it?
2016-08-06.snippet: What should we make of the Republican swoon for Clinton, and what should she do with it?
2016-08-06.lead_paragraph: It’s looking more and more like Donald Trump is the best thing that ever happened to Hillary Clinton.
2016-08-06.headline_main: Hillary’s Summer of Love

2016-08-06.abstract: Silicon Valley has brought its wrecking ball to haute cuisine, and the results are not pretty.
2016-08-06.snippet: Silicon Valley has brought its wrecking ball to haute cuisine, and the results are not pretty.
2016-08-06.lead_paragraph: SAN FRANCISCO — At a fancy Silicon Valley restaurant where the micro-greens came from a farm called Love Apple, I got a definitive taste of California in the age of the plutocrats. This state — and this native of it — have long indulged a borderline-comic impulse toward self-expression through lifestyle and food, as if success might be a matter of nailing the perfect combination of surf trunks, grilled lamb hearts and sunset views.
2016-08-06.headline_main: Dinner, Disrupted

2016-08-06.abstract: Fast forward to Inauguration Day.
2016-08-06.snippet: Fast forward to Inauguration Day.
2016-08-06.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — IT is Inauguration Day, Jan. 20, 2017.
2016-08-06.headline_main: Crazy About the Presidency

2016-08-06.abstract: We never really talked, but the seeds he collected for me one summer said it all.
2016-08-06.snippet: We never really talked, but the seeds he collected for me one summer said it all.
2016-08-06.lead_paragraph: Minneapolis — I spent the entire month of May sorting through the past, and throwing away old fruit. The discarded material filled several Dumpsters in total, but I was careful to space it out, so as not to overload the university’s trash pickup schedule. It was fruit that I had collected more than 20 years ago, as part of my dissertation research, which was to study the mineralization processes within the hackberry (Celtis occidentalis) seed.
2016-08-06.headline_main: My Father’s Hackberry Tree

2016-08-06.abstract: Recent research suggests that only about half of perceived friendships are mutual.
2016-08-06.snippet: Recent research suggests that only about half of perceived friendships are mutual.
2016-08-06.lead_paragraph: THINK of all the people with whom you interact during the course of a day, week, month and year. The many souls with whom you might exchange a greeting or give a warm embrace; engage in chitchat or have a deeper conversation. All those who, by some accident of fate, inhabit your world. And then ask yourself who among them are your friends — your true friends. Recent research indicates that only about half of perceived friendships are mutual. That is, someone you think is your friend might not be so keen on you. Or, vice versa, as when someone you feel you hardly know claims you as a bestie.
2016-08-06.headline_main: Do Your Friends Actually Like You?

2016-08-06.abstract: Trade isn’t the main force destroying good jobs, but it sure is a handy scapegoat.
2016-08-06.snippet: Trade isn’t the main force destroying good jobs, but it sure is a handy scapegoat.
2016-08-06.lead_paragraph: One of the unusual features of this very unusual election year is that both candidates have made major trade agreements an important issue in their campaigns. Donald Trump has been particularly vociferous on the matter, blaming trade for hollowing out the middle class and promising to rip up existing agreements with other countries. Though his talking points are nothing more than hot air, he has struck a chord with millions of angry voters.
2016-08-06.headline_main: The Rage Against Trade

2016-08-06.abstract: How to teach them our faith — and not to be afraid.
2016-08-06.snippet: How to teach them our faith — and not to be afraid.
2016-08-06.lead_paragraph: I’m up at 3 a.m., burping my new baby girl, Nusayba, smelling her fresh, new baby skin and rubbing her soft, bald head.

2016-08-06.snippet: A global arts curator on the creation of culture, trashy celebrity blogs and keeping cool.
2016-08-06.lead_paragraph: Boon Hui Tan was named vice president for global arts and programming for the Asia Society last year following a decade shaping the art scene in his native Singapore, where he curated major exhibitions, commissioned public art and served as director of the Singapore Arts Museum.
2016-08-06.headline_main: Boon Hui Tan

2016-08-06.lead_paragraph: Feeling worried? These days, much of America is.

2016-08-06.snippet: Investigating which candidate is more honest.

2016-08-06.headline_main: Clinton’s Fibs vs. Trump’s Huge Lies

2016-08-06.snippet: A French priest’s murder and an unexpected religious future.
2016-08-06.lead_paragraph: IN the days since Father Jacques Hamel, an 85-year-old French priest, was slaughtered at the altar by two jihadists, his murder has become a contested symbol in his country, continent and church.
2016-08-06.headline_main: The Meaning of a Martyrdom

2016-08-06.abstract: A Brazilian star tries to lift the weight off his nation’s soccer soul and the dreams of his old neighborhood.
2016-08-06.snippet: A Brazilian star tries to lift the weight off his nation’s soccer soul and the dreams of his old neighborhood.

2016-08-06.abstract: Representative Scott Rigell, a Republican who opposes Donald J. Trump, is the first member of Congress to throw his support to Gary Johnson.

2016-08-06.abstract: The law requires notification to Medicare beneficiaries that they may incur huge out-of-pocket costs if they seek care at nursing homes after not being formally admitted to hospitals as inpatients.
2016-08-06.snippet: The law requires notification to Medicare beneficiaries that they may incur huge out-of-pocket costs if they seek care at nursing homes after not being formally admitted to hospitals as inpatients.
2016-08-06.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — In November, after a bad fall, 85-year-old Elizabeth Cannon was taken to a hospital outside Philadelphia for six and a half days of “observation,” followed by nearly five months at a nearby nursing home for rehabilitation and skilled nursing care. The cost: more than $40,000.
2016-08-06.headline_main: New Medicare Law to Notify Patients of Loophole in Nursing Home Coverage

2016-08-06.abstract: The disclosure of the “playbook” for drone strikes further lifts the secrecy cloaking a much disputed tactic for fighting terrorism outside conventional war zones.
2016-08-06.snippet: The disclosure of the “playbook” for drone strikes further lifts the secrecy cloaking a much disputed tactic for fighting terrorism outside conventional war zones.

2016-08-06.abstract: The president headed into his two-week break in an unusually festive mood, having just celebrated his 55th birthday and with Hillary Clinton ahead in the polls.

2016-08-06.lead_paragraph: CHILMARK, Mass. — President Obama arrived in Martha’s Vineyard on Saturday for his last summer vacation as president, bringing his wife, both daughters and even the family dogs along.
2016-08-06.headline_main: Obama Arrives in Martha’s Vineyard for Two-Week Vacation

2016-08-06.abstract: Bruce Gemmell, whose name appears on 11 patents, has helped Katie Ledecky lower her times in numerous events.

2016-08-06.lead_paragraph: RIO DE JANEIRO — Before he became a full-time swim coach, Bruce Gemmell was an engineer and inventor whose oeuvre included toilet paper products. Among the 11 American patents on which his name appears is one for an adapter and dispenser for coreless rolls.
2016-08-06.headline_main: His Latest Innovation: The World’s Best Swimmer

2016-08-06.abstract: Readers respond to “Trade Is Good, but Voters Aren’t Buying It” (July 31).
2016-08-06.snippet: Readers respond to “Trade Is Good, but Voters Aren’t Buying It” (July 31).
2016-08-06.lead_paragraph: To the Editor:
2016-08-06.headline_main: The People vs. Global Trade

2016-08-06.abstract: The International Boxing Association decided to eliminate the guards for amateur male boxers, concluding that they did not prevent concussions.
2016-08-06.snippet: The International Boxing Association decided to eliminate the guards for amateur male boxers, concluding that they did not prevent concussions.
2016-08-06.lead_paragraph: RIO DE JANEIRO — Olympic boxing has taken on a new look. In the 2016 Summer Games, there is a revised point system, the inclusion of a number of professional fighters and, perhaps most noticeably, the elimination of head guards for male boxers.
2016-08-06.headline_main: Making Olympic Boxing Safer by Eliminating Head Guards

2016-08-06.abstract: Gary Sanchez filled in again at catcher as the Yankees continued to assess one of their most promising young players.

2016-08-06.lead_paragraph: During spring training, the Yankees rookie Gary Sanchez had an opportunity to secure a roster spot backing up catcher Brian McCann. But Sanchez appeared to press, had trouble reaching base during games and was sent to Class AAA Scranton/Wilkes-Barre for more seasoning.
2016-08-06.headline_main: A Yankees Rookie Is Impressive in Defeat

2016-08-06.abstract: Martha Norelius is the only woman to win consecutive 400 freestyles at the Olympics, and Ledecky needs two golds in the event just to match her.
2016-08-06.snippet: Martha Norelius is the only woman to win consecutive 400 freestyles at the Olympics, and Ledecky needs two golds in the event just to match her.
2016-08-06.lead_paragraph: Katie Ledecky is the queen of the pool right now, a colossal favorite to win the 400- and 800-meter freestyles and a good bet in the 200, too.
2016-08-06.headline_main: Here’s a Record Even Katie Ledecky Can’t Match (Yet)

2016-08-06.abstract: A partnership with Apple has made eight iPads available to every major league club that can be used in dugouts during games to consult scouting reports and other information.
2016-08-06.snippet: A partnership with Apple has made eight iPads available to every major league club that can be used in dugouts during games to consult scouting reports and other information.
2016-08-06.lead_paragraph: If a major league coach or player is scrolling through an iPad in the dugout, he is probably not perusing Facebook but rather accessing his scouting reports.

2016-08-06.abstract: Milwaukee, a fourth-place team, dealt Jeremy Jeffress, Will Smith and Jonathan Lucroy to restock their farm system.
2016-08-06.snippet: Milwaukee, a fourth-place team, dealt Jeremy Jeffress, Will Smith and Jonathan Lucroy to restock their farm system.
2016-08-06.lead_paragraph: The big winner at the nonwaiver trading deadline, at least among the sellers, was a fourth-place team that has gone a few years since its last playoff series. This team dealt multiple relievers and a top position player for a haul that included three of the top eight prospects who switched organizations before the deadline.
2016-08-06.headline_main: Brewers, Like Yankees, Trade With Eye on Future

2016-08-06.abstract: Samuel Donaldson the puzzle maker makes it tougher to distinguish between himself and the newsman.
2016-08-06.snippet: Samuel Donaldson the puzzle maker makes it tougher to distinguish between himself and the newsman.
2016-08-06.lead_paragraph: SUNDAY PUZZLE — The puzzle constructor Samuel Donaldson created quite a stir when his first crossword appeared in The New York Times in 2008. Solvers thought that the news anchor and journalist, Sam Donaldson, had added crossword puzzle construction to his already impressive list of accomplishments.
2016-08-06.headline_main: Anchor Lines

2016-08-06.abstract: The best singles players who will be competing in doubles in the Olympics may be able to change their games. For a regular player, it’s more challenging.
2016-08-06.snippet: The best singles players who will be competing in doubles in the Olympics may be able to change their games. For a regular player, it’s more challenging.
2016-08-06.lead_paragraph: I hit one backhand after another crosscourt but could not get the ball where it was supposed to go. I couldn’t bring myself to cross the line, to hit my shots wider, into that dreaded doubles alley on the tennis court I had always avoided.
2016-08-06.headline_main: Learning to Cross the Line in Doubles

2016-08-06.abstract: If you’re seeing more accents on the backs of baseball jerseys, there’s a good reason.
2016-08-06.snippet: If you’re seeing more accents on the backs of baseball jerseys, there’s a good reason.
2016-08-06.lead_paragraph: Shortstop Eduardo Núñez was sitting in the locker room at Major League Baseball’s All-Star Game last month when a clubhouse employee walked in. The man was holding Núñez’s jersey but calling out an unfamiliar name. It sounded like “Noonez.”
2016-08-06.headline_main: Baseball Campaign Puts the Accent on Spanish Names

2016-08-06.abstract: Competition begins Sunday with the women’s artistic gymnastics qualifying round.
2016-08-06.snippet: Competition begins Sunday with the women’s artistic gymnastics qualifying round.
2016-08-06.lead_paragraph: For Simone Biles, the wait is over. Her Olympic competition begins Sunday with the women’s artistic gymnastics qualifying round. She and her American teammates are all but assured spots in the team final, the all-around final and event finals: vault, uneven bars, balance beam and floor exercise. Here’s what to know as the competition kicks off.
2016-08-06.headline_main: Women’s Gymnastics Day 1: Simone Biles Is the One to Beat

2016-08-06.abstract: The team, which seeks to win its first Olympic medal since the 1984 Games, is already achieving what the American men can only dream about.
2016-08-06.snippet: The team, which seeks to win its first Olympic medal since the 1984 Games, is already achieving what the American men can only dream about.
2016-08-06.lead_paragraph: RIO DE JANEIRO — The United States women’s field hockey team, seeking an Olympic medal and maybe, just maybe, a boost in national recognition, played its first game Saturday against the powerhouse Argentina, and did just what it needed to, pulling off a 2-1 victory.
2016-08-06.headline_main: U.S. Women’s Field Hockey Team Pushes Toward Recognition, Defeating Argentina

2016-08-07.abstract: A defrocked Irish priest accosted de Lima, the Rio caldron lighter, while he was leading the 2004 Olympic marathon. The assailant, now 69, isn’t quite remorseful.
2016-08-07.snippet: A defrocked Irish priest accosted de Lima, the Rio caldron lighter, while he was leading the 2004 Olympic marathon. The assailant, now 69, isn’t quite remorseful.
2016-08-07.lead_paragraph: RIO DE JANEIRO — Alone in his apartment in south London, a 69-year-old man named Neil Horan watched a middle-of-the night broadcast of the opening ceremony for the Summer Olympics. Like other viewers, he wondered which Brazilian would get the honor of lighting the Olympic caldron.
2016-08-07.headline_main: He Tackled Vanderlei de Lima, Then Fumed During Caldron Lighting

2016-08-07.abstract: Mr. Fountain brought the traditional jazz of his native New Orleans to a national audience through frequent appearances on the Lawrence Welk and Johnny Carson television shows.
2016-08-07.snippet: Mr. Fountain brought the traditional jazz of his native New Orleans to a national audience through frequent appearances on the Lawrence Welk and Johnny Carson television shows.
2016-08-07.lead_paragraph: Pete Fountain, a clarinetist who brought the traditional jazz of his native New Orleans to a national audience through frequent appearances on the Lawrence Welk and Johnny Carson television shows, died on Saturday in New Orleans. He was 86.
2016-08-07.headline_main: Pete Fountain, 86, Dies; Clarinetist Popularized Spirited New Orleans Jazz

2016-08-07.abstract: The party, which held its convention on Saturday in Houston, has a new sense of vitality as its candidate, Jill Stein, draws about 5 percent in polls.
2016-08-07.snippet: The party, which held its convention on Saturday in Houston, has a new sense of vitality as its candidate, Jill Stein, draws about 5 percent in polls.
2016-08-07.lead_paragraph: HOUSTON — Minutes before she addressed a boisterous crowd at the Green Party convention here on Saturday, Jill Stein sat in a mirror-walled room backstage, gazing at her reflection with a look of dumbstruck bliss.

2016-08-07.abstract: Saturday’s match was, in some ways, the World Cup game that could have happened last summer but never did.
2016-08-07.snippet: Saturday’s match was, in some ways, the World Cup game that could have happened last summer but never did.
2016-08-07.lead_paragraph: RIO DE JANEIRO — In winning the 2015 women’s World Cup, the United States was fortunate to avoid a surprisingly strong French club that lost to Germany in a quarterfinal game in which France seemed to be the better team.

2016-08-07.abstract: Quotation of the day for Sunday, August 7, 2016.

2016-08-07.lead_paragraph: “Same thing we’d do in a hotel. It just floats.”

2016-08-07.abstract: A man threatened to kill two New York police captains over restricted airwaves, revealing how easily someone can hack a store-bought radio and communicate with the police.
2016-08-07.snippet: A man threatened to kill two New York police captains over restricted airwaves, revealing how easily someone can hack a store-bought radio and communicate with the police.
2016-08-07.lead_paragraph: A male voice came over the police radio, speaking in standard departmental jargon as he asked to be patched through to the duty captain in the Midtown South Precinct in Manhattan on July 30. The captain responded.
2016-08-07.headline_main: Threats Over Police Radios Have Officers and Scanner Buffs on the Case

2016-08-07.abstract: An Op-Ed piece endorsing Hillary Clinton by Michael J. Morell, a former top C.I.A. official, does not disclose that Morell works at a Washington consulting firm with connections to Clinton.
2016-08-07.snippet: An Op-Ed piece endorsing Hillary Clinton by Michael J. Morell, a former top C.I.A. official, does not disclose that Morell works at a Washington consulting firm with connections to Clinton.
2016-08-07.lead_paragraph: The Op-Ed ran in The New York Times opinion section on Friday under the headline, “I Ran the C.I.A. Now I’m Endorsing Hillary Clinton,” and the piece delivered the kind of public support a campaign cherishes:
2016-08-07.headline_main: A Potent Endorsement Could Use More Transparency

2016-08-07.abstract: Nick Delpopolo, who was adopted from an orphanage in Montenegro, is competing in the Rio Olympics with the United States judo team four years after testing positive for marijuana.
2016-08-07.snippet: Nick Delpopolo, who was adopted from an orphanage in Montenegro, is competing in the Rio Olympics with the United States judo team four years after testing positive for marijuana.
2016-08-07.lead_paragraph: GLENVILLE, N.Y. — Seven years ago, Nick Delpopolo took a family trip back to Montenegro, the country where he was born. He met a young man who had lived with him at an orphanage — and still lived there.
2016-08-07.headline_main: Foreign-Born, Adopted and Seeking a Comeback in Rio

2016-08-07.abstract: The groups have attacked Muslims and, more recently, low-caste Hindus, under the guise of protecting animals sacred to Hindus.
2016-08-07.snippet: The groups have attacked Muslims and, more recently, low-caste Hindus, under the guise of protecting animals sacred to Hindus.
2016-08-07.lead_paragraph: NEW DELHI — As his party prepares for elections in key states, Prime Minister Narendra Modi has distanced himself from right-wing cow protection groups that have proliferated since his government came to power. These vigilante groups have carried out violent attacks on Muslims and, more recently, low-caste Hindus suspected of slaughtering cows, which are considered sacred in Hinduism.
2016-08-07.headline_main: Narendra Modi, India’s Leader, Condemns Vigilante Cow Protection Groups

2016-08-07.abstract: Mr. Kaine, Mrs. Clinton’s running mate, on Sunday said their campaign would be “real transparent” and could recover from a trust deficit with voters.
2016-08-07.snippet: Mr. Kaine, Mrs. Clinton’s running mate, on Sunday said their campaign would be “real transparent” and could recover from a trust deficit with voters.
2016-08-07.lead_paragraph: Hillary Clinton will be “real transparent” with Americans after learning lessons from the controversy over her use of a private email server, her running mate, Tim Kaine, said on Sunday, expressing optimism that she could improve her trust deficit with voters over the next month.
2016-08-07.headline_main: Tim Kaine Says Hillary Clinton Has Learned From Email ‘Mistake’

2016-08-07.abstract: Productions for the coming year include a revival of Stephen Adly Guirgis’s play “The Last Days of Judas Iscariot,” directed by Estelle Parsons.
2016-08-07.snippet: Productions for the coming year include a revival of Stephen Adly Guirgis’s play “The Last Days of Judas Iscariot,” directed by Estelle Parsons.
2016-08-07.lead_paragraph: For its 55th season, La MaMa, the East Village hub of avant-garde performance, has assembled a cosmopolitan smorgasbord of more than 70 productions of plays, puppet shows and dance.
2016-08-07.headline_main: La MaMa Announces an Eclectic and International 55th Season

2016-08-07.abstract: In the face of a growing epidemic, Mr. Pence put aside his own moral opposition to giving syringes to drug users to allow a needle exchange program.
2016-08-07.snippet: In the face of a growing epidemic, Mr. Pence put aside his own moral opposition to giving syringes to drug users to allow a needle exchange program.
2016-08-07.lead_paragraph: AUSTIN, Ind. — On the evening of March 24, 2015, Sheriff Dan McClain got an unexpected voice mail: “This is Gov. Mike Pence calling. I would welcome the opportunity to get your counsel on what’s going on in Scott County.”
2016-08-07.headline_main: Mike Pence’s Response to H.I.V. Outbreak: Prayer, Then a Change of Heart

2016-08-07.abstract: Deborah Colker, a passionate Brazilian mixer of forms, talked about how the opening ceremony for the Rio Games was an ideal showcase.
2016-08-07.snippet: Deborah Colker, a passionate Brazilian mixer of forms, talked about how the opening ceremony for the Rio Games was an ideal showcase.
2016-08-07.lead_paragraph: Brazilians know how to put on a good show on a shoestring — this is the country of Carnival, after all. So despite Zika fears and reports about murky water in Guanabara Bay, the colorful and ecologically conscious Olympics opening ceremony in Rio de Janeiro on Friday night went off without a hitch, and even more: It felt like a giant street party.
2016-08-07.headline_main: For This Choreographer, the Olympics Are the Zenith

2016-08-07.abstract: Fans may want athletes to be drug free, but they also want to be entertained by raw power, and there has long been a wink-and-nod pragmatism about weight lifting in particular.
2016-08-07.snippet: Fans may want athletes to be drug free, but they also want to be entertained by raw power, and there has long been a wink-and-nod pragmatism about weight lifting in particular.
2016-08-07.lead_paragraph: RIO DE JANEIRO — The brothers Dan and Anthony Rigney of Australia attended the Olympic weight lifting competition on Sunday and were not exactly mortified that the sport is more polluted than Guanabara Bay.
2016-08-07.headline_main: After Drug Tests, Is Anyone Left in the Weight-Lifting Room?

2016-08-07.abstract: The Warner Bros. film about a gang of DC Comics supervillains set box office records over the weekend, with about $135 million in domestic sales.
2016-08-07.snippet: The Warner Bros. film about a gang of DC Comics supervillains set box office records over the weekend, with about $135 million in domestic sales.
2016-08-07.lead_paragraph: Backed by a meticulously executed marketing campaign, “Suicide Squad” pushed through abysmal reviews to set box office records for Warner Bros. over the weekend.
2016-08-07.headline_main: Making ‘Suicide Squad’ a Smash, Despite Withering Reviews

2016-08-07.abstract: At least 77 people were injured in a rainstorm that surprised even Macedonia’s top weather authorities with its ferocity.
2016-08-07.snippet: At least 77 people were injured in a rainstorm that surprised even Macedonia’s top weather authorities with its ferocity.
2016-08-07.lead_paragraph: SKOPJE, Macedonia — A freakishly violent rainstorm that Macedonia’s top weather official called a “water bomb” ravaged Skopje during the weekend, collapsing streets, inundating vehicles and drowning trapped motorists and homeowners, most of them caught by surprise.
2016-08-07.headline_main: A ‘Water Bomb’ of a Storm Kills 21 in Macedonia’s Capital, Skopje

2016-08-07.abstract: As Phelps prepared to compete in a fifth Olympics, he was learning to balance his proven routines and a new, unpredictable life featuring a 2-month-old son.
2016-08-07.snippet: As Phelps prepared to compete in a fifth Olympics, he was learning to balance his proven routines and a new, unpredictable life featuring a 2-month-old son.
2016-08-07.lead_paragraph: Michael Phelps, headphones in, was listening to music on his smartphone to pump himself up for a race at the United States Olympic trials when he felt the phone vibrate in his hoodie pocket. Phelps has faced plenty of distractions in his 16 years as an Olympic swimmer, but nothing like this.
2016-08-07.headline_main: Michael Phelps Relishes the Cheer and Challenge of His New Reality

2016-08-07.abstract: Black, middle-class voters appeared more concerned with mundane matters like good governance and taxes than with the party’s heroic liberation past.
2016-08-07.snippet: Black, middle-class voters appeared more concerned with mundane matters like good governance and taxes than with the party’s heroic liberation past.
2016-08-07.lead_paragraph: CHANTELLE, South Africa — A week before South Africa’s local elections on Wednesday, the Zithas held a family meeting inside their entertainment room to decide how to vote. Loyal backers of the African National Congress in every election since the end of apartheid, the family decided it was time for a change.
2016-08-07.headline_main: Election Shows Many South Africans Losing Faith in ‘Pompous’ A.N.C.

2016-08-07.abstract: At the Vail International Dance Festival, the artistic director Damian Woetzel revived rare works and brought fresh faces to classical showpieces.
2016-08-07.snippet: At the Vail International Dance Festival, the artistic director Damian Woetzel revived rare works and brought fresh faces to classical showpieces.
2016-08-07.lead_paragraph: VAIL, Colo. — Often the greatest excitement at an all-star dance gala comes from reading the list of illustrious participants. The programs, too commonly a numbing pileup of tired showpieces and frustrating excerpts, disappoint. But the International Evenings of Dance at the Vail International Dance Festival here on Friday and Saturday night were not that kind of gala.
2016-08-07.headline_main: An All-Star Dance Gala Takes Risks and Soars

2016-08-07.abstract: A coalition including the jihadist group formerly known as the Nusra Front seized military facilities and tentatively opened a road into rebel-held districts.
2016-08-07.snippet: A coalition including the jihadist group formerly known as the Nusra Front seized military facilities and tentatively opened a road into rebel-held districts.
2016-08-07.lead_paragraph: BEIRUT, Lebanon — Rebel forces and their jihadist allies challenged the Syrian government’s siege of opposition-held districts of Aleppo over the weekend, seizing military facilities in the city’s southwest and tentatively opening a road to the besieged area.
2016-08-07.headline_main: Rebel Offensive in Syria Challenges Government Siege of Aleppo

2016-08-07.abstract: Drowning in debt and tempted to line up a handy corpse? Elizabeth Greenwood’s book explores death fraud and offers a rough primer on erasing yourself.
2016-08-07.snippet: Drowning in debt and tempted to line up a handy corpse? Elizabeth Greenwood’s book explores death fraud and offers a rough primer on erasing yourself.
2016-08-07.lead_paragraph: “There is but one truly serious philosophical problem,” Camus wrote, “and that is suicide. Judging whether life is or is not worth living amounts to answering the fundamental question of philosophy.” Camus was silent, as far as I know, on the subject of “pseudocide,” the term for faking one’s own death.
2016-08-07.headline_main: ‘Playing Dead,’ a Disappearing Act for the Fraudulent-Minded

2016-08-07.abstract: Ashley Jensen stars as an aggressive publicist turned crime solver in a new British series on Acorn.
2016-08-07.snippet: Ashley Jensen stars as an aggressive publicist turned crime solver in a new British series on Acorn.
2016-08-07.lead_paragraph: Not all detectives have to be brooding, whiskey-swilling clouds of gloom. Not all of them even have to be real detectives. The delightful Agatha Raisin is the latest proof.
2016-08-07.headline_main: Review: For ‘Agatha Raisin,’ Playing Detective in an English Village

2016-08-07.abstract: Still time to borrow and spend.
2016-08-07.snippet: Still time to borrow and spend.
2016-08-07.lead_paragraph: A few years ago, it was easy to say what U.S. monetary and fiscal policy should be doing. The economy was still obviously depressed, so the indicated demand policy was pedal to the metal all the way – no need to worry about inflation, no reason to believe that deficit spending would cause any crowding out (in fact it would almost surely crowd in private investment, because such investment depends on demand.)
2016-08-07.headline_main: Prudential Macro Policy

2016-08-07.abstract: On Friday, the jazz trumpeter Terence Blanchard performed an elegy for Eric Garner in Staten Island. Other artists have been equally expressive in the age of Black Lives Matter.
2016-08-07.snippet: On Friday, the jazz trumpeter Terence Blanchard performed an elegy for Eric Garner in Staten Island. Other artists have been equally expressive in the age of Black Lives Matter.
2016-08-07.lead_paragraph: The emotional climax of Terence Blanchard’s SummerStage concert on Friday night, at Clove Lakes Park on Staten Island, arrived precisely one hour in, like a timed detonation. It was the title track of his most recent album, “Breathless” — an elegy for Eric Garner, who died at the hands of police officers on Staten Island just over two years ago. Mr. Blanchard, in his trumpet solo over the plaintive theme, struck a careful tonal balance, sounding haunted but unflinching.
2016-08-07.headline_main: A Cri de Coeur From Jazz Musicians in a Black Lives Matter Age

2016-08-07.abstract: Now in its second year, the fair founded by the Microsoft billionaire Paul Allen featured artists such as Dawn Kasper, Adam McEwen and Wynne Greenwood.
2016-08-07.snippet: Now in its second year, the fair founded by the Microsoft billionaire Paul Allen featured artists such as Dawn Kasper, Adam McEwen and Wynne Greenwood.
2016-08-07.lead_paragraph: SEATTLE — Physicists, picking up where Einstein left off, say the titanic impact of two black holes colliding can make a sound detectable through gravitational waves that wash across space and time. Dawn Kasper, in trying to create her version of that sound as a project for the Seattle Art Fair, said she thought it might be a little like the fading echoes of a great Seattle rock show, in the resonant hum of a crashing cymbal.
2016-08-07.headline_main: At Seattle Art Fair, the Interaction Between Technology and Modern Life

2016-08-07.abstract: The following tax-exempt fixed-income issues are scheduled for pricing this week.
2016-08-07.snippet: The following tax-exempt fixed-income issues are scheduled for pricing this week.
2016-08-07.lead_paragraph: The Treasury’s schedule of financing this week includes Monday’s regular weekly auction of new three- and six-month bills and an auction of four-week bills on Tuesday.
2016-08-07.headline_main: Treasury Auctions Set for the Week of Aug. 8

2016-08-07.abstract: This biographical play at 59E59 Theaters profiles Alice Austen, a 19th- and 20th-century photographer who chronicled city life and defied conventions of her day.
2016-08-07.snippet: This biographical play at 59E59 Theaters profiles Alice Austen, a 19th- and 20th-century photographer who chronicled city life and defied conventions of her day.
2016-08-07.lead_paragraph: Alice Austen loved her Staten Island estate, Clear Comfort. “If somebody made me go away, it would be like a chunk torn out of my body,” she says early in the new biographical play “Alice in Black and White.”
2016-08-07.headline_main: Review: In ‘Alice in Black and White,’ a Pioneering Photojournalist

2016-08-07.abstract: Zhouqin Burnikel and Don Gagliardo return with huge ideas.
2016-08-07.snippet: Zhouqin Burnikel and Don Gagliardo return with huge ideas.
2016-08-07.lead_paragraph: MONDAY PUZZLE — For some solvers, themes get in the way of a good free-form crossword puzzle, one where the really cool entries stretch across and down the grid with abandon. Admittedly, themes put constraints on constructors because it takes a lot of skill to place a set of entries in a symmetrical grid without sacrificing other things. For my money, though, themes are bonus content that not only present a challenge to the puzzle maker, but are also a leg up to the crossword solver.
2016-08-07.headline_main: Long View

2016-08-07.abstract: The announcement of Rodriguez’s retirement closed a chapter in Yankees history as the team shifts its focus to a younger, developing roster.
2016-08-07.snippet: The announcement of Rodriguez’s retirement closed a chapter in Yankees history as the team shifts its focus to a younger, developing roster.
2016-08-07.lead_paragraph: Luis Severino sat in the Yankees’ clubhouse Sunday morning, inquisitively viewing several televisions that were broadcasting speculation about Alex Rodriguez’s future. Late Saturday night, the Yankees had announced a news conference with Rodriguez to be held before Sunday’s game against the Cleveland Indians.
2016-08-07.headline_main: Alex Rodriguez’s Future Resolved, Yankees Settle In and Beat Indians

2016-08-07.abstract: In 2010, Shahram Amiri, a scientist, claimed on YouTube that the C.I.A. had kidnapped him. A subsequent video changed the narrative. Missing his son, he returned to Iran and disappeared.
2016-08-07.snippet: In 2010, Shahram Amiri, a scientist, claimed on YouTube that the C.I.A. had kidnapped him. A subsequent video changed the narrative. Missing his son, he returned to Iran and disappeared.
2016-08-07.lead_paragraph: When Shahram Amiri emerged from the shadows into the spotlight six years ago, he was a young Iranian scientist who suddenly appeared on YouTube from a safe house, telling a bizarre story of having been kidnapped by the Central Intelligence Agency.
2016-08-07.headline_main: How an Iranian’s Spy Saga Ends, 6 Years Later: He’s Executed

2016-08-07.abstract: Suzuki accomplished the feat in his 16th Major League Baseball season, joining only Pete Rose as players who did so that quickly.
2016-08-07.snippet: Suzuki accomplished the feat in his 16th Major League Baseball season, joining only Pete Rose as players who did so that quickly.
2016-08-07.lead_paragraph: Ichiro Suzuki, the baseball pioneer who proved 15 years ago that Japanese hitters could succeed in Major League Baseball, reached a hallowed milestone Sunday when he became the 30th player to compile 3,000 hits.
2016-08-07.headline_main: Ichiro Suzuki Reaches 3,000 Hits, Again Breaking Ground for Japanese Players

2016-08-07.abstract: The tech giant wants to weave its intelligent assistant into other smart gadgets, even those not made by Amazon. But weakness in mobile could be an obstacle.
2016-08-07.snippet: The tech giant wants to weave its intelligent assistant into other smart gadgets, even those not made by Amazon. But weakness in mobile could be an obstacle.
2016-08-07.lead_paragraph: SEATTLE — Amazon surprised a lot of people when its Echo, a $180 so-called smart speaker, became a hit, giving them a novel way to play music, turn on the lights in their homes and set thermostats with voice commands.
2016-08-07.headline_main: Amazon Has Big Plans for Alexa: Running the ‘Star Trek’ Home

2016-08-07.abstract: Several fans wearing T-shirts critical of Brazil’s interim president were shown being removed from a women’s soccer match.
2016-08-07.snippet: Several fans wearing T-shirts critical of Brazil’s interim president were shown being removed from a women’s soccer match.
2016-08-07.lead_paragraph: RIO DE JANEIRO — The expulsions of ticket holders from Olympic sites after they protested Michel Temer, Brazil’s interim president, is fueling a debate over the limits of freedom of expression in a country that remains on edge amid a period of extraordinary political upheaval.
2016-08-07.headline_main: Expulsions of Protesters at Rio Olympics Draw Rebukes

2016-08-07.abstract: Signatures are due Monday to put proposals on Colorado’s ballot that would restrict hydraulic fracturing; and attention turns to earnings at Valeant, Disney and Macy’s.
2016-08-07.snippet: Signatures are due Monday to put proposals on Colorado’s ballot that would restrict hydraulic fracturing; and attention turns to earnings at Valeant, Disney and Macy’s.
2016-08-07.lead_paragraph: Here’s what to expect in the week ahead.
2016-08-07.headline_main: Colorado Fracking Limit Deadline; Valeant and Disney Earnings Reports

2016-08-07.abstract: Children of the 1980s will remember the sizzling egg equated to a brain on drugs. Its coming back helps those same people talk to their own children.
2016-08-07.snippet: Children of the 1980s will remember the sizzling egg equated to a brain on drugs. Its coming back helps those same people talk to their own children.
2016-08-07.lead_paragraph: For a generation of commercial-watching adolescents, it was an indelible image: an egg, sizzling in a frying pan, representing “your brain on drugs.” It was a straightforward message, and the ad’s final line — “Any questions?” — asked as the egg white clouded and cooked, was strictly rhetorical.
2016-08-07.headline_main: ‘This Is Your Brain on Drugs,’ Tweaked for Today’s Parents

2016-08-07.abstract: He talked of being “at peace” in stepping aside as a player, but the allure of records so close could tug at the achievement-obsessed Yankee.
2016-08-07.snippet: He talked of being “at peace” in stepping aside as a player, but the allure of records so close could tug at the achievement-obsessed Yankee.
2016-08-07.lead_paragraph: This is how it ends for Alex Rodriguez? With a Yankees-orchestrated whimper instead of an all-out public relations war?
2016-08-07.headline_main: Alex Rodriguez’s Orchestrated Move May Not Be His Last

2016-08-07.abstract: In the wake of a Korean military agreement with the United States, several events in China featuring the South’s music and television stars have been canceled.
2016-08-07.snippet: In the wake of a Korean military agreement with the United States, several events in China featuring the South’s music and television stars have been canceled.
2016-08-07.lead_paragraph: BEIJING — Has K-pop become one of the first victims of a recent fraying of relations between China and South Korea?
2016-08-07.headline_main: South Korean Missile Defense Deal Appears to Sour China’s Taste for K-Pop

2016-08-08.abstract: Wondering what will happen to the homeless people who cluster each morning on West 57th Street, as developers compete to build the highest condominium building.
2016-08-08.snippet: Wondering what will happen to the homeless people who cluster each morning on West 57th Street, as developers compete to build the highest condominium building.
2016-08-08.lead_paragraph: My commute to work includes a walk on West 57th Street (a.k.a. Billionaire’s Row), a street laced with new high-rise condominiums and others under construction. A competition seems to be in progress: Which will be the highest and most expensive?
2016-08-08.headline_main: Left Behind on Billionaire’s Row

2016-08-08.abstract: President Recep Tayyip Erdogan is racing to banish the legacy of Mustafa Kemal Ataturk and establish himself and Islam as the most consequential factors in modern Turkish history.
2016-08-08.snippet: President Recep Tayyip Erdogan is racing to banish the legacy of Mustafa Kemal Ataturk and establish himself and Islam as the most consequential factors in modern Turkish history.
2016-08-08.lead_paragraph: ISTANBUL — President Recep Tayyip Erdogan has always had ambitions of surpassing Mustafa Kemal Ataturk, the founder of modern Turkey, as the country’s most consequential figure.
2016-08-08.headline_main: Erdogan Seizes Failed Coup in Turkey as a Chance to Supplant Ataturk

2016-08-08.abstract: It’s a moment of reckoning for a legendary former guerrilla leader, and new prime minister.
2016-08-08.snippet: It’s a moment of reckoning for a legendary former guerrilla leader, and new prime minister.
2016-08-08.lead_paragraph: KATHMANDU, Nepal — Ten summers ago in Nepal, the Maoist leader Pushpa Kamal Dahal emerged from hiding just as the decade-long insurgency he had directed was pushing the country’s monarchy to its knees. The rebel chief was picked up by a government helicopter, then whisked to the prime minister’s residence in Kathmandu to begin official peace talks.
2016-08-08.headline_main: A Maoist’s Burden in Nepal

2016-08-08.abstract: No matter the outcome of Sunday’s national referendum on a new constitution, the junta will remain in control until it decides to hand power back to an elected government.
2016-08-08.snippet: No matter the outcome of Sunday’s national referendum on a new constitution, the junta will remain in control until it decides to hand power back to an elected government.
2016-08-08.lead_paragraph: No matter the outcome of Sunday’s national referendum, the junta will remain in control until it decides to hand power back to an elected government.
2016-08-08.headline_main: Heng on Thailand’s Military Referendum

2016-08-08.abstract: To provide high-speed internet to remote areas, local power companies are borrowing techniques that were used to electrify towns in the United States nearly a century ago.
2016-08-08.snippet: To provide high-speed internet to remote areas, local power companies are borrowing techniques that were used to electrify towns in the United States nearly a century ago.
2016-08-08.lead_paragraph: ZENA, Okla. — From the sofa in his living room, Clinton Creason can see the electric pole outside that his father staked 70 years ago to bring power to this remote area of hilly cattle pastures.
2016-08-08.headline_main: How to Give Rural America Broadband? Look to the Early 1900s

2016-08-08.abstract: Corporations are turning to Apple’s products for their tight-knit hardware and software, advanced security and intuitive interfaces.
2016-08-08.snippet: Corporations are turning to Apple’s products for their tight-knit hardware and software, advanced security and intuitive interfaces.
2016-08-08.lead_paragraph: SAN FRANCISCO — In the primordial days of computing, IBM machines were so common inside corporations that there was a running joke in the industry: Nobody ever got fired for buying IBM.
2016-08-08.headline_main: Once Taunted by Steve Jobs, Companies Are Now Big Customers of Apple

2016-08-08.abstract: As anti-Islamic rhetoric and discrimination surge, the federal government is emerging as a bulwark in defense of embattled American Muslims.
2016-08-08.snippet: As anti-Islamic rhetoric and discrimination surge, the federal government is emerging as a bulwark in defense of embattled American Muslims.
2016-08-08.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — For nearly 10 months, a Muslim congregation in the Philadelphia suburb of Bensalem, Pa., pleaded with township officials to allow the construction of a mosque, paying for expensive traffic studies, repeatedly explaining Islamic practices, revising and re-revising design plans, and then receiving the final word: No.
2016-08-08.headline_main: Township Saw a Zoning Issue. The Justice Dept. Saw Religious Discrimination.

2016-08-08.abstract: Incidents, including a mugging of a security chief and an assault on a Portuguese official, are piling up, while the show of force has raised concerns about overly aggressive policing.
2016-08-08.snippet: Incidents, including a mugging of a security chief and an assault on a Portuguese official, are piling up, while the show of force has raised concerns about overly aggressive policing.
2016-08-08.lead_paragraph: RIO DE JANEIRO — If battling pickpockets were an Olympic sport at the current Summer Games, the Brazilian authorities might qualify for a medal.
2016-08-08.headline_main: Security Force of 85,000 Fills Rio, Unsettling Rights Activists

2016-08-08.abstract: At an industry event in Beverly Hills, television executives try to make the case that their shows stand out.
2016-08-08.snippet: At an industry event in Beverly Hills, television executives try to make the case that their shows stand out.
2016-08-08.lead_paragraph: BEVERLY HILLS, Calif. — With the number of scripted television shows swelling each year — there were more than 400 last year, and that number is expected to go up this year — anxious network executives are once again attending a news media event here to make the case that their stuff is just a wee bit better than the next guy’s.
2016-08-08.headline_main: TV Networks Try to Win Over the Critics

2016-08-08.abstract: High-profile accusations have drawn new attention to sexual harassment and assault, but the risks of reporting incidents still discourage women from coming forward.
2016-08-08.snippet: High-profile accusations have drawn new attention to sexual harassment and assault, but the risks of reporting incidents still discourage women from coming forward.
2016-08-08.lead_paragraph: In the fall of 1991, an obscure law professor named Anita Hill pushed the issue of sexual harassment into the public consciousness when she accused her former boss, the Supreme Court nominee Clarence Thomas, of having repeatedly made lewd overtures toward her.
2016-08-08.headline_main: After Ailes and Cosby, a Moment for More Women to Speak Up

2016-08-08.abstract: Walker’s two-run shot in the ninth inning decided the game after Jacob deGrom held host Detroit to one run over six and two-thirds innings.
2016-08-08.snippet: Walker’s two-run shot in the ninth inning decided the game after Jacob deGrom held host Detroit to one run over six and two-thirds innings.
2016-08-08.lead_paragraph: DETROIT — Neil Walker had someplace to go Sunday afternoon. His wife, Niki, is expected to deliver their first child next week, and Walker needed to drive about four and a half hours to spend Monday’s day off with her at their home near Pittsburgh.
2016-08-08.headline_main: Neil Walker and Michael Conforto Homer as Mets Top Tigers

2016-08-08.abstract: As Donald J. Trump continues his stream of outrageous and disquieting statements, journalists must grapple with how to cover him — and if, or when, to abandon the rules of traditional reporting.
2016-08-08.snippet: As Donald J. Trump continues his stream of outrageous and disquieting statements, journalists must grapple with how to cover him — and if, or when, to abandon the rules of traditional reporting.
2016-08-08.lead_paragraph: If you’re a working journalist and you believe that Donald J. Trump is a demagogue playing to the nation’s worst racist and nationalistic tendencies, that he cozies up to anti-American dictators and that he would be dangerous with control of the United States nuclear codes, how the heck are you supposed to cover him?
2016-08-08.headline_main: Trump Is Testing the Norms of Objectivity in Journalism

2016-08-08.abstract: President Obama still can and should take steps to advance his vision of a safer world.
2016-08-08.snippet: President Obama still can and should take steps to advance his vision of a safer world.
2016-08-08.lead_paragraph: The Air Force has formally begun the process of asking defense contractors to submit proposals for a new long-range cruise missile and a new land-based intercontinental ballistic missile. These two weapons, capable of carrying nuclear payloads, will cost billions of dollars. The first is unnecessary; the second, debatable.
2016-08-08.headline_main: A Nuclear Legacy Within Reach

2016-08-08.abstract: The emperor spoke publicly for the first time about retiring, saying he feared it would become “more difficult” to fulfill his duties.
2016-08-08.snippet: The emperor spoke publicly for the first time about retiring, saying he feared it would become “more difficult” to fulfill his duties.
2016-08-08.lead_paragraph: TOKYO — The Japanese have acknowledged that their emperor is not a god and he has been stripped of all political power, but the nation still views its monarch as so central to the sense of identity that he is not permitted to resign.
2016-08-08.headline_main: At 82, Emperor Akihito of Japan Wants to Retire. Will Japan Let Him?

2016-08-08.abstract: Dr. Pitanguy established himself in Brazil as one of the world’s most famous plastic surgeons, as much through his marketing savvy as through his surgical skills.
2016-08-08.snippet: Dr. Pitanguy established himself in Brazil as one of the world’s most famous plastic surgeons, as much through his marketing savvy as through his surgical skills.
2016-08-08.lead_paragraph: Dr. Ivo Pitanguy, a pioneering Brazilian plastic surgeon who performed face lifts, tummy tucks and other procedures on the rich, famous and royal, becoming rich, famous and celebrated in his own right, died on Saturday at his home in Rio de Janeiro. He was 93.
2016-08-08.headline_main: Ivo Pitanguy, Plastic Surgeon to the Stars and a Celebrity Himself, Dies at 93

2016-08-08.abstract: As the head of a Chamber of Commerce, Mr. Tiber, an unlikely counterculture hero, offered a home for the music festival. He wrote two memoirs.
2016-08-08.snippet: As the head of a Chamber of Commerce, Mr. Tiber, an unlikely counterculture hero, offered a home for the music festival. He wrote two memoirs.
2016-08-08.lead_paragraph: In July 1969, the town of Wallkill, N.Y., dealt a potentially mortal blow to Woodstock Ventures, a group of rookie promoters hoping to organize a grand festival of rock music in rural New York.
2016-08-08.headline_main: Elliot Tiber, Who With a Permit Brought Forth Woodstock, Dies at 81

2016-08-08.abstract: There have been hints of Naz’s hardening resolve, but we are suddenly confronted with the thought that our hero may not be innocent after all.
2016-08-08.snippet: There have been hints of Naz’s hardening resolve, but we are suddenly confronted with the thought that our hero may not be innocent after all.
2016-08-08.lead_paragraph: In Jacques Audiard’s superb 2009 thriller “A Prophet,” a French teenager of Algerian descent begins serving a six-year sentence for attacking police officers, but quickly discovers that he has no allies in prison. Needing protection in order to survive, he carries out a soul-coarsening atrocity on behalf of a Corsican mob boss who runs a criminal operation within the prison walls. By committing this heinous act of violence, however, he crosses a moral Rubicon that forever changes him and the audience follows his transformation into a vicious, calculating gangster. He enters prison a lamb and leaves a lion.
2016-08-08.headline_main: ‘The Night Of’ Season 1, Episode 5: Seeing Naz in a New Light

2016-08-08.abstract: Uneasy relationships feature in the three one-act plays in Series B of this 59E59 Theaters festival.
2016-08-08.snippet: Uneasy relationships feature in the three one-act plays in Series B of this 59E59 Theaters festival.
2016-08-08.lead_paragraph: By the time things turn dizzily theatrical, in a noir-style romp called “The Dark Clothes of Night,” the audience is well primed. This delicious little play, by Richard Alfredo, is the third of three one-acts in Series B of this year’s Summer Shorts festival at 59E59 Theaters, and it’s the first that feels unmistakably like a work for the stage — dressed up though it is as a love letter to classic cinema.
2016-08-08.headline_main: Review: A Femme Fatale, a Private Eye and Dorm Mates, at Summer Shorts

2016-08-08.abstract: On Sunday, Rodriguez announced that Friday would be his final game with the Yankees, closing a career that has made fans awe at his ability and criticize his actions.
2016-08-08.snippet: On Sunday, Rodriguez announced that Friday would be his final game with the Yankees, closing a career that has made fans awe at his ability and criticize his actions.
2016-08-08.lead_paragraph: In the moments after Alex Rodriguez announced that Friday would be the end of his turbulent yet stellar playing career, fans outside Yankee Stadium on Sunday cheered for different reasons — some in relief, and others in solidarity with a player they will always consider one of the greats.
2016-08-08.headline_main: As Alex Rodriguez Prepares to Retire, Fans Grapple With a Complicated Legacy

2016-08-08.abstract: Another day, another milestone for Katie Ledecky, who won her second medal, and first gold, of the Rio Games on Sunday night in the 400-meter freestyle.
2016-08-08.snippet: Another day, another milestone for Katie Ledecky, who won her second medal, and first gold, of the Rio Games on Sunday night in the 400-meter freestyle.
2016-08-08.lead_paragraph: After finishing, having roared through the last 50 meters of the 400-meter freestyle at a sprinter’s pace, Katie Ledecky turned around to see the scoreboard. It told her what she surely already knew: she had won gold, her first of the Rio Games, and she had crushed her own world record.
2016-08-08.headline_main: Katie Ledecky Smashes Her Own World Record in 400 Freestyle

2016-08-08.abstract: The Williams sisters were also eliminated early at the Olympic Games.
2016-08-08.snippet: The Williams sisters were also eliminated early at the Olympic Games.
2016-08-08.lead_paragraph: RIO DE JANEIRO — Novak Djokovic, the world’s dominant tennis player, had made the Olympic gold medal in singles one of his big priorities for 2016.
2016-08-08.headline_main: Novak Djokovic Upset in First Round by Juan Martín del Potro

2016-08-08.abstract: After a series of clashes with preservationists, the Roman Catholic Diocese of Brooklyn filed an application to demolish a church built in 1908 by Italian immigrants.
2016-08-08.snippet: After a series of clashes with preservationists, the Roman Catholic Diocese of Brooklyn filed an application to demolish a church built in 1908 by Italian immigrants.
2016-08-08.lead_paragraph: A seven-year battle between preservationists and the Roman Catholic Diocese of Brooklyn over the fate of a church more than a century old will likely end with the arrival of a wrecking ball.
2016-08-08.headline_main: Brooklyn Church, Over a Century Old, Likely to Make Way for Affordable Housing

2016-08-08.abstract: Far fewer cases in recent decades are going to jury trials, as prosecutors are increasingly negotiating plea deals, a trend that some say disrupts a foundation of the American justice system.
2016-08-08.snippet: Far fewer cases in recent decades are going to jury trials, as prosecutors are increasingly negotiating plea deals, a trend that some say disrupts a foundation of the American justice system.
2016-08-08.lead_paragraph: The criminal trial ended more than two and a half years ago, but Judge Jesse M. Furman can still vividly recall the case. It stands out, not because of the defendant or the subject matter, but because of its rarity: In his four-plus years on the bench in Federal District Court in Manhattan, it was his only criminal jury trial.
2016-08-08.headline_main: Trial by Jury, a Hallowed American Right, Is Vanishing

2016-08-08.abstract: On the second full day of events at the 2016 Summer Games in Rio de Janeiro, foils flashed, water splashed, bodies crashed and horses dashed.
2016-08-08.snippet: On the second full day of events at the 2016 Summer Games in Rio de Janeiro, foils flashed, water splashed, bodies crashed and horses dashed.
2016-08-08.lead_paragraph: On the second full day of events at the 2016 Summer Games in Rio de Janeiro, foils flashed, water splashed, bodies crashed and horses dashed.
2016-08-08.headline_main: Competition, in a Swirl of Color

2016-08-08.abstract: Quotation of the day for Monday, August 8, 2016.
2016-08-08.snippet: Quotation of the day for Monday, August 8, 2016.
2016-08-08.lead_paragraph: “It’s hugely disappointing. A trial is the one place where the system really gets tested. Everything else is done behind closed doors.”
2016-08-08.headline_main: Quotation of the Day

2016-08-08.abstract: At 19, Biles is considered the best female gymnast in history, but she still looks up to Kohei Uchimura, 27.
2016-08-08.snippet: At 19, Biles is considered the best female gymnast in history, but she still looks up to Kohei Uchimura, 27.
2016-08-08.lead_paragraph: RIO DE JANEIRO — In the hours before the preliminary round of Olympic gymnastics, members of the United States women’s team were at the cafeteria in the athletes’ village, goofing around. Telling jokes. Making funny faces. Laughing so hard that Martha Karolyi, the women’s national team coordinator, approached Aly Raisman, the team captain, to tell them to quiet down.
2016-08-08.headline_main: Simone Biles Has Just One Peer in Rio, but Rejects the Comparison

2016-08-08.abstract: Phelps won his 23rd Olympic medal over all for the United States, extending his record.
2016-08-08.snippet: Phelps won his 23rd Olympic medal over all for the United States, extending his record.
2016-08-08.lead_paragraph: RIO DE JANEIRO — Michael Phelps won his 19th Olympic gold medal as the United States won the 4x100 relay at the Olympics on Sunday. The Americans’ traditional rival in the event, France, was second, and Australia third.
2016-08-08.headline_main: Michael Phelps Powers U.S. to Victory in 4x100 Relay, Winning a 19th Gold

2016-08-08.abstract: An official called the government-coordinated cover-up of doping among Russia’s top disabled athletes “abominable.”
2016-08-08.snippet: An official called the government-coordinated cover-up of doping among Russia’s top disabled athletes “abominable.”
2016-08-08.lead_paragraph: RIO DE JANEIRO — Paralympics officials have done what Olympics officials chose not to do, barring all Russian athletes from their Games after an elaborate cheating scheme.
2016-08-08.headline_main: Russia Not Allowed to Compete in Paralympics

2016-08-08.abstract: “Hitchcock/Truffaut” looks back at the directors’ 1962 meeting of the minds. And Michael Phelps swims the 200-meter butterfly at the Rio Olympics.
2016-08-08.snippet: “Hitchcock/Truffaut” looks back at the directors’ 1962 meeting of the minds. And Michael Phelps swims the 200-meter butterfly at the Rio Olympics.
2016-08-08.lead_paragraph: “Hitchcock/Truffaut” recalls the directors’ 1962 meeting of the minds. Michael Phelps swims a signature event, the 200-meter butterfly, at the Rio Olympics. And Michael Shannon glowers as an outlaw on the lam with an unusual child in “Midnight Special.”
2016-08-08.headline_main: What’s on TV Monday: ‘Hitchcock/Truffaut’ and Michael Phelps at the Rio Olympics

2016-08-08.abstract: Record-breaking rains in the eastern states of Puebla and Veracruz caused landslides heavy enough to bury entire homes, the government said.
2016-08-08.snippet: Record-breaking rains in the eastern states of Puebla and Veracruz caused landslides heavy enough to bury entire homes, the government said.
2016-08-08.lead_paragraph: MEXICO CITY — At least 39 people have died in Mexico after a series of landslides caused by torrential rains from Tropical Storm Earl, government officials said, as the country braced for the arrival of another tropical storm.
2016-08-08.headline_main: Landslides in Mexico Kill at Least 39 After Rains From Tropical Storm Earl

2016-08-08.abstract: The oldest continuous monarchy in the world, extending back to 600 B.C., has had an unbroken hereditary line of 125 emperors.
2016-08-08.snippet: The oldest continuous monarchy in the world, extending back to 600 B.C., has had an unbroken hereditary line of 125 emperors.
2016-08-08.lead_paragraph: Emperor Akihito of Japan indicated in a rare public address on Monday that he wants to abdicate the throne, which would make him the first Japanese monarch in 200 years to step down. Here are five essential facts about one of the world’s oldest and most cloistered royal families.
2016-08-08.headline_main: 5 Things to Know About Japan’s Emperor and Imperial Family

2016-08-08.lead_paragraph: To the Editor:

2016-08-08.snippet: A reader recalls a sign on a dentist’s lawn.
2016-08-08.lead_paragraph: To the Editor:
2016-08-08.headline_main: To Floss, or Not?

2016-08-08.abstract: The departing police commissioner William J. Bratton brought important innovations to New York. But the time has come to try new ideas.
2016-08-08.snippet: The departing police commissioner William J. Bratton brought important innovations to New York. But the time has come to try new ideas.
2016-08-08.lead_paragraph: WITH the impending departure of William J. Bratton as commissioner of the New York Police Department, an important chapter in American policing is about to close. Mr. Bratton — with whom I have collaborated in a Harvard program on police reform — has served with distinction as commissioner in Boston, Los Angeles and twice in New York, the nation’s largest department and a trendsetter in the profession. Not surprisingly, police chiefs across the country are watching the Police Department closely to see whether, and how, it moves beyond Mr. Bratton’s policies.
2016-08-08.headline_main: Moving Beyond Bratton

2016-08-08.abstract: Gov. Jay Nixon of Missouri, by slashing the budget for public defenders, has turned a blind eye to a pressing need in his state.
2016-08-08.snippet: Gov. Jay Nixon of Missouri, by slashing the budget for public defenders, has turned a blind eye to a pressing need in his state.
2016-08-08.lead_paragraph: Considering the hard-pressed criminal justice system of Missouri — a crisis laid bare by the police shooting and civil unrest in Ferguson in 2014 — the last thing Gov. Jay Nixon should be doing is stinting on support of the state public defender system, which provides counsel to indigent defendants.
2016-08-08.headline_main: A Message to a Stingy Governor

2016-08-08.abstract: Voters expect a president to improve their lives, but the cause of anxiety follows trends that are decades in the making.
2016-08-08.snippet: Voters expect a president to improve their lives, but the cause of anxiety follows trends that are decades in the making.
2016-08-08.lead_paragraph: The party conventions were rightly characterized as either relentlessly downbeat (Republican) or fervently optimistic (Democratic). The Republican view rests in part on poll numbers that show a solid majority of Americans think that the country is headed in the wrong direction. What has caused this malaise?
2016-08-08.headline_main: Can Clinton or Trump Recapture Robust American Growth?

2016-08-08.abstract: The overwhelming case for deficit spending.
2016-08-08.snippet: The overwhelming case for deficit spending.
2016-08-08.lead_paragraph: The campaign still has three ugly months to go, but the odds — 83 percent odds, according to the New York Times’s model — are that it will end with the election of a sane, sensible president. So what should she do to boost America’s economy, which is doing better than most of the world but is still falling far short of where it should be?
2016-08-08.headline_main: Time to Borrow

2016-08-08.abstract: Rich nations need to make good on their pledges, particularly to low-lying island nations whose very existence is threatened.
2016-08-08.snippet: Rich nations need to make good on their pledges, particularly to low-lying island nations whose very existence is threatened.
2016-08-08.lead_paragraph: The National Oceanic and Atmospheric Administration reported last week that global temperatures last year were the highest on record — and that this year is likely to be hotter still. That is a powerful reason for rich countries to begin making good on their promises to help low-lying island nations, some of the poorest countries in the world, build their defenses against the disastrous effects of climate change, which some are already experiencing.
2016-08-08.headline_main: Many Countries Will Need Help Adapting to Climate Change

2016-08-08.abstract: Signs of Republican decline, even in the Deep South.
2016-08-08.snippet: Signs of Republican decline, even in the Deep South.
2016-08-08.lead_paragraph: There has been much talk this election about the fundamental transformation of voters in the Rust Belt and what that portends for Hillary Clinton and Donald Trump.
2016-08-08.headline_main: Trump’s Troubles in the Black Belt

2016-08-08.abstract: The D.N.C. emails were in the public interest but they also show how reckless and agenda-driven WikiLeaks has become.
2016-08-08.snippet: The D.N.C. emails were in the public interest but they also show how reckless and agenda-driven WikiLeaks has become.
2016-08-08.lead_paragraph: The release of a cache of emails from the Democratic National Committee by WikiLeaks last month has raised a great many questions — about the role of the D.N.C. in trying to influence the primary and about the alleged interference of Russian intelligence in an American election.
2016-08-08.headline_main: Can We Trust Julian Assange and WikiLeaks?

2016-08-08.abstract: Doctors discuss the promise of immunotherapy but worry about giving false hope; a cancer patient believes the treatment helped save his life.
2016-08-08.snippet: Doctors discuss the promise of immunotherapy but worry about giving false hope; a cancer patient believes the treatment helped save his life.
2016-08-08.lead_paragraph: To the Editor:
2016-08-08.headline_main: New Approaches to Fighting Cancer

2016-08-08.abstract: The truth is we “sustain” nature to preserve the resources needed for our own consumption.
2016-08-08.snippet: The truth is we “sustain” nature to preserve the resources needed for our own consumption.
2016-08-08.lead_paragraph: Among the many stories that can be told about the origins of the environmental movement in the West, perhaps the most common is that it began with the emergence of Romanticism in the late 18th century. In this version, environmentalism was born as the good twin to evil industrialization. Today, when we talk about ecological sustainability and environmental preservation, we typically still understand them in terms of a battle between nature and industry.
2016-08-08.headline_main: Against ‘Sustainability’

2016-08-08.abstract: On what is likely the most diverse college campus in the United States, Muslim women who wear a hijab talk about their lives.
2016-08-08.snippet: On what is likely the most diverse college campus in the United States, Muslim women who wear a hijab talk about their lives.
2016-08-08.lead_paragraph: To set foot on the campus of Rutgers University, Newark, is to witness a majority-minority census in three dimensions. Brown, black, beige and every shade in between, the university’s population is robust with first-generation Americans redefining attitudes about race, interfaith dialogue and national identity. Those features have led it to be ranked by U.S. News and World Report as the most diverse campus in the United States.
2016-08-08.headline_main: Listening to the Voices From Hijabi World

2016-08-08.abstract: Borders dating to the 12th century carve Baarle into a crazy patchwork, splitting sidewalks, shops and houses between Belgium and the Netherlands.
2016-08-08.snippet: Borders dating to the 12th century carve Baarle into a crazy patchwork, splitting sidewalks, shops and houses between Belgium and the Netherlands.
2016-08-08.lead_paragraph: At De Biergrens beer shop, you can walk in from the Netherlands through one door and walk out into Belgium through another. There are two telephones, one connected to the Belgian telecom system and one plugged into the Dutch. There are even two cash registers, at opposite ends of the shop — one in each country.
2016-08-08.headline_main: Put One Foot Wrong in This Town and You’ve Left the Country

2016-08-08.snippet: Terry F. Kleeman has published the first book in a Western language on the founding of Taoism as a formal religion, rooted in earlier philosophical texts.
2016-08-08.lead_paragraph: Terry F. Kleeman is a leading scholar of the early texts and history of China’s only indigenous religion, Taoism. A professor of religious studies at the University of Colorado, Boulder, he is the author of the recently published “Celestial Masters: History and Ritual in Early Daoist Communities.” This is the first work in any Western language on the founding of Taoism as a formal religious movement, rooted in earlier philosophical teachings like the Tao Te Ching, also known as the Daodejing and sometimes translated as “The Way and Its Power.”
2016-08-08.headline_main: Reconstructing Taoism’s Transformation in China

2016-08-08.abstract: At the Brooklyn Museum since 1898, it is restored and on display in Boston and Washington, D.C.
2016-08-08.snippet: At the Brooklyn Museum since 1898, it is restored and on display in Boston and Washington, D.C.
2016-08-08.lead_paragraph: The Antinoris of Florence, Italy, have been in the wine business in Tuscany since the 14th century and can trace their lineage back even further. As testimony to their importance during the Renaissance, a massive glazed terra-cotta relief, “The Resurrection of Christ,” by Giovanni della Robbia, dating from around 1524 and commissioned by the Antinoris, is a highlight of an exhibition of della Robbia works at the Museum of Fine Arts in Boston. The relief, in a half-moon shape, was created for the entrance to one of the family’s properties and includes the Antinori crest, designed by della Robbia. Since 1898 it has been in the Brooklyn Museum. The Antinoris contributed to the restoration of the work: “Della Robbia: Sculpting With Color in Renaissance Florence,” Museum of Fine Arts, Boston, to Dec. 4; National Gallery of Art, Washington, Feb. 4 to June 4, 2017.
2016-08-08.headline_main: The Import of the Antinori Wine Family in a Terra Cotta Relief

The views are stunning; the menu is simple: hummus, spring rolls, a lobster roll or a chicken sandwich, with wine, cocktails, beer and iced tea: The Terrace, Saks Fifth Avenue, eighth floor, 212-940-4080, cafesfa.com.
2016-08-08.headline_main: A Restaurant With a Terrace Off the Saks Shoe Department

2016-08-08.abstract: Called Spin Sauce, it nods to mayonnaise and comes in a spicier version, too.
2016-08-08.snippet: Called Spin Sauce, it nods to mayonnaise and comes in a spicier version, too.
2016-08-08.lead_paragraph: The condiment of choice for chicken or meat at halal street carts is a thick drizzle that’s simply called white sauce. Jamal Rasoully, whose parents fled Afghanistan about 30 years ago and opened a restaurant in New York, said that they made such a sauce based on an old Pashtun recipe. Now, Mr. Rasoully has bottled the condiment, calling it Spin Sauce. The traditional sauce is yogurt-based, but this one has mayonnaise written all over it and certainly delivers all-purpose potential. There’s a spicier version and a fierce cayenne hot sauce, too: Spin Sauce, $11.99 for three 12-ounce bottles, spinsauce.com.
2016-08-08.headline_main: From the Halal Street Carts, That White Sauce Drizzled on Everything

2016-08-08.abstract: Bottaraga, an Italian delicacy, can be sliced, shaved or grated and has a long shelf life.
2016-08-08.snippet: Bottaraga, an Italian delicacy, can be sliced, shaved or grated and has a long shelf life.
2016-08-08.lead_paragraph: The delicacy bottarga is cured roe, usually from fish like mullet. In thin slices or grated, it’s used to season and bring umami to pasta and other dishes. Most bottarga is a fisherman’s afterthought, coming from parts of the catch that otherwise may be discarded. But Marc Slakmon, who learned to make it from his Tunisian grandmothers, has teamed up with a Florida fisherman who is catching gray mullet in the Gulf of Mexico. Their company, Dell’Isola Foods, produces Bottarga Dell’Isola, and chefs are praising its quality. It is rich, briny and pleasantly funky with an excellent consistency for slicing, shaving or grating: Bottarga Dell’Isola, $32 to $118 whole, depending on the size; $25 for a two-ounce jar of grated; bottargadellisola.com.
2016-08-08.headline_main: Cured Roe From Gray Mullet Caught in the Gulf of Mexico

2016-08-08.abstract: A mild Swiss-Style Apine cheese called Little Mountain took top honors.
2016-08-08.snippet: A mild Swiss-Style Apine cheese called Little Mountain took top honors.
2016-08-08.lead_paragraph: At the recent annual meeting of the American Cheese Society in Des Moines, five best-in-show winners were named. First place went to Little Mountain, a mild yet complex Swiss-style Alpine cheese from the Roelli Cheese Company in Shullsburg, Wis. Second was a tie: St. Malachi Reserve, another Alpine cheese, with deep, almost caramel notes from the Farm at Doe Run in Coatesville, Pa., and Buff Blue, a deliciously buttery water-buffalo-milk blue cheese from Bleating Heart Cheese in Tomales, Calif. In third place was another tie, this one between Greensward, a silky, intense Vacherin-style cheese made by the Cellars at Jasper Hill and cave-finished by Murray’s Cheese in New York, and Jeff’s Select Gouda, a well-made classic from the Caves of Faribault in Faribault, Minn.: roellicheese.com, facebook.com/thefarmatdoerun, bleatingheart.com, murrayscheese.com, faribaultdairy.com.
2016-08-08.headline_main: 5 Best in Show Winners From the American Cheese Society

2016-08-08.lead_paragraph: The Governor of the Bank of England, Sir William Lidderdale, has consented to make a statement to the public through the Herald, in consequence of the alarming stories in America and on the Continent, to the effect that a general financial crash is near at hand, and that the British banks are afraid to let the full situation be known, for fear it would precipitate a panic throughout the world.

2016-08-08.abstract: Try these Olympics-themed puzzles from Po-Shen Loh, team lead for Team U.S.A, winner of this year’s International Mathematical Olympiad. Also — If you could train with the best, would you? Perspectives from Olympians Gwen Jorgensen and Clark Burckle.
2016-08-08.snippet: Try these Olympics-themed puzzles from Po-Shen Loh, team lead for Team U.S.A, winner of this year’s International Mathematical Olympiad. Also — If you could train with the best, would you? Perspectives from Olympians Gwen Jorgensen and Clark Burck...
2016-08-08.lead_paragraph: The 2016 Rio Olympics have begun, unleashing Hungarian swimmer Katinka Hosszu, American shooter Ginny Thrasher, and a whole pack of Brazilian gymnasts. I’ve enjoyed the Times’ coverage, including the Interactive Stories series and the SMS experiment. It was also a nice surprise to find Karen Crouse’s story about Bruce Gemmell, an old college teammate of mine and current coach of swimmer Katie Ledecky. I’ve spent as much time immersed in water as enveloped by math problems, and it’s good to see so many friends and fast swims down in Rio. (Well done with the flag, MP!)
2016-08-08.headline_main: Olympic Strategies, Part 1

2016-08-08.lead_paragraph: “There is no one who has not smiled at least once,” writes Marianne LaFrance, a Yale University psychology professor, in her 2011 book “Lip Service: Smiles in Life, Death, Trust, Lies, Work, Memory, Sex and Politics.” Her book explores how smiling unifies us. Like breath, the smile is universal. We smile to connect, to forgive, to love. A smile is beauty, human.
