2016-08-16.abstract: A new book features Ted Williams’s photos of the jazz world, a record of a life spent listening through his camera.
2016-08-16.snippet: A new book features Ted Williams’s photos of the jazz world, a record of a life spent listening through his camera.
2016-08-16.lead_paragraph: A new book features Ted Williams’s photos of the jazz world, a record of a life spent listening through his camera.
2016-08-16.headline_main: Hearing Music in Photos of Jazz Giants

2016-08-16.abstract: A new book features Ted Williams’s photos of the jazz world, a record of a life spent listening through his camera.
2016-08-16.snippet: A new book features Ted Williams’s photos of the jazz world, a record of a life spent listening through his camera.
2016-08-16.lead_paragraph: A good jazz photograph tells its story musically as much as visually. More than images of rock, classical or hip-hop musicians, jazz images, like those of Ted Williams, who studied saxophone and clarinet before picking up the camera after World War II, seem to capture the intangible essence of a thought being transformed into sound.
2016-08-16.headline_main: Hearing Music in Photos of Jazz Giants

2016-08-16.abstract: Is David Duke racist? Obama? Trump? Beyoncé? Ever since we decided racism was a character flaw, not an institutional one, it became easier to toss the charge around — and harder to make it stick.
2016-08-16.snippet: Is David Duke racist? Obama? Trump? Beyoncé? Ever since we decided racism was a character flaw, not an institutional one, it became easier to toss the charge around — and harder to make it stick.
2016-08-16.lead_paragraph: On its face, inviting a former grand wizard of the Ku Klux Klan onto your radio show is a risky proposition with very little upside. The situation gets even more precarious when you’re inviting this ex-wizard to dole out opinions on race. But these are wild times we’re living in, which is why David Duke — who has emerged as a top cheerleader for the Republican presidential nominee, Donald J. Trump — appeared on N.P.R.’s “Morning Edition” two weeks ago and defended the candidate from charges of racism.
2016-08-16.headline_main: The Easiest Way to Get Rid of Racism? Just Redefine It.

2016-08-16.abstract: On long-haul flights, Delta is introducing all-suite business class (complete with sliding doors).
2016-08-16.snippet: On long-haul flights, Delta is introducing all-suite business class (complete with sliding doors).
2016-08-16.lead_paragraph: Suites in the skies — airline seats with doors that slide shut to give passengers total privacy — have become de rigueur in international first class: Emirates and Singapore Airlines are two of the carriers that offer them on long-haul flights. But an all-suite business class? It has yet to be heard of, according to Delta Air Lines, and the carrier wants to be the first in the industry to change that with the fall 2017 debut of the Delta One suite in its Delta One business-class category.
2016-08-16.headline_main: On Delta, All-Suite Business Class Flights

2016-08-16.abstract: The former congressman on if Donald Trump Jr. ran for mayor of New York, life after the documentary and what, exactly, he’s up to now.
2016-08-16.snippet: The former congressman on if Donald Trump Jr. ran for mayor of New York, life after the documentary and what, exactly, he’s up to now.
2016-08-16.lead_paragraph: What is your job now? I don’t have one, really. I’ve got a consulting company with a handful of clients — a couple of nonprofits, a universe of businesses and executives whose instincts are good. Sometimes they just want to kibitz.
2016-08-16.headline_main: Anthony Weiner Thinks He’s Pretty Good at Giving Advice

2016-08-16.abstract: Marc Edwards took up the cause of water activists in Michigan a year ago — and earned their trust. Now he’s fighting to keep it.
2016-08-16.snippet: Marc Edwards took up the cause of water activists in Michigan a year ago — and earned their trust. Now he’s fighting to keep it.
2016-08-16.lead_paragraph: Near the railroad tracks on the outskirts of Flint, Mich., there is an old pump house, the walls of which have long served as a kind of communal billboard. The Block, people call it. People paint messages there — birthday wishes, memorials for the dead. In January, after Gov. Rick Snyder declared a state of emergency in response to Flint’s water crisis, a new message appeared, addressed implicitly to Snyder but also to the world: YOU WANT OUR TRUST??? WE WANT VA TECH!!! In the history of political graffiti, “We want Va. Tech” may sound like one of the least stirring demands ever spray-­painted on a wall, but in the context of Flint, it was charged with the emotion and meaning of a rallying cry.
2016-08-16.headline_main: Flint’s Water Crisis and the ‘Troublemaker’ Scientist

2016-08-16.abstract: Productions of “Jesus Christ Superstar,” “The Threepenny Opera,” “Show Boat” and “Guys and Dolls” are fun and fresh diversions.
2016-08-16.snippet: Productions of “Jesus Christ Superstar,” “The Threepenny Opera,” “Show Boat” and “Guys and Dolls” are fun and fresh diversions.
2016-08-16.lead_paragraph: LONDON — When you’re approaching a monumental landmark, it’s usually a good idea to leave the awe at home. That would seem to be the attitude of the creative teams behind four disarmingly relaxed and very enjoyable revivals of watershed musicals here this summer. They are shows that in their original incarnations caused such excitement that ever after they have inspired trepidation, agitation and extreme self-consciousness among those who revisit them.
2016-08-16.headline_main: Summertime, and the Revivals in London are Breezy

2016-08-16.abstract: From the Statue of Liberty to Stonehenge, tips on how to visit bucket-list sites without getting dazed and confused.
2016-08-16.snippet: From the Statue of Liberty to Stonehenge, tips on how to visit bucket-list sites without getting dazed and confused.
2016-08-16.lead_paragraph: If you’re visiting Florence, Italy, you’ve got to see the world-famous Uffizi Gallery. But why? Because that’s what one does in Florence? Because you feel compelled to post a selfie in front of Botticelli’s “Birth of Venus”?
2016-08-16.headline_main: How to Get the Most out of Visiting World-Famous Sites

2016-08-16.abstract: Trump advisers say there are nearly three months to counter Hillary Clinton’s vast operation and get Mr. Trump on message. But voting starts in less than six weeks.
2016-08-16.snippet: Trump advisers say there are nearly three months to counter Hillary Clinton’s vast operation and get Mr. Trump on message. But voting starts in less than six weeks.
2016-08-16.lead_paragraph: Advisers to Donald J. Trump keep reassuring Republicans that there is still plenty of time to rescue his candidacy — nearly three months to counter Hillary Clinton’s vast operation in swing states and get Mr. Trump on message.
2016-08-16.headline_main: Early Voting Limits Donald Trump’s Time to Turn Campaign Around

2016-08-16.abstract: The country has magazines devoted to bell ringing, there are bell-ringing societies at universities with their own coats of arms, and there’s even a national council.
2016-08-16.snippet: The country has magazines devoted to bell ringing, there are bell-ringing societies at universities with their own coats of arms, and there’s even a national council.
2016-08-16.lead_paragraph: Some Britons love ringing church bells so much that they think it ought to be an Olympic sport.
2016-08-16.headline_main: Britain’s Church Bell Ringers Don’t Limit Themselves to Sunday Services

2016-08-16.snippet: A presentation at a trade group meeting showed that coal companies were seeing comparisons that environmentalists typically make.
2016-08-16.lead_paragraph: Greg Zimmerman, an environmental activist, was scrolling through the website of a coal industry association when he came across a presentation that startled him: “Survival Is Victory: Lessons From the Tobacco Wars.”
2016-08-16.headline_main: Feeling Cornered, Coal Industry Borrows From Tobacco Playbook, Activists Say

2016-08-16.abstract: High-achieving students are enrolling to turbocharge grade-point averages or load up on advanced courses, but critics say the practice only adds to the inequities of the college admissions process.
2016-08-16.snippet: High-achieving students are enrolling to turbocharge grade-point averages or load up on advanced courses, but critics say the practice only adds to the inequities of the college admissions process.
2016-08-16.lead_paragraph: GILL, Mass. — Chase Pellegrini de Paur didn’t flunk math, and he is not trying to hone his study skills. The 15-year-old honor-roll student nevertheless spent six weeks this summer studying geometry at the prestigious Northfield Mount Hermon boarding school here.
2016-08-16.headline_main: Taking Summer School to Get Ahead, Not Catch Up

2016-08-16.abstract: Aggressive property seizures, apparently legal but surrounded by questions, have shaken the beach town of Tulum and stained its image.
2016-08-16.snippet: Aggressive property seizures, apparently legal but surrounded by questions, have shaken the beach town of Tulum and stained its image.
2016-08-16.lead_paragraph: TULUM, Mexico — By the time Renaud Jacquet arrived at his compound of rental beach villas, invaders were crawling all over the place.
2016-08-16.headline_main: Evictions by Armed Men Rattle a Mexican Tourist Paradise

2016-08-16.abstract: Millennials may pine for shows from the past, but that doesn’t mean they want to watch them on a television.
2016-08-16.snippet: Millennials may pine for shows from the past, but that doesn’t mean they want to watch them on a television.
2016-08-16.lead_paragraph: VH1 Classic is dead. This month, it was reborn as MTV Classic, a channel focusing on music videos and shows from the ’80s to the aughts. The nostalgia baton has officially been passed to the millennials.
2016-08-16.headline_main: MTV Classic Is Nostalgia for Millennials. But Do They Want TV?

2016-08-16.abstract: Like the opulent opera house in Manaus, which was built by rubber barons and fell into disuse, the costly Arena da Amazônia is providing little benefit.
2016-08-16.snippet: Like the opulent opera house in Manaus, which was built by rubber barons and fell into disuse, the costly Arena da Amazônia is providing little benefit.
2016-08-16.lead_paragraph: MANAUS, Brazil — Our tale takes metaphorical root in the early 1880s and the fevered imaginings of rubber barons. Sitting by the vast Amazon River, bewitched by pink river dolphins and torrential downpours, surrounded by rain forest, these men hungered for a legacy worthy of kings.
2016-08-16.headline_main: In the Brazilian Rain Forest, ‘a White Elephant, a Big One’

2016-08-16.abstract: New personal accounts show diverse experiences of growing up gay, from the ordeal of conversion therapy to an unexpectedly elite cultural education.
2016-08-16.snippet: New personal accounts show diverse experiences of growing up gay, from the ordeal of conversion therapy to an unexpectedly elite cultural education.
2016-08-16.lead_paragraph: BOY ERASED (Riverhead, $27), a memoir by the debut author Garrard Conley, recounts a hellish tutelage under John Smid, the director of a so-called ex-gay therapy group called Love in Action. The son of a Baptist preacher in a small, evangelical Ozarks community, Conley is outed and at 19 enters treatment at the program’s grim facility in Memphis, earnestly hoping to cure himself. With its penchant for whiteboards and workbooks, Love in Action has the flavor of a low-budget corporate retreat and all the hallmarks of a cult. “We had to be willing to undergo extreme changes,” Conley writes, “leave people behind who were harmful to our development, who reminded us of the past.”
2016-08-16.headline_main: ‘Inside My Head I’m a Girl’: Three Ways of Growing Up Gay

2016-08-16.abstract: Here’s what you need to know to start your day.
2016-08-16.snippet: Here’s what you need to know to start your day.

2016-08-16.abstract: It was not clear whether any high-level operatives had been eliminated in the assault, which took place last week.
2016-08-16.snippet: It was not clear whether any high-level operatives had been eliminated in the assault, which took place last week.
2016-08-16.lead_paragraph: NAIROBI, Kenya — United States forces assisted Somali commandos in killing several members of the Shabab militant group in an attack last week, an American military spokesman said on Tuesday, but it was not clear whether any high-level operatives had been eliminated.
2016-08-16.headline_main: Somali Forces, Backed by U.S., Kill Shabab Militants in Raid

2016-08-16.abstract: Why do people want the Olympics in their home city? It could all be a poisoned chalice, and some people are floating unconventional solutions for future host cities.
2016-08-16.snippet: Why do people want the Olympics in their home city? It could all be a poisoned chalice, and some people are floating unconventional solutions for future host cities.
2016-08-16.lead_paragraph: Why does anyone want the Olympics in their home city? The last time the Games were profitable was in Los Angeles in 1984 — that is more than 30 years ago. But for whatever reason, government officials, businessmen and bankers are in a bidding war for the 2024 Summer Games that could rival anything seen on Wall Street. Some are competing on costs, but potential losses are a major concern — is it all a poisoned chalice?
2016-08-16.headline_main: The Olympics, Where Winning Gold Can Mean Losing Billions

2016-08-16.abstract: Unless Donald Trump can change his approach for a general election audience, he may be left hoping for an external event.
2016-08-16.snippet: Unless Donald Trump can change his approach for a general election audience, he may be left hoping for an external event.

2016-08-16.abstract: Hong Kong’s young protesters return with a new demand: Independence from China.
2016-08-16.snippet: Hong Kong’s young protesters return with a new demand: Independence from China.
2016-08-16.lead_paragraph: HONG KONG — The run-up to the Sept. 4 election for Legislative Council is getting tense, and the governments of both Hong Kong and Beijing are watching with keen interest. For the first time, a crop of fresh-faced candidates who cut their political teeth during the pro-democracy Umbrella Movement in 2014 are hoping to bring to the lawmaking body their battle to emancipate Hong Kong from Beijing’s increasingly authoritarian control.
2016-08-16.headline_main: The Umbrella Movement Fights Back

2016-08-16.abstract: A new wave of analysts wants to do away with contrived narratives. But if not for the stories, why watch?
2016-08-16.snippet: A new wave of analysts wants to do away with contrived narratives. But if not for the stories, why watch?
2016-08-16.lead_paragraph: The modern N.B.A. era began in the 1980s with two made-to-order if only half-true narratives. The rivalry between Larry Bird and Magic Johnson was transmitted to the public through sportswriters who typecast Bird as the white country bumpkin who gritted his way to excellence and Johnson as the black, always-smiling savant who whipped up his God-given talents into the best show on the hardwood. The cities of Boston (parochial and solemn) and Los Angeles (flashy and morally suspect) were featured in supporting roles that echoed the best and worst traits of the main characters. The reality behind “Bird versus Magic” was mostly irrelevant. What mattered was that the choice you were supposed to make between them was laid out as simple-mindedly as possible.
2016-08-16.headline_main: How Do You Tell a Better Story in Sports?

2016-08-16.abstract: The suit had claimed religious discrimination because the Motor Vehicle Commission had approved a plate that said, “BAPTIST.”
2016-08-16.snippet: The suit had claimed religious discrimination because the Motor Vehicle Commission had approved a plate that said, “BAPTIST.”
2016-08-16.lead_paragraph: Drivers in New Jersey will be able to request vanity license plates that reference their belief in atheism after the state’s Motor Vehicle Commission settled a lawsuit this month filed by a woman whose request for a license plate that said “8THEIST” was rejected almost three years ago.
2016-08-16.headline_main: After Lawsuit, New Jersey Allows Driver to Get ‘8THEIST’ License Plate

2016-08-16.headline_main: Stranded Indian Elephant Dies of Heart Attack, Ending a Wretched Journey

2016-08-16.abstract: How did Hillary Clinton lose Americans’ trust? Stanley Greenberg, a top Democratic campaign strategist, describes how he addressed the trust issue for another Clinton: Bill. We also speak with Lissa CQ Muscatine, a longtime adviser for Hillary Clinton, and Mark Landler, a White House correspondent for The Times.
2016-08-16.snippet: How did Hillary Clinton lose Americans’ trust? Stanley Greenberg, a top Democratic campaign strategist, describes how he addressed the trust issue for another Clinton: Bill. We also speak with Lissa CQ Muscatine, a longtime adviser for Hillary Cli...
2016-08-16.lead_paragraph: How did Hillary Clinton lose Americans’ trust? Stanley Greenberg, a top Democratic campaign strategist, describes how he addressed the trust issue for another Clinton: Bill. We also speak with Lissa CQ Muscatine, a longtime adviser for Hillary Clinton, and Mark Landler, a White House correspondent for The Times.
2016-08-16.headline_main: Why She’s Distrusted

2016-08-16.abstract: Has Hillary Clinton uttered untruths? Yes. But the perception that she is dishonest is about a confluence of mistakes, a marriage and partisanship.
2016-08-16.snippet: Has Hillary Clinton uttered untruths? Yes. But the perception that she is dishonest is about a confluence of mistakes, a marriage and partisanship.
2016-08-16.lead_paragraph: A Clinton with a trust problem. We’ve seen that before. It was 1992, and doubts about Bill Clinton’s integrity, stoked by his marital infidelities and avoidance of the Vietnam War, were the biggest threat to his presidential campaign. Stanley Greenberg, a top Democratic campaign strategist, devised a secret plan to turn around the candidate’s reputation for dishonesty.
2016-08-16.headline_main: Americans Don’t Trust Her. But Why?

2016-08-16.abstract: Six of the Japanese ultra-Pop artist’s “infinity mirror” rooms and other works will be on view starting next year.
2016-08-16.snippet: Six of the Japanese ultra-Pop artist’s “infinity mirror” rooms and other works will be on view starting next year.
2016-08-16.lead_paragraph: It’s strange to think about taking a room-sized, mirror-lined art installation designed to be a dazzlingly immersive and thoroughly self-contained aesthetic experience and putting it under the same roof as five other versions of the artwork. But that’s the idea at the heart of a 2017 survey of the Japanese ultra-Pop artist Yayoi Kusama, which will host six of her attention-grabbing “infinity mirror” rooms alongside sculptures, paintings and drawings from her six-decade career.
2016-08-16.headline_main: Yayoi Kusama to Be the Focus of a Touring Museum Show

2016-08-16.abstract: With down-ballot candidates seeking to distance themselves from their party’s nominee, the Republican majority in the House is looking safe.
2016-08-16.snippet: With down-ballot candidates seeking to distance themselves from their party’s nominee, the Republican majority in the House is looking safe.
2016-08-16.lead_paragraph: No presidential candidate in modern history has behaved like Donald J. Trump. And that distinction, paradoxically, might be enough for Republicans in the House of Representatives to keep their majority in November.
2016-08-16.headline_main: How House Republicans May Survive Donald Trump

2016-08-16.abstract: The trial of an Israeli soldier is reinforcing calls for the death penalty for Palestinian terrorists.
2016-08-16.snippet: The trial of an Israeli soldier is reinforcing calls for the death penalty for Palestinian terrorists.
2016-08-16.lead_paragraph: TEL AVIV — For decades, Israel has prided itself on its anti death-penalty stance. But in the past year, calls for the use of capital punishment have started to rise again, heightened by the trial of Elor Azaria, a sergeant in the Israel Defense Forces. Sergeant Azaria has been charged with manslaughter for killing Abdel Fattah al-Sharif, a Palestinian. Mr. Sharif had stabbed an Israeli soldier, and been shot and wounded by the soldier’s colleagues. In a video of the event, he can be seen lying supine and still for several minutes before Sergeant Azaria calmly points the gun at his head and fires.
2016-08-16.headline_main: Capital Punishment Is Not Israel’s Answer to Terrorism

2016-08-16.abstract: Byron Lima Oliva’s death was a fitting end for a man who built an empire from behind bars by leveraging alliances on both sides of the law.
2016-08-16.snippet: Byron Lima Oliva’s death was a fitting end for a man who built an empire from behind bars by leveraging alliances on both sides of the law.
2016-08-16.lead_paragraph: On July 18, Guatemala’s most infamous — and powerful — prisoner, Byron Lima Oliva, was shot to death in the Pavón prison outside Guatemala City. While it was a fellow prisoner who, the authorities said, put two bullets in Mr. Lima’s head, in all likelihood the intellectual authors of the killing hail from the highest echelons of the state and the moneyed elite. In Guatemala, it is often impossible to tell where the state ends and the underworld begins.
2016-08-16.headline_main: The Demise of a Prison Lord

2016-08-16.abstract: A New York councilman has introduced legislation that takes aim at the list, which advocates say includes tenants who won court cases or legally withheld rent because of decrepit conditions.
2016-08-16.snippet: A New York councilman has introduced legislation that takes aim at the list, which advocates say includes tenants who won court cases or legally withheld rent because of decrepit conditions.
2016-08-16.lead_paragraph: After two years of being homeless, napping in stores open all night and more recently staying in a convent in Harlem, Margot Miller found out in March that her luck was about to change: She had qualified for an apartment for low-income older adults.
2016-08-16.headline_main: On Tenant Blacklist, Errors and Renters With Little Recourse

2016-08-16.abstract: Teff, an ancient grain that has long been a dietary staple for Ethiopia’s legendary distance runners because of its high iron content, is gaining popularity in the United States.

2016-08-16.abstract: A clinical trial found that a new drug stimulates bone growth and prevents fractures at least as well as the only other such drug on the market.
2016-08-16.snippet: A clinical trial found that a new drug stimulates bone growth and prevents fractures at least as well as the only other such drug on the market.
2016-08-16.lead_paragraph: A large clinical trial of a new osteoporosis drug found that it stimulates bone growth and prevents fractures at least as well as the only other such drug on the market. The new drug, expected to win approval from federal regulators, would offer another much-needed treatment for some of the 10 million Americans, 80 percent of them women, who have a disease that weakens bones and often leads to years of pain, disability and early death.
2016-08-16.headline_main: Osteoporosis, a Disease With Few Treatment Options, May Soon Have One More

2016-08-16.lead_paragraph: RIO DE JANEIRO — For anyone who doubted her after a subpar performance on the balance beam, Simone Biles sent an emphatic message on Tuesday: She is unbeatable in the floor exercise.

2016-08-16.abstract: The Republican nominee’s claim that President Obama is the ‘founder of ISIS’ is being welcomed by the United States’ enemies.
2016-08-16.snippet: The Republican nominee’s claim that President Obama is the ‘founder of ISIS’ is being welcomed by the United States’ enemies.
2016-08-16.lead_paragraph: In November 2015, a cartoon in Al-Ahram, an Egyptian state-owned newspaper, depicted an Islamic State ogre with “Made in America” emblazoned on his back. It wasn’t unusual. A look at Middle Eastern news media shows that this idea is startlingly common. Even prominent officials in the region, from Egypt’s former culture minister to a former deputy prime minister of Iraq, have publicly ventured conspiracy theories that Washington created the Islamic State.
2016-08-16.headline_main: How Do Trump’s Conspiracy Theories Go Over in the Middle East? Dangerously.

2016-08-16.snippet: A deal would combine two of the world’s largest providers of industrial-gas products and create a giant with more than $30 billion in annual revenue.

2016-08-16.abstract: From the archives of The International Herald Tribune: Comtesse Potocka steals dogs in Paris in August 1891.
2016-08-16.snippet: From the archives of The International Herald Tribune: Comtesse Potocka steals dogs in Paris in August 1891.
2016-08-16.lead_paragraph: Comtesse Potocka, a Polish lady, living at St. Cloud, has a mania for stealing dogs. She lives quite alone and the neighbors were for a long time annoyed by the noises and smells which proceeded from her dog-haunted premises. At last her neglect to pay her rent gave the police an opportunity of forcing their way into the house. In the various rooms and the garden there were found forty-one dogs, some tied to trees, others shut up in rooms. As their meals had been regulated more by the good humor of the Comtesse than by their own natural cravings, some of the animals were in a painful condition, and had to be shot. — The New York Herald, European Edition, August 17, 1891
2016-08-16.headline_main: 1891: A Dogomaniac Near Paris

2016-08-16.abstract: From the archives of The International Herald Tribune: An Iraqi Air Force captain defects to Israel in August 1966.
2016-08-16.snippet: From the archives of The International Herald Tribune: An Iraqi Air Force captain defects to Israel in August 1966.
2016-08-16.lead_paragraph: TEL AVIV — An Iraqi Air Force captain defected to Israel today [Aug. 16] in his Russian-built MiG-21 supersonic jet fighter. Israeli military officers here said it was the first time a MiG-21 had been deposited intact in Western hands. The 30-year-old pilot said he was a Catholic, and that religious discrimination had affected his chances for promotion. He said that he began planning his defection 18 months ago, and had decided to fly to Israel because that was the only country within flying range which would not hand him back to Iraq. — New York Herald Tribune, European Edition, Aug. 17, 1966
2016-08-16.headline_main: 1966: Iraqi Defects to Israel

2016-08-16.abstract: Along the Neckar River in Germany, Mark Twain found an unlikely source of inspiration.
2016-08-16.snippet: Along the Neckar River in Germany, Mark Twain found an unlikely source of inspiration.
2016-08-16.lead_paragraph: Heidelberg’s only Mark Twain impersonator takes his work seriously. His eyebrows and mustache are unruly, and his long gray hair overlaps his ears. He wears a white suit that is too warm in summer and not warm enough in winter. The only obvious problem with Klaus Mombrei’s performance, as he leads tour groups through the city, is something Twain himself would have found amusing: He speaks not Missouri-twanged English but his native German.
2016-08-16.headline_main: Mark Twain Found Inspiration in Germany (Though Not German)

2016-08-16.lead_paragraph: RIO DE JANEIRO — Down in the pool, the Australian synchronized swimming duo was performing a three-minute whistle-stop tour of the animals of the outback — kookaburras, emus, centipedes — to music from “Crocodile Dundee.” In the stands, the American mother-daughter duo of Ruth and Emily Thunstrum was trying to figure out what, exactly, was going on.

2016-08-16.abstract: When she isn’t a Manhattan mother-cum-fashion designer, Hearst is an indomitable gaucho on her childhood ranch.
2016-08-16.snippet: When she isn’t a Manhattan mother-cum-fashion designer, Hearst is an indomitable gaucho on her childhood ranch.
2016-08-16.lead_paragraph: When Gabriela Hearst began dating her future husband Austin Hearst, scion of the publishing clan, they shared memories of growing up on their families’ ranches. Austin’s, of course, was San Simeon, the well-groomed coastal California spread (including the now-public Hearst Castle) where he rode the Arabians his family breeds. Gabriela recalls smiling back at him indulgently. “It sounded so nice,” she says, “but I was thinking, ‘No, I meant I grew up on a ranch.’ ”
2016-08-16.headline_main: Gabriela Hearst at Home, in Uruguay

In a recent interview, Anthony Cordesman, who holds the Arleigh A. Burke Chair in Strategy at the Center for Strategic and International Studies, helped evaluate some of Mr. Trump’s more unusual proposals. Mr. Cordesman, who focuses on national security and has worked on Middle Eastern issues for years, explained why an ideological test for immigrants won’t work, why the United States couldn’t have kept Iraq’s oil and what really led to the rise of ISIS.

2016-08-16.lead_paragraph: Even by Pennsylvania’s unbuttoned standards, it was a scandal of exhausting length and tawdriness, a seemingly endless parade of pornography, personal and political vendettas, smear tactics, barely veiled threats, conspiracy and cover-up. So when the state’s attorney general, Kathleen G. Kane, announced on Tuesday that she was resigning, one day after her conviction for perjury and conspiracy, among other charges, even her supporters might have been excused for welcoming a sense of closure.

2016-08-16.snippet: Honey’s in East Williamsburg features mead-heavy drinks created by a Mission Chinese alum — and adjoins the city’s first honey winery.
2016-08-16.lead_paragraph: Deep in Brooklyn’s artisanal hinterlands, where East Williamsburg and Bushwick converge on Scott Avenue, a new alcoholic enterprise is brewing — with a twist. Enlightenment Wines, New York’s self-proclaimed first meadery, is a distinctly DIY undertaking that seeks to elevate the profile of honey wines beyond their knee-jerk associations with the “Game of Thrones” milieu. To do so, this summer its founders quietly opened a front-of-house tasting room and cocktail bar called Honey’s adjoining the meadery, where visitors can sample brews like Memento Mori (drawn from foraged dandelion flowers) and Jewels Into Flowers (an apple mead made from chrysanthemum and chamomile flowers), as well as a menu of bar snacks and cocktails devised by the mixologist Arley Marks of Mission Chinese and Dimes.
2016-08-16.headline_main: A Brooklyn Cocktail Bar Dedicated to One Unexpected Ingredient

2016-08-16.snippet: The new Union Square Cafe will sprout an offshoot, Daily Provisions; Señor Frog’s closes in Times Square and other restaurant news.
2016-08-16.lead_paragraph: SAMUI The chef and an owner of this Southeast Asian restaurant goes by the name A Napadol. Ms. Napadol grew up working with her grandmother, who had a restaurant in her northeastern Thailand home, and is now cooking again after careers in real estate and as a jewelry designer. The design background is evident in the fancy details of the restaurant, which occupies what was a garage with soaring brick walls and is named for a Thai resort island. Ms. Napadol’s interpretive menu stretches through categories like small plates, sliders, soups, noodles, curries and big plates. It touches on tradition with the inevitable papaya salad and pad Thai, but adds new ideas, not strictly Thai, including black potato fritters, crispy smelts, a mussel pancake and grilled black cod in a miso-jalapeño marinade: 15 Vanderbilt Avenue (Flushing Avenue), Fort Greene, Brooklyn, 917-909-1032, samuibrooklyn.com.
2016-08-16.headline_main: Samui Brings Northern Thailand to Fort Greene

2016-08-16.abstract: Traditional idioms actually seemed freshest at the Erasing Borders Festival in Manhattan.
2016-08-16.snippet: Traditional idioms actually seemed freshest at the Erasing Borders Festival in Manhattan.
2016-08-16.lead_paragraph: Practitioners of Indian classical dance are rightly proud of the ancient heritage they embody. As devoted as they are to gurus and lineage and tradition, though, they are also artists of the present, and many of them, especially the young, long to be innovative, up-to-date, relevant. Whether updating is more positive or more perilous was a live question during this year’s Erasing Borders Festival of Indian Dance.
2016-08-16.headline_main: Broad Hints of Modern Angst at a Festival of Indian Dance

2016-08-16.snippet: Mr. Trump says he will end the H-1B program, which allows certain skilled immigrants to work in the United States — including some employees of Trump Model Management.
2016-08-16.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — On the campaign trail, Donald J. Trump has excoriated the nation’s visa program for high-skilled workers as a job killer, pledging to end it with “no exceptions.” But his own companies have used it to bring in hundreds of foreign workers, including fashion models for his modeling agency who need exhibit no special skills.
2016-08-16.headline_main: Donald Trump Wants to Cut Visa Program He Used for His Own Models

2016-08-16.abstract: Female airline pilots are pushing for paid maternity leave and private spaces to pump breast milk, as opponents point to added costs and safety issues.
2016-08-16.snippet: Female airline pilots are pushing for paid maternity leave and private spaces to pump breast milk, as opponents point to added costs and safety issues.
2016-08-16.lead_paragraph: Boarding a flight can feel like stepping into a time capsule — men typically fly the plane, while most flight attendants are still women. Which is why a female pilot from Delta Air Lines did something dramatic at a union meeting recently.
2016-08-16.headline_main: When the Pilot Is a Mom: Accommodating New Motherhood at 30,000 Feet

2016-08-16.abstract: Though many have stayed for years, no Turkish Kurd has ever been granted refugee status in Japan, which would allow them to settle there permanently.
2016-08-16.snippet: Though many have stayed for years, no Turkish Kurd has ever been granted refugee status in Japan, which would allow them to settle there permanently.
2016-08-16.lead_paragraph: KAWAGUCHI, Japan — Mahircan Yucel moved to Japan a dozen years ago as a teenager fleeing sectarian violence in Turkey. He learned Japanese, got married, had two children and grew to love his adopted homeland. But Japan has refused to accept him and could force him to leave.
2016-08-16.headline_main: Ethnic Kurds Find Haven, but No Home, in Insular Japan

2016-08-16.abstract: Officials say that Russian hackers may have breached the email accounts of more than 100 officials and groups.
2016-08-16.snippet: Officials say that Russian hackers may have breached the email accounts of more than 100 officials and groups.

2016-08-16.abstract: A new generation considers the black experience in America in this collection of essays, poems and memoirs.
2016-08-16.snippet: A new generation considers the black experience in America in this collection of essays, poems and memoirs.
2016-08-16.lead_paragraph: When the Mississippi-born writer Jesmyn Ward was in high school, she and five members of her class visited the office of Trent Lott, one of her state’s senators, in Washington.
2016-08-16.headline_main: Review: ‘The Fire This Time,’ Stoked by Baldwin’s Legacy

2016-08-16.abstract: “I can’t explain how I even have a voice, after all the bad things I did to it,” says Mr. Crosby, whose “Lighthouse” will be released in October.
2016-08-16.snippet: “I can’t explain how I even have a voice, after all the bad things I did to it,” says Mr. Crosby, whose “Lighthouse” will be released in October.
2016-08-16.lead_paragraph: David Crosby’s “Croz,” released in 2014, was his first solo studio album in 20 years. He didn’t wait as long for a follow-up. “Lighthouse,” due out on Oct. 21, is a collection of new songs performed in a sparse acoustic setting, with a warm, bright light trained on his voice and guitar.
2016-08-16.headline_main: David Crosby on Politics, Culture, Aging and a New Album

2016-08-16.abstract: A dozen-show dive into the New York International Fringe Festival, which has nearly 200 shows on offer.
2016-08-16.snippet: A dozen-show dive into the New York International Fringe Festival, which has nearly 200 shows on offer.
2016-08-16.lead_paragraph: Part of me wondered where everyone was. Late on Saturday night, at the fifth production of what would be a dozen-show dive into the New York International Fringe Festival, I had finally found something rather glorious — but the house looked more empty than not. It hardly seemed right.
2016-08-16.headline_main: Finding Some Treasures at FringeNYC

2016-08-16.abstract: Seeking to duplicate his success in describing Jeb Bush as “low energy,” Mr. Trump has taken to arguing that Mrs. Clinton is too tired to lead the country.
2016-08-16.snippet: Seeking to duplicate his success in describing Jeb Bush as “low energy,” Mr. Trump has taken to arguing that Mrs. Clinton is too tired to lead the country.
2016-08-16.lead_paragraph: First there was “low energy.” Now increasingly it’s “no stamina.”
2016-08-16.headline_main: Donald Trump’s Latest Jab at Hillary Clinton: ‘No Stamina’

2016-08-16.abstract: For many plaintiffs in suits involving the police, a tension exists between the need to take the settlement and the inclination to make a point.
2016-08-16.snippet: For many plaintiffs in suits involving the police, a tension exists between the need to take the settlement and the inclination to make a point.
2016-08-16.lead_paragraph: When lawsuits against the police are settled, like the one announced this week in which New York City agreed to pay $4 million to the family of Akai Gurley, people tend to focus on the amount of money changing hands. Sometimes overlooked are the institutional reforms embedded in the deals, and the difficult decisions made by plaintiffs and their lawyers in trading a full public airing of the facts for the recovery of damages.
2016-08-16.headline_main: In Police Misconduct Lawsuits, Potent Incentives Point to a Payout

2016-08-16.abstract: House Republicans had pushed the bureau to surrender material it had gathered before it concluded that Mrs. Clinton should not face criminal charges
2016-08-16.snippet: House Republicans had pushed the bureau to surrender material it had gathered before it concluded that Mrs. Clinton should not face criminal charges
2016-08-16.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — The F.B.I. on Tuesday handed over to Congress documents related to its investigation of Hillary Clinton’s private email server after House Republicans pushed the bureau to surrender material it had gathered before it concluded last month that she should not face criminal charges.
2016-08-16.headline_main: F.B.I. Gives Congress Documents Related to Hillary Clinton E-Mail Inquiry

2016-08-16.abstract: An overloaded bus with villagers en route to sign agreements for grants to rebuild their homes ran off an unpaved road, killing and injuring dozens.
2016-08-16.snippet: An overloaded bus with villagers en route to sign agreements for grants to rebuild their homes ran off an unpaved road, killing and injuring dozens.
2016-08-16.lead_paragraph: KATHMANDU, Nepal — The second time the overloaded bus stalled, passengers stayed put. They had already exited once to push. With the bus stuck on a one-lane mountain dirt road, its occupants stuffed inside and on the roof amid luggage and rice sacks, the driver backed up first to regain uphill momentum.
2016-08-16.headline_main: Bus of Nepal Earthquake Survivors Plunges Off a Road, Killing 27

2016-08-16.abstract: This dutiful documentary casts indigenous protesters against the government and commercial interests intent on exploiting Peru’s rich natural resources.
2016-08-16.snippet: This dutiful documentary casts indigenous protesters against the government and commercial interests intent on exploiting Peru’s rich natural resources.
2016-08-16.lead_paragraph: During his second term as president of Peru, from 2006 to 2011, Alan García made deals and pushed through laws allowing for greater corporate and industrial incursions into the Amazon than the government had ever permitted. Various factions rose up to oppose his administration’s actions, including Aidesep, the interethnic association for the development of the Peruvian rain forest, an organization of indigenous Amazonians led by Alberto Pizango.
2016-08-16.headline_main: Review: ‘When Two Worlds Collide’ Portrays a Battle for the Amazon

2016-08-16.abstract: The suspect, 31, is accused of selling a gun and ammunition to a teenager who went on a shooting spree at a mall last month and sent a city into lockdown.
2016-08-16.snippet: The suspect, 31, is accused of selling a gun and ammunition to a teenager who went on a shooting spree at a mall last month and sent a city into lockdown.
2016-08-16.lead_paragraph: BERLIN — The police have arrested a 31-year-old German man suspected of selling a gun and bullets to a teenager who killed nine people in a rampage last month in Munich, which sent the city into a panicky lockdown amid fears of a terrorist attack.

2016-08-16.snippet: A hip, cuddly and cunningly sadistic musical adaptation of the 1993 Bill Murray movie has just opened in London.
2016-08-16.lead_paragraph: LONDON — Who knew that déjà vu could smell this fresh all over again? On paper, the happy new musical “Groundhog Day,” which opened on Tuesday night at the Old Vic Theater here, seemed like one of those shows that elicit instant groans of “been there, done that” among jaded theatergoers.
2016-08-16.headline_main: Review: ‘Groundhog Day,’ All Over Again, Now With Song and Dance

2016-08-16.snippet: Speaking in West Bend, Wis., Mr. Trump accused Hillary Clinton of complicity in violence against the police and blamed Democrats for the plight of black neighborhoods.
2016-08-16.lead_paragraph: WEST BEND, Wis. — Forty miles north of the racially charged unrest unfolding in Milwaukee, Donald J. Trump spoke to a nearly all-white crowd here on Tuesday, accusing Hillary Clinton of complicity in violence against police officers and claiming to “reject the bigotry” of Democrats, who he said were responsible for the plight of many black neighborhoods.
2016-08-16.headline_main: Trump, Rallying White Crowd for Police, Accuses Democrats of Exploiting Blacks

2016-08-16.abstract: Kyle Dixon and Michael Stein, members of the synth-driven group Survive, discuss their score for the hit Netflix science-fiction series.
2016-08-16.snippet: Kyle Dixon and Michael Stein, members of the synth-driven group Survive, discuss their score for the hit Netflix science-fiction series.
2016-08-16.lead_paragraph: Two of the stars of “Stranger Things,” the ’80s-inspired Netflix series, never show their faces onscreen. The show, a mixture of science fiction, fantasy and horror, has attracted attention for its use of popcorn cinema touchstones. But its score is perhaps the secret ingredient, a mixture of icy new-wave hooks, spooky ambient textures and menacing drones made by Kyle Dixon and Michael Stein, both Austin, Tex., musicians who play in a synth-driven quartet called Survive.
2016-08-16.headline_main: How the ‘Stranger Things’ Soundtrack Became the Show’s Secret Weapon

2016-08-16.abstract: The sale came two months after Gawker filed for bankruptcy, a concession to the financial pressure it faced from a judgment in a case involving Hulk Hogan.
2016-08-16.snippet: The sale came two months after Gawker filed for bankruptcy, a concession to the financial pressure it faced from a judgment in a case involving Hulk Hogan.
2016-08-16.lead_paragraph: Gawker Media, whose fierce independence afforded it an unsparing approach to web journalism that influenced news organizations across the internet and the wider media world, was sold to Univision at auction on Tuesday, giving the freewheeling company an outside owner for the first time since its founding 14 years ago.
2016-08-16.headline_main: Gawker Is Said to Be Sold to Univision in a $135 Million Bid

2016-08-16.abstract: When the German twins Anna and Lisa Hahner joined hands as they finished deep in the pack in the women’s marathon, they quickly drew sharp criticism from their federation.
2016-08-16.snippet: When the German twins Anna and Lisa Hahner joined hands as they finished deep in the pack in the women’s marathon, they quickly drew sharp criticism from their federation.

2016-08-16.headline_main: Twins Finish Marathon Hand in Hand, but Their Country Says They Crossed a Line

2016-08-16.abstract: Under Gov. Chris Christie, New Jersey agreed to accept just $5 million in the bankruptcy cases of casinos founded by his friend Donald J. Trump, raising questions of special treatment.
2016-08-16.snippet: Under Gov. Chris Christie, New Jersey agreed to accept just $5 million in the bankruptcy cases of casinos founded by his friend Donald J. Trump, raising questions of special treatment.
2016-08-16.lead_paragraph: By the time Chris Christie became governor of New Jersey, the state’s auditors and lawyers had been battling for several years to collect long-overdue taxes owed by the casinos founded by his friend Donald J. Trump.

2016-08-17.abstract: A Jesuit priest who served in the Nixon White House, he turned to a new vocation that brought a sharp edge to the Sunday morning political talk show.
2016-08-17.snippet: A Jesuit priest who served in the Nixon White House, he turned to a new vocation that brought a sharp edge to the Sunday morning political talk show.
2016-08-17.lead_paragraph: John McLaughlin, a former Roman Catholic priest who became an aide to Richard M. Nixon in the White House and parlayed his fierce defense of the president into a television career as host of “The McLaughlin Group,” the long-running Sunday morning program of combative political punditry, died on Tuesday at his home in Washington. He was 89.
2016-08-17.headline_main: John McLaughlin, TV Host Who Made Combat of Punditry, Dies at 89

2016-08-17.abstract: But Congress should strengthen health insurance marketplaces to ensure sufficient competition.
2016-08-17.snippet: But Congress should strengthen health insurance marketplaces to ensure sufficient competition.
2016-08-17.lead_paragraph: Die-hard opponents of the 2010 health reform law, the Affordable Care Act, have often used its real and imagined problems to argue that it is fatally flawed. Now they are seizing on an announcement by Aetna that it will reduce its participation in the health insurance marketplaces set up by the law. Donald Trump’s campaign  called Aetna’s move “the latest blow to this broken law that is slowly imploding under its regulatory red tape.”
2016-08-17.headline_main: Obamacare Will Survive Aetna’s Retreat

2016-08-17.abstract: You know the actress from her films. The real Kristen Stewart — funny and fiercely open — is only just emerging. That took years of work.
2016-08-17.snippet: You know the actress from her films. The real Kristen Stewart — funny and fiercely open — is only just emerging. That took years of work.
2016-08-17.lead_paragraph: It’s hard to not be charmed by Kristen Stewart’s Los Feliz home, even harder to believe that it belongs to a movie star and not a college freshman. The basement den of her four-bedroom property, which hovers above Los Angeles — at once belonging to and separate from the hazy city below it — is a study in random: a stop sign on one wall, three metal letters — A, S and S — on another, a Batman action figure, a Winnie the Pooh-themed Pez dispenser, a Playboy pinball machine. The room’s centerpiece, an imposing bookcase, is packed with fashion tomes, a few to do with Chanel, for whom she models; monographs featuring the work of Basquiat, Eggleston and Mapplethorpe; books about food, travel and the Beatles; and novels by Dostoyevsky, Hesse and Kafka. A chunk of shelf is devoted to Jack Kerouac, whose character Marylou she played in a film version of “On the Road.”
2016-08-17.headline_main: Kristen Stewart, the Good Bad Girl

2016-08-17.abstract: The Incroyables of 18th-century France used exquisitely malformed clothing to express outrage. So, too, are designers now.
2016-08-17.snippet: The Incroyables of 18th-century France used exquisitely malformed clothing to express outrage. So, too, are designers now.
2016-08-17.lead_paragraph: At the fall 2016 shows back in March, the fashion designer Rei Kawakubo presented a collection for her Comme des Garçons label that was an ode to the 18th century. Its shapes were grandly outsize: gargantuan balloons of brocade and jacquard malforming the body, hair ­piled high and frizzed. Anna Cleveland, daughter of Pat, strode with her unusual gait, toes pointed outward, nose pointed upward. “Eighteenth-­century punk” was Kawakubo’s stated inspiration. “The 18th century was a time of change and revolution,” she said. “This is how I imagine punks would look, if they had lived in this century.”
2016-08-17.headline_main: When Fashion Becomes a Form of Protest

2016-08-17.abstract: With long lines, chaotic ticketing and a collection to rival the Louvre’s, the Uffizi Gallery is at the forefront of dramatic reforms.
2016-08-17.snippet: With long lines, chaotic ticketing and a collection to rival the Louvre’s, the Uffizi Gallery is at the forefront of dramatic reforms.
2016-08-17.lead_paragraph: FLORENCE, Italy — Eike Schmidt, the new director of the Uffizi Gallery here and the first non-Italian to hold the job, took what seemed a logical step. In the spring, he set up loudspeakers warning visitors about scalpers and pickpockets who target tourists waiting in the perennially long lines outside Italy’s most-visited museum, famous for its magnificent treasures by Botticelli and Raphael.
2016-08-17.headline_main: Shaking Up Italy’s Most Popular Museum

2016-08-17.abstract: In different parts of Washington State, working together on local agendas was a key to chipping away at social ills.
2016-08-17.snippet: In different parts of Washington State, working together on local agendas was a key to chipping away at social ills.
2016-08-17.lead_paragraph: Liberals and conservatives often disagree about the causes of poverty and other social ills. Broadly speaking, liberals point the finger at structural factors and advocate for policy changes, while conservatives look to individuals and families and favor behavior changes. Clearly, both points of view have validity. But what’s often overlooked is what lies between these two poles — communities and neighborhoods — and the value of focusing on this middle zone.
2016-08-17.headline_main: How Community Networks Stem Childhood Traumas

2016-08-17.snippet: Extremists in Congress want to give away our federal lands.
2016-08-17.lead_paragraph: Tucked into the fiscal relief package for Puerto Rico this spring was a provision to give away a national treasure that belongs to all Americans — 3,100 acres of the Vieques National Wildlife Refuge. The proposal had nothing to do with the economic recovery of Puerto Rico. But it would have handed an important victory to extremists in Congress and state legislatures who want to grab national lands and turn them over to the states to be sold or leased.
2016-08-17.headline_main: Don’t Give Away Our Wildlife Refuges

2016-08-17.abstract: Our cultural idealization of love could use a revision.
2016-08-17.snippet: Our cultural idealization of love could use a revision.
2016-08-17.lead_paragraph: It has not, by any measure, been a Summer of Love; more like a Summer of Anxiety, Fear and Hate. It would be facile to respond to recent events — political upheaval, mass murder, police violence and festering racism — with a call to “love.” But in extreme times, it’s worth considering: Can love (as we know it) act as a radical force rather than a distraction? Does our current idea of love need revision? Is there a new kind of love emerging in new social movements, one that works against the narrow kind of love fostered by capitalism? I discussed these and other matters with Moira Weigel, the author of “Labor of Love: The Invention of Dating.” — Natasha Lennard
2016-08-17.headline_main: Love. Labor. Lost.

2016-08-17.lead_paragraph: Las Vegas — THIS summer I worked as a seasonal cocktail server, a job that came with a membership in the largest union local in Nevada, Culinary 226. In my first week on the job, I chatted with a co-worker in the elevator. I asked how long she had been working there. “Twenty-eight years,” she said. “And I just got my dream shift last week!”
2016-08-17.headline_main: Why Las Vegas Is a Great Place for Working-Class Women

2016-08-17.snippet: Climate experts deconstruct the possible roles of global warming and Louisiana’s warm swampy landscapes in fueling a devastating inland tropical deluge.
2016-08-17.lead_paragraph: As news media fixated on athletic achievements at the Rio Olympics, and of course remained fixated on Donald Trump, different corners of the United States were confronting weather-related hazards — including relentless steamy heat in the East and drought-fueled wildfires all around California, including the explosively spreading “Blue Cut” Fire east of Los Angeles. But nothing has come close to the deadly off-the-chart deluges and flooding in southern Louisiana, which the Red Cross says have produced the country’s worst natural disaster since Hurricane Sandy.
2016-08-17.headline_main: What Fueled Louisiana’s Deadly Flood?

2016-08-17.snippet: A heavily processed food that embodies our conquest of nature.
2016-08-17.lead_paragraph: About 12 years ago, my partner and I decided to wow our friends on Thanksgiving by ordering a heritage-breed turkey from a small farmer in Pennsylvania. For weeks we watched the turkey — our turkey — on the farmer’s webcam, a cluster of pixels frolicking inside a chicken-wire enclosure. It was butchered and shipped overnight (the FedEx shipping cost nearly as much as the bird) and when it emerged from the oven, mari­nated and basted decadently in butter, the turkey tasted so unspeakably bland that much of it was left on our friends’ plates, camouflaged awkwardly under brussels sprouts. The feel-good narrative of our lovingly raised, hormone-antibiotic-and-G.M.O.-free certified-organic turkey became supplanted with a more ambiguous one. We felt both duped and morally abject: Not only were we out nearly $200, but our ethical gambit put an end to the bird’s bucolic life.
2016-08-17.headline_main: Letter of Recommendation: Cheddar and Sour Cream Ruffles

2016-08-17.abstract: The magazine’s Ethicist columnist on telling a friend’s husband about her serial betrayals, sharing a dementia diagnosis with a sibling and whether it’s O.K. to ask a student to do free research.
2016-08-17.snippet: The magazine’s Ethicist columnist on telling a friend’s husband about her serial betrayals, sharing a dementia diagnosis with a sibling and whether it’s O.K. to ask a student to do free research.
2016-08-17.lead_paragraph: More than two years ago, my best friend’s husband discovered that she was cheating on him with her business partner. They decided to work on their marriage and go to counseling, together and separately. I’ve had long conversations with my friend, and she confessed to me that she has slept with more than 10 other men while being married and even slept with an ex-­boyfriend while she was engaged. She has gone to addiction support groups; however, she’s still seeing and sleeping with the man she was caught cheating with, engaging in threesomes with him and sleeping with other men. She even brought him to my birthday party, where there were only a few friends celebrating (none of whom know her or her husband).
2016-08-17.headline_main: When a Friend Cheats Often on Her Husband, Should You Keep Quiet?

2016-08-17.lead_paragraph: LONDON — In barely a generation, air power has shifted from indiscriminate to discriminating. Thanks to advances in precision guidance, American bombs and missiles now generally get to where they’re intended. But human or machine error, bad luck or faulty military math still lead to unforeseen civilian deaths. And as the United States and its allies continue their bombing campaign against the Islamic State in Iraq and Syria, many more noncombatants are perishing than they seem prepared to admit.

2016-08-17.abstract: A repurposed gasworks complex, built in the 19th century, has spurred a revival of the industrial neighborhood of Westerpark.
2016-08-17.snippet: A repurposed gasworks complex, built in the 19th century, has spurred a revival of the industrial neighborhood of Westerpark.
2016-08-17.lead_paragraph: In northwestern Amsterdam, an old gasworks complex has spurred a revival of the industrial neighborhood of Westerpark. Built in the 19th century, the Westergasfabriek hasn’t produced gas in decades, but its handsome red brick buildings have been repurposed to house creative projects ranging from an art house cinema to a trendsetting nightclub. Spruced-up outdoor areas host regular flea and food markets, and new bars, restaurants and shops now attract Amsterdammers from across the city. Meanwhile, the surrounding urban park beckons with its large grassy meadows, petting zoo and benches that double as art installations.
2016-08-17.headline_main: Five Places to Go in Amsterdam

2016-08-17.abstract: Has something fundamental shifted? Amid uncertainty, the Fed affirmed the status quo.
2016-08-17.snippet: Has something fundamental shifted? Amid uncertainty, the Fed affirmed the status quo.
2016-08-17.lead_paragraph: The quandary facing the Federal Reserve this summer is the same as it was back in the spring, and winter, and last fall: By traditional guideposts like the unemployment rate, it looks as if it is time for the Fed to be raising interest rates. Yet the global economy seems to be locked in a low-growth, low-inflation world in which raising interest rates is at best unnecessary and at worst dangerous.
2016-08-17.headline_main: The Fed Is Searching for a New Framework. New Minutes Show It Doesn’t Have One Yet.

2016-08-17.abstract: Mr. Walker’s songs on “Golden Sings That Have Been Sung” are all age-old tales, but put together in his own exacting way, which makes them new.
2016-08-17.snippet: Mr. Walker’s songs on “Golden Sings That Have Been Sung” are all age-old tales, but put together in his own exacting way, which makes them new.
2016-08-17.lead_paragraph: Not long ago it was possible to peg Ryley Walker as a pastiche agent, a fingerstyle guitarist and singer-songwriter with a taste for revivalist modes of yesteryear. His breakout 2015 album, “Primrose Green,” evoked the pastoral British psychedelia of the late 1960s and early ’70s — Tim Buckley, John Martyn, Nick Drake — with a coy precision that probably went a little too far. From the title to the cover illustration, it sold a convenient fiction: the idea that Mr. Walker was a torchbearer, rather than a trickster.
2016-08-17.headline_main: Review: Ryley Walker Is Unsettled in a Chicago Way on ‘Golden Sings’

2016-08-17.abstract: This week’s Modern Love Podcast is an encore episode for prom season, featuring the “Unbreakable Kimmy Schmidt” actor reading the story of a gay high school student who gets invited to the big event again and again and again.

2016-08-17.headline_main: The Modern Love Podcast: Tituss Burgess Reads ‘A Prince Charming for the Prom (Not Ever After, Though)’

2016-08-17.abstract: Ms. Russell is an Emmy nominee for her role as Elizabeth Jennings, the K.G.B. agent and master of disguise on FX’s “The Americans.”
2016-08-17.snippet: Ms. Russell is an Emmy nominee for her role as Elizabeth Jennings, the K.G.B. agent and master of disguise on FX’s “The Americans.”
2016-08-17.lead_paragraph: In 1999, after a single season as the bountifully curled college student at the helm of WB’s “Felicity,” Keri Russell won a Golden Globe. Seventeen years and countless hairstyles later, Ms. Russell has finally earned recognition for the strongest role of her career — an Emmy Award nomination for playing Elizabeth Jennings, the K.G.B. agent and master of disguise, on FX’s “The Americans.” The 68th Emmy Awards will be held on Sept. 18.
2016-08-17.headline_main: Keri Russell on Her First Emmy Nomination, for ‘The Americans’

2016-08-17.abstract: The historian Covell Meyskens discusses his blog, where he displays photos and other documents from the first decades of Communist rule.
2016-08-17.snippet: The historian Covell Meyskens discusses his blog, where he displays photos and other documents from the first decades of Communist rule.
2016-08-17.lead_paragraph: Covell Meyskens is a historian of modern China at the Naval Postgraduate School, an educational institution in California mainly aimed at active-duty military officers. He is working on a book about the Third Front, the gargantuan defense project China began in 1964 to build an industrial base in its interior, far from the more vulnerable coastal region. He also runs the photo blog “Everyday Life in Mao’s China,” a website with more than 5,000 photos and paintings depicting life in China during the first decades of Communist rule.
2016-08-17.headline_main: Where Mao Meets the Mundane: Everyday Life in a Bygone China

Rivera built a reputation for hitting in the Mets’ minor league system, and long before he reached the majors, he was a baseball-loving kid growing up in the Throgs Neck section of the Bronx. 2016-08-17.abstract: This troupe from Philadelphia is devoted to new choreography and has vividly appealing, highly individualistic dancers.
2016-08-17.snippet: This troupe from Philadelphia is devoted to new choreography and has vividly appealing, highly individualistic dancers.
2016-08-17.lead_paragraph: Ballet tends to be the most orthodox of the art forms, and often the most reactionary. How heartening to renew acquaintance with the uninhibited and adult eccentricity that BalletX, a company devoted to new choreography, seems to encourage. This Philadelphia company, appearing this week in a program of three works at the Joyce Theater, also has vividly appealing, highly individual dancers. It’s easy to miss how meticulous they are in style — but impossible not to recognize their richness and immediacy.
2016-08-17.headline_main: Review: Eccentricity and Offbeat Humor by BalletX

2016-08-17.lead_paragraph: PARIS — The debate is now so heated in France that one could be forgiven for assuming that the burkini — the full-body bathing suit worn by some Muslim women — had invaded French beaches. Five towns have banned them. Three more are in the process of doing so. Prime Minister Manuel Valls supported the prohibitions on Wednesday, calling the garment part of “the enslavement of women.”
2016-08-17.headline_main: Fighting for the ‘Soul of France,’ More Towns Ban a Bathing Suit: The Burkini

2016-08-17.abstract: “Women look at the full measure” of Mr. Trump, said Kellyanne Conway. I did just that.

2016-08-17.lead_paragraph: Kellyanne Conway was supposed to help Donald Trump appeal to women.
2016-08-17.headline_main: I Took Some Advice From Donald Trump’s New Campaign Manager

2016-08-17.abstract: Investigators said they found a weapon and obtained surveillance camera footage connecting Oscar Morel to the crime, but could not yet say why the attack occurred.
2016-08-17.snippet: Investigators said they found a weapon and obtained surveillance camera footage connecting Oscar Morel to the crime, but could not yet say why the attack occurred.
2016-08-17.lead_paragraph: Investigators said on Wednesday that they were certain the man charged with first-degree murder in the sidewalk killing of an imam and his assistant in Queens was the assailant, though they concede the motive for the attack remains a mystery.
2016-08-17.headline_main: New York Police Certain They Caught Imam’s Killer; Motive Still a Mystery

2016-08-17.abstract: Customers say they want to keep the right to sue, and the Consumer Financial Protection Bureau has proposed a ban on such moves by banks.
2016-08-17.snippet: Customers say they want to keep the right to sue, and the Consumer Financial Protection Bureau has proposed a ban on such moves by banks.
2016-08-17.lead_paragraph: Big banks are increasingly using the fine print of checking account agreements to restrict their customers’ ability to settle disputes in court, even though most consumers want to keep their legal options open.
2016-08-17.headline_main: More Big Banks Are Using Arbitration to Bar Customer Lawsuits

2016-08-17.abstract: Just as President Obama attacked Mitt Romney for paying a lower effective tax rate than most Americans, Mrs. Clinton said Mr. Trump’s plan would benefit people in his own bracket.
2016-08-17.snippet: Just as President Obama attacked Mitt Romney for paying a lower effective tax rate than most Americans, Mrs. Clinton said Mr. Trump’s plan would benefit people in his own bracket.
2016-08-17.lead_paragraph: Hillary Clinton leaned into her plans to raise taxes on the wealthiest Americans on Wednesday, denouncing Donald J. Trump’s tax proposals as a boondoggle for billionaires.
2016-08-17.headline_main: Hillary Clinton Twists the Knife in Donald Trump’s Tax Proposals

2016-08-17.abstract: The director of state-run Egyptian radio and television barred the women from appearing on the air for a month, and ordered them to go on a diet.
2016-08-17.snippet: The director of state-run Egyptian radio and television barred the women from appearing on the air for a month, and ordered them to go on a diet.
2016-08-17.lead_paragraph: CAIRO — Most Egyptian journalists have had to watch their tongues and tone down their reporting over the past three years to keep their jobs under a military-dominated government. Now, the state is ordering some women working as television anchors to practice a similar restraint with their weight.
2016-08-17.headline_main: Egypt Suspends 8 Female TV Anchors, Saying They Are Overweight

2016-08-17.abstract: Britain’s vote to leave the European Union sent many fund managers scrambling, but managers cite a number of factors that help explain how some avoided losses.
2016-08-17.snippet: Britain’s vote to leave the European Union sent many fund managers scrambling, but managers cite a number of factors that help explain how some avoided losses.
2016-08-17.lead_paragraph: LONDON — In late June, as Britons prepared to go to the polls to vote on the country’s membership in the European Union, about 800 hedge fund managers gathered at the opulent Cavalieri hotel on a hill overlooking Rome for an annual rite.
2016-08-17.headline_main: Hedge Funds Avoided Big Losses Despite ‘Brexit’ Shock

2016-08-17.abstract: The Syrian government and Russia are accused of using the bombs, which can cause horrific burns, in or near cities. Russia is part of a treaty banning them in civilians areas.
2016-08-17.snippet: The Syrian government and Russia are accused of using the bombs, which can cause horrific burns, in or near cities. Russia is part of a treaty banning them in civilians areas.
2016-08-17.lead_paragraph: BEIRUT, Lebanon — Syrian government aircraft hit the rebel-held Damascus suburb of Daraya with incendiary bombs for the third straight day on Wednesday, according to local council members, who said the weapons were packed with substances akin to napalm.
2016-08-17.headline_main: Syrian Government and Russia Are Accused of Using Napalm-Like Bombs

2016-08-18.abstract: Cosmetics should be rigorously tested, much as drugs already are, and as they already are in Europe.
2016-08-18.snippet: Cosmetics should be rigorously tested, much as drugs already are, and as they already are in Europe.
2016-08-18.lead_paragraph: You can’t legally buy a drug in the United States that hasn’t undergone rigorous testing, mandated by Congress, to prove that it’s safe and effective. By contrast, that lipstick, shampoo, or deodorant you use every day may have undergone no such testing.
2016-08-18.headline_main: Is Your Lipstick Bad for You?

2016-08-18.abstract: Inbee Park of South Korea is one shot behind the leader, Ariya Jutanugarn of Thailand, after the first round.
2016-08-18.snippet: Inbee Park of South Korea is one shot behind the leader, Ariya Jutanugarn of Thailand, after the first round.
2016-08-18.lead_paragraph: RIO DE JANEIRO — It looked like any other major tournament opener in women’s golf, with volunteers barking at people to silence their cellphones and caddies lining up the players for their shots. Upon closer inspection, the stark expressions of the players on the practice range and the duct tape covering sponsors’ names on their clothing served as reminders that the stakes are even higher this week at Reserva de Marapendi.
2016-08-18.headline_main: South Korean Dream Team Begins Its Quest for a Sweep in Women’s Golf

2016-08-18.abstract: A study finds that errors were made because earlier research linking genetic traits to illness did not include enough blacks.
2016-08-18.snippet: A study finds that errors were made because earlier research linking genetic traits to illness did not include enough blacks.
2016-08-18.lead_paragraph: Genetic tests for an inherited heart disorder are more likely to have incorrect results in black Americans than in whites, according to a new study that is likely to have implications for other minorities and other diseases, including cancer.
2016-08-18.headline_main: Genetic Tests for a Heart Disorder Mistakenly Find Blacks at Risk

2016-08-18.abstract: Happ, 17-3 after a road victory over the Yankees, already has five more wins than his previous best, which he recorded with the 2009 National League champion Phillies.
2016-08-18.snippet: Happ, 17-3 after a road victory over the Yankees, already has five more wins than his previous best, which he recorded with the 2009 National League champion Phillies.
2016-08-18.lead_paragraph: No pitcher has won as many games this season as J. A. Happ of the Toronto Blue Jays. A pitcher’s record can be misleading, of course, but a pattern emerges with time. For Happ, who improved to 17-3 by beating the Yankees on Wednesday, winning big had not been part of the pattern.
2016-08-18.headline_main: Blue Jays’ J. A. Happ Having Career Year as Majors’ Top Winner

2016-08-18.abstract: The acknowledgment came after a confidential report told the secretary general that the outbreak, which began in 2010, “would not have broken out but for the actions of the United Nations.”
2016-08-18.snippet: The acknowledgment came after a confidential report told the secretary general that the outbreak, which began in 2010, “would not have broken out but for the actions of the United Nations.”
2016-08-18.lead_paragraph: For the first time since a cholera epidemic believed to be imported by United Nations peacekeepers began killing thousands of Haitians nearly six years ago, the office of Secretary General Ban Ki-moon has acknowledged that the United Nations played a role in the initial outbreak and that a “significant new set of U.N. actions” will be needed to respond to the crisis.
2016-08-18.headline_main: U.N. Admits Role in Cholera Epidemic in Haiti

2016-08-18.abstract: An uneasy truce between the government and insurers appears to be fraying as some of the large companies say they are leaving or sharply scaling back.
2016-08-18.snippet: An uneasy truce between the government and insurers appears to be fraying as some of the large companies say they are leaving or sharply scaling back.
2016-08-18.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — Facing high-profile withdrawals from online insurance exchanges and surging premiums, the Obama administration is preparing a major push to enroll new participants into public marketplaces under the Affordable Care Act.
2016-08-18.headline_main: As Insurers Like Aetna Balk, U.S. Makes New Push to Bolster Health Care Act

2016-08-18.abstract: The secretary general, Ban Ki-moon, has ordered an independent inquiry into a spate of violence last month, including the rapes and beatings of foreign aid workers.
2016-08-18.snippet: The secretary general, Ban Ki-moon, has ordered an independent inquiry into a spate of violence last month, including the rapes and beatings of foreign aid workers.
2016-08-18.lead_paragraph: Alarmed over attacks that included the rapes and beatings of foreign aid workers by soldiers in South Sudan’s capital last month, the United Nations secretary general has ordered an inquiry into why the organization’s peacekeepers failed to stop the violence, his spokesman said on Wednesday.
2016-08-18.headline_main: U.N. Wants to Know Why Peacekeepers Did Not Stop Violence in South Sudan

2016-08-18.abstract: The Police Department and Mayor Bill de Blasio have endorsed putting officers on the streets to mingle with residents, in an effort to reduce crime and ease tensions.
2016-08-18.snippet: The Police Department and Mayor Bill de Blasio have endorsed putting officers on the streets to mingle with residents, in an effort to reduce crime and ease tensions.
2016-08-18.lead_paragraph: When Mayor Bill de Blasio introduced the next New York City police commissioner this month, he said he wanted someone who could make neighborhood policing a reality and help ease the distrust that persists between officers and residents in many predominately minority communities, like Far Rockaway in Queens.
2016-08-18.headline_main: Community Policing Expands in New York, but Some Question if It Works

2016-08-18.abstract: It has become clouded by a nearly two-decade-old case in which Mr. Parker was accused, and later acquitted, of raping a fellow student while at Penn State.
2016-08-18.snippet: It has become clouded by a nearly two-decade-old case in which Mr. Parker was accused, and later acquitted, of raping a fellow student while at Penn State.
2016-08-18.lead_paragraph: LOS ANGELES — It was supposed to be a corrective to #OscarsSoWhite. The blistering story of a slave revolt that was directed and written by a black artist, Nate Parker, who also stars in the lead role, “The Birth of a Nation” had been positioned as a balm for an industry long criticized for sidelining minorities.
2016-08-18.headline_main: ‘The Birth of a Nation,’ Nate Parker’s Heralded Film, Is Now Cloaked in Controversy

2016-08-18.abstract: Mr. Christie said New Jersey should dip into its own general fund to pay for projects because its Transportation Trust Fund was about to run out of money.
2016-08-18.snippet: Mr. Christie said New Jersey should dip into its own general fund to pay for projects because its Transportation Trust Fund was about to run out of money.
2016-08-18.lead_paragraph: With lawmakers in New Jersey at an impasse over transportation funding, Gov. Chris Christie on Wednesday ordered officials to use the state’s general fund to pay for “essential” transportation projects until the crisis is resolved.
2016-08-18.headline_main: Christie Orders Use of General Fund for ‘Essential’ Transportation Work

2016-08-18.abstract: Though his ventures into modernism put him at odds with Soviet cultural authorities in the post-Stalin era, the artist later created a monument for Khrushchev’s grave.
2016-08-18.snippet: Though his ventures into modernism put him at odds with Soviet cultural authorities in the post-Stalin era, the artist later created a monument for Khrushchev’s grave.
2016-08-18.lead_paragraph: Ernst Neizvestny, a sculptor whose ventures into modernism put him at odds with the Soviet cultural authorities and led to a memorable confrontation with Nikita S. Khrushchev in 1962, died on Aug. 9 in Stony Brook, N.Y. He was 91.
2016-08-18.headline_main: Ernst Neizvestny, a Russian Sculptor Who Clashed With Khrushchev, Dies at 91

2016-08-18.abstract: After a string of close victories, the Americans won easily in front of a raucous pro-Argentina crowd.
2016-08-18.snippet: After a string of close victories, the Americans won easily in front of a raucous pro-Argentina crowd.
2016-08-18.lead_paragraph: RIO DE JANEIRO — Argentine fans were irrepressible, bouncing up and down and back and forth across the stands, waving flags, imploring their compatriots to jump along, and singing that anyone who did not join the fun was Brazilian.
2016-08-18.headline_main: U.S. Basketball Team Muffles Argentines, if Not Their Fervent Fans

2016-08-18.abstract: Thompson, from Jamaica, finished ahead of Dafne Schippers of the Netherlands.
2016-08-18.snippet: Thompson, from Jamaica, finished ahead of Dafne Schippers of the Netherlands.
2016-08-18.lead_paragraph: RIO DE JANEIRO — Elaine Thompson of Jamaica won the 200 meters to complete a sprint double at the Rio Games.
2016-08-18.headline_main: Elaine Thompson Adds the 200 to Her 100 Crown

2016-08-18.abstract: Mr. Briggs’s parents originated the lawsuit that struck down public school segregation in 1954, though his name became a forgotten legal footnote.
2016-08-18.snippet: Mr. Briggs’s parents originated the lawsuit that struck down public school segregation in 1954, though his name became a forgotten legal footnote.
2016-08-18.lead_paragraph: Harry Briggs Jr., whose parents originated the pivotal lawsuit that struck down public school segregation in 1954, but whose name was relegated by fate to a forgotten legal footnote, died on Aug. 9 in the Bronx. He was 75.
2016-08-18.headline_main: Harry Briggs Jr., a Catalyst for Brown v. Board of Education, Dies at 75

2016-08-18.snippet: Parker Lewis and Jeff Chen show us what can happen when we play with words.
2016-08-18.lead_paragraph: THURSDAY PUZZLE — Have you ever stared at a word for so long that it stops looking like that word and starts to look like a completely different word?
2016-08-18.headline_main: It’s So Typical

2016-08-18.snippet: The fuel was responsible for 366,000 premature deaths in the country in 2013, Chinese and American researchers concluded.
2016-08-18.lead_paragraph: BEIJING — Burning coal has the worst health impact of any source of air pollution in China and caused 366,000 premature deaths in 2013, Chinese and American researchers said on Thursday.
2016-08-18.headline_main: Coal Burning Causes the Most Air Pollution Deaths in China, Study Finds

2016-08-18.abstract: A short poem about a bird on a wire, artfully posing on one leg.

2016-08-18.lead_paragraph: Dear Diary:
2016-08-18.headline_main: Blue Jay Dance Haiku

2016-08-18.snippet: The program, which expired in January, generated thousands of apartments for poor and moderate-income New Yorkers.
2016-08-18.lead_paragraph: The administration of Gov. Andrew M. Cuomo has offered developers and union officials a wage subsidy for construction workers in the hopes of reviving a dormant program that has generated thousands of apartments for poor and moderate-income New Yorkers, and saved property owners tens of millions of dollars in property taxes.
2016-08-18.headline_main: Cuomo Moves to Revive a Dormant Housing Aid Program

2016-08-18.abstract: Jimmy Feigen, Gunnar Bentz and Jack Conger all won gold medals in Rio.
2016-08-18.snippet: Jimmy Feigen, Gunnar Bentz and Jack Conger all won gold medals in Rio.
