2016-08-18.headline_main: Documenting Africa’s Rising Fashion Industry

2016-08-18.abstract: The Swedish-born photographer Per-Anders Pettersson has spent the last five years documenting the vibrant fashion scene across sub-Saharan African. For his new book, “African Catwalk,” he photographed more than 40 shows, giving viewers an insider’s perspective on a spectacle that often goes unseen.
2016-08-18.snippet: The Swedish-born photographer Per-Anders Pettersson has spent the last five years documenting the vibrant fashion scene across sub-Saharan African. For his new book, “African Catwalk,” he photographed more than 40 shows, giving viewers an insider’...
2016-08-18.lead_paragraph: Per-Anders Pettersson has spent the last five years documenting the vibrant fashion scene across sub-Saharan Africa. His new photography book, “African Catwalk,” is a visual survey of Africa’s emerging fashion industry, giving viewers an insider’s perspective on a transcontinental spectacle that often goes unseen.
2016-08-18.headline_main: Photographing Africa’s Fashion Elite

2016-08-18.abstract: For “African Catwalk,” the Swedish photographer Per-Anders Pettersson spent five years documenting the energy of Africa’s emerging fashion industry.
2016-08-18.snippet: For “African Catwalk,” the Swedish photographer Per-Anders Pettersson spent five years documenting the energy of Africa’s emerging fashion industry.
2016-08-18.lead_paragraph: It was a fashion show that stopped traffic.
2016-08-18.headline_main: Africa Takes Its Turn on the Runway

2016-08-18.abstract: These agreements impose silence on sexual harassment victims to protect the company, but this fosters the perception that they are really cover-ups.
2016-08-18.snippet: These agreements impose silence on sexual harassment victims to protect the company, but this fosters the perception that they are really cover-ups.
2016-08-18.lead_paragraph: Like many companies confronted with sexual harassment in their executive ranks, Fox News and its parent, 21st Century Fox, say they do not tolerate such behavior and have strict policies prohibiting it.
2016-08-18.headline_main: Secrecy of Settlements at Fox News Hid Bad Behavior

2016-08-18.abstract: The removal of the federation’s executive director, Karim Bouzidi, came after a handful of judges were sent home for making dubious decisions in some bouts.
2016-08-18.snippet: The removal of the federation’s executive director, Karim Bouzidi, came after a handful of judges were sent home for making dubious decisions in some bouts.
2016-08-18.lead_paragraph: RIO DE JANEIRO — The federation running the boxing tournament at the Olympics reassigned its executive director on Thursday, a day after a handful of judges were sent home for making questionable rulings in a few bouts.
2016-08-18.headline_main: AIBA Reassigns Official Overseeing Olympic Boxing Judges

2016-08-18.abstract: Pedals, an American black bear that walks upright, has stirred passions in northern New Jersey, where some want him put in a sanctuary and others think he should remain free.
2016-08-18.snippet: Pedals, an American black bear that walks upright, has stirred passions in northern New Jersey, where some want him put in a sanctuary and others think he should remain free.
2016-08-18.lead_paragraph: OAK RIDGE, N.J. — The first time Greg Macgowan’s wife saw the bear near their home, the upper half of the animal’s body was obscured by a neighbor’s deck. “She said, ‘Come here — there’s a guy in a bear suit,’” he recalled.
2016-08-18.headline_main: Debate in New Jersey: Is Bear That Walks Upright Suffering, or Thriving?

2016-08-18.abstract: Christopher Chen’s “Caught” emerged from the controversy of Mike Daisey’s “The Agony and the Ecstasy of Steve Jobs.”
2016-08-18.snippet: Christopher Chen’s “Caught” emerged from the controversy of Mike Daisey’s “The Agony and the Ecstasy of Steve Jobs.”
2016-08-18.lead_paragraph: The brouhaha over Mike Daisey, who admitted to fabricating details in his one-man play about Chinese factory workers, “The Agony and the Ecstasy of Steve Jobs,” led to a humbling backlash against the acclaimed writer-performer and innumerable essays.
2016-08-18.headline_main: Truth, Lies and Chinese Art Inspire ‘a Puzzle Box of a Play’

2016-08-18.abstract: Readers discuss the challenges Hillary Clinton faces in trying to lure supporters of both Bernie Sanders and Donald Trump.
2016-08-18.snippet: Readers discuss the challenges Hillary Clinton faces in trying to lure supporters of both Bernie Sanders and Donald Trump.
2016-08-18.lead_paragraph: To the Editor:
2016-08-18.headline_main: Hillary Clinton’s Campaign Choices

2016-08-18.abstract: Jason Greenstein fought off Hodgkin’s lymphoma with immunotherapy, but prolonged exposure to chemotherapy and radiation weakened his body. He died Aug. 10.
2016-08-18.snippet: Jason Greenstein fought off Hodgkin’s lymphoma with immunotherapy, but prolonged exposure to chemotherapy and radiation weakened his body. He died Aug. 10.
2016-08-18.lead_paragraph: I recently chronicled the story of Jason Greenstein and his battle against cancer. He was at the vanguard of a new kind of treatment that unleashes the immune system to fight the disease as it does infections caused by viruses and bacteria.
2016-08-18.headline_main: Immune System and Spirit Kept Cancer at Bay for a Year

2016-08-18.abstract: Jonah Hill and Miles Teller play 20-something entrepreneurs who plunge into the weaponry business and end up in over their heads.
2016-08-18.snippet: Jonah Hill and Miles Teller play 20-something entrepreneurs who plunge into the weaponry business and end up in over their heads.
2016-08-18.lead_paragraph: “Based on a true story,” the movie “War Dogs” says, and indeed it is. Which proves conclusively that truth is stranger than fiction.
2016-08-18.headline_main: Review: ‘War Dogs,’ an Absurd (and True) Gunrunning Tale

2016-08-18.abstract: Options range from eroticized hot dogs to an installation based on a sighting of the Virgin Mary.
2016-08-18.snippet: Options range from eroticized hot dogs to an installation based on a sighting of the Virgin Mary.
2016-08-18.headline_main: What to See in New York Art Galleries This Week

2016-08-18.abstract: The bans on full-body swimsuits are not primarily about protecting Muslim women from patriarchy, but about shielding France’s non-Muslims from a changing world.
2016-08-18.snippet: The bans on full-body swimsuits are not primarily about protecting Muslim women from patriarchy, but about shielding France’s non-Muslims from a changing world.
2016-08-18.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — There is something inherently head-spinning about the so-called burkini bans that are popping up in coastal France. The obviousness of the contradiction — imposing rules on what women can wear on the grounds that it’s wrong for women to have to obey rules about what women can wear — makes it clear that there must be something deeper going on.
2016-08-18.headline_main: France’s ‘Burkini’ Bans Are About More Than Religion or Clothing

2016-08-18.abstract: Josh Duhamel portrays the ballplayer Bill Lee at a stage when he is slowly realizing that his major-league days are over.
2016-08-18.snippet: Josh Duhamel portrays the ballplayer Bill Lee at a stage when he is slowly realizing that his major-league days are over.
2016-08-18.lead_paragraph: Anyone going to “Spaceman” with the expectation of seeing a version of the major league career of Bill Lee, the pitcher known by that nickname, will be frustrated, maybe even annoyed. The film is interested not in the heart of Lee’s career — he pitched for Boston and Montreal from 1969 to 1982 — but in the end of it, and the slow process of letting go of the glory days.
2016-08-18.headline_main: Review: In ‘Spaceman,’ a Pitcher Specializing in Brashness

2016-08-18.abstract: The pastel-hued landscapes in the Australian native Gina Nero’s “Leaving Hampton” series cast the city in a pretty, peaceful light.
2016-08-18.snippet: The pastel-hued landscapes in the Australian native Gina Nero’s “Leaving Hampton” series cast the city in a pretty, peaceful light.
2016-08-18.lead_paragraph: The pastel-hued landscapes in the Australian native Gina Nero’s “Leaving Hampton” series cast the city in a pretty, peaceful light.
2016-08-18.headline_main: One Photographer’s Cotton-Candy View of Los Angeles

2016-08-18.abstract: The shake-up of Mr. Trump’s campaign was set in motion by people and groups backed by the political action committee of a New York investor, Robert Mercer.
2016-08-18.snippet: The shake-up of Mr. Trump’s campaign was set in motion by people and groups backed by the political action committee of a New York investor, Robert Mercer.
2016-08-18.lead_paragraph: Last week, as Donald J. Trump endured one of the most tumultuous stretches of his presidential campaign, a few longtime allies in New York conservative circles met for dinner and a drink. As the evening progressed, the conversation turned to an inevitable topic: What would it take to give Mr. Trump his best shot at winning?
2016-08-18.headline_main: How One Family’s Deep Pockets Helped Reshape Donald Trump’s Campaign

2016-08-18.abstract: The change means users can log on to their online “mySocialSecurity” accounts as before, with just a username and password.
2016-08-18.snippet: The change means users can log on to their online “mySocialSecurity” accounts as before, with just a username and password.
2016-08-18.lead_paragraph: Never mind — at least, for now.
2016-08-18.headline_main: Social Security Retreats From Cellphone-Based Online Security

2016-08-18.abstract: This movie from Laika Films (“Coraline” and “ParaNorman”) combines stop-motion animation and computer-generated backgrounds with a moving and magical tale.
2016-08-18.snippet: This movie from Laika Films (“Coraline” and “ParaNorman”) combines stop-motion animation and computer-generated backgrounds with a moving and magical tale.
2016-08-18.lead_paragraph: “If you must blink, do it now” is the first line spoken in this stop-motion animated movie. It’s apt advice. “Kubo and the Two Strings” was made by Laika Films, the outfit behind such quirky and visually arresting pictures as “Coraline” (2009) and “ParaNorman” (2012). The action in “Kubo” begins at night, with a desperate woman at sea fighting off waves with her small boat and a shamisen (a Japanese three-stringed lute) imbued with magic powers.
2016-08-18.headline_main: Review: In ‘Kubo and the Two Strings,’ Origami Fuels an Animated Quest

2016-08-18.abstract: In his new travelogue, the musician Franz Nicolay writes about “the past and future of underground punk and rock in formerly Communist states.”
2016-08-18.snippet: In his new travelogue, the musician Franz Nicolay writes about “the past and future of underground punk and rock in formerly Communist states.”
2016-08-18.lead_paragraph: Musicians have written a nearly uncountable number of books in recent years. But unlike, say, Rod Stewart or Steven Tyler, Franz Nicolay refers to Montaigne, Tocqueville, V.S. Pritchett, Ford Madox Ford and Melville — and that’s just in a two-page stretch of the introduction to his new travelogue, “The Humorless ­Ladies of Border Control.”
2016-08-18.headline_main: Outside the Bars

2016-08-18.abstract: Works by the doomed Polish-Jewish artist Moshe Rynecki inspired his great-granddaughter Elizabeth Rynecki to write a book and make a documentary.
2016-08-18.snippet: Works by the doomed Polish-Jewish artist Moshe Rynecki inspired his great-granddaughter Elizabeth Rynecki to write a book and make a documentary.
2016-08-18.lead_paragraph: The last time anyone is known to have heard from the Polish-Jewish artist Moshe Rynecki was in 1943, when his wife, Perla, received a postcard that he had sent from Majdanek, a concentration camp near Lublin, Poland. The Nazis had transported him there from the smoldering ruins of the Jewish ghetto in Warsaw. The rest of his family had stayed in Warsaw, posing as Christians. His scrawled message reassured his wife that he was well and “painting in the camp,” his son, George Rynecki, recalled in a memoir written decades after the war.
2016-08-18.headline_main: A ‘Moral Imperative’ to Recover a Lost Art Legacy

2016-08-18.abstract: Unless you’re a fan of the hugely successful Final Fantasy video game series, this big-screen version is too ludicrous for words.
2016-08-18.snippet: Unless you’re a fan of the hugely successful Final Fantasy video game series, this big-screen version is too ludicrous for words.
2016-08-18.lead_paragraph: There’s a very real possibility that watching “Kingsglaive: Final Fantasy XV” could result in brain addlement. At least, that’s what it might feel like if you’ve so far managed to resist the lure of the long-running (29 years, no less), rampantly successful Final Fantasy video game franchise. Suffice to say, this spinoff from the story of a magical kingdom besieged by an evil empire is too ludicrous for words.
2016-08-18.headline_main: Review: ‘Kingsglaive: Final Fantasy XV,’ Where the Bad Guys Sport Silly Hats

2016-08-18.abstract: The century-old chair is part of the Museum of the City of New York’s show “From Teaspoons to Titanic: Recent Acquisitions.”
2016-08-18.snippet: The century-old chair is part of the Museum of the City of New York’s show “From Teaspoons to Titanic: Recent Acquisitions.”
2016-08-18.lead_paragraph: A century-old wooden deck chair from a sunken British ship might seem like an incongruous artifact to include in an exhibition of recently acquired objects by a New York history museum, except that this one was retrieved from the Titanic. New York, where the ship was to dock, was the final destination of about 200 of the 1,500 passengers who drowned in the disaster, and the first Senate hearings into the tragedy were held at the Waldorf-Astoria Hotel.
2016-08-18.headline_main: One Titanic Survivor Goes on View: A Deck Chair

2016-08-18.abstract: Mirai Konishi’s light documentary focuses on brewery experts and others who have devoted their lives to this complex rice-based beverage.
2016-08-18.snippet: Mirai Konishi’s light documentary focuses on brewery experts and others who have devoted their lives to this complex rice-based beverage.
2016-08-18.lead_paragraph: The title “Kampai! For the Love of Sake” — “kampai” is a Japanese toast — captures the essence of this crisp if feather-light documentary. The film, directed by Mirai Konishi, is the latest in a mini-genre (including “The Birth of Sake,” released in March, and “Wa-shoku,” from 2015) extolling Japanese cuisine, here again focusing on Japan’s best-known libation and profiling its experts.
2016-08-18.headline_main: Review: ‘Kampai! For the Love of Sake’ Celebrates Japan’s Best-Known Libation

2016-08-18.abstract: The Beach Sessions Dance Series is free, welcomes barefoot audience members and gives a sex doll a starring role.
2016-08-18.snippet: The Beach Sessions Dance Series is free, welcomes barefoot audience members and gives a sex doll a starring role.
2016-08-18.lead_paragraph: Anyone who has turned a cartwheel in the sand or sprinted along a shoreline can identify: Something about the beach feels invitingly kinetic.
2016-08-18.headline_main: In the Rockaways, Dancing by the Surf and Sand

2016-08-18.abstract: The first feature from Jayro Bustamante contrasts a quiet agrarian life in Guatemala with a hard-hitting tragedy.
2016-08-18.snippet: The first feature from Jayro Bustamante contrasts a quiet agrarian life in Guatemala with a hard-hitting tragedy.
2016-08-18.lead_paragraph: “Ixcanul” means “volcano” in the Kaqchikel language, and the title refers both to the peak that overlooks the Guatemalan coffee plantation where the film is set and to the eruptive emotions at the movie’s core. We see no hint of these, though, as we watch María (María Mercedes Coroy), a young Maya woman, and her parents work the land and care for their livestock. Their actions are languid and explicit; yet there’s a ritualistic precision to the way they slit a pig’s throat and scrape off its hair that’s more hypnotic than repellent.
2016-08-18.headline_main: Review: ‘Ixcanul,’ From Luminous Ritual to Emotional Explosions

2016-08-18.abstract: Ai Weiwei, the Chinese artist and dissident, uses his new freedom to travel to tell the stories of refugees in Lesbos.
2016-08-18.snippet: Ai Weiwei, the Chinese artist and dissident, uses his new freedom to travel to tell the stories of refugees in Lesbos.
2016-08-18.lead_paragraph: Ai Weiwei, the Chinese artist and dissident, is known for his films, sculptures and photography. Last July, the Chinese government returned Mr. Ai his passport after four years of detainment in Beijing. Since sharing the moment on his Instagram, Mr. Ai has been traveling — first moving to Germany, where he settled with his family, then to London in September for his single-artist show at the Royal Academy of Arts, and in January to Paris for an atrium and window display inside the Bon Marché department store.
2016-08-18.headline_main: On Instagram, the Artist Ai Weiwei Focuses on Refugees

2016-08-18.abstract: The mood of art in the ’80s was darkly rueful, as can be seen in an exhibit of work by Ross Bleckner, Eric Fischl and David Salle.
2016-08-18.snippet: The mood of art in the ’80s was darkly rueful, as can be seen in an exhibit of work by Ross Bleckner, Eric Fischl and David Salle.
2016-08-18.lead_paragraph: For contemporary art in America, the 1980s was an exciting if not lovable decade. Arguably it was second only to the 1960s for ambitious innovations of style and thought. Consider Julian Schnabel’s brawny Neo-Expressionist paintings, Cindy Sherman’s canny, staged self-portraits, Jeff Koons’s sumptuous sculptures of kitschy objects and Barbara Kruger’s suavely designed leftist agitprop: The ’80s abounded in eye- and mind-grabbing work.
2016-08-18.headline_main: Searching for Light in the Darkness of the ’80s

2016-08-18.abstract: Inspired by the career of a former F.B.I. agent who infiltrated white supremacist groups, the film may get moviegoers’ blood boiling.
2016-08-18.snippet: Inspired by the career of a former F.B.I. agent who infiltrated white supremacist groups, the film may get moviegoers’ blood boiling.
2016-08-18.lead_paragraph: Daniel Radcliffe might seem a long way from Hogwarts in “Imperium,” a bleak movie about an F.B.I. agent’s undercover foray into the world of neo-Nazis, but then again, maybe not. In the child-friendly “Harry Potter” films, Harry was perpetually doing battle against the wizarding world’s version of racism and a toxic hatred that seemed to grip those around him like a disease. The difference is that in “Imperium” his character, Nate Foster, doesn’t have magic to fall back on.
2016-08-18.headline_main: Review: Daniel Radcliffe Battles Homegrown Extremists in ‘Imperium’

2016-08-18.abstract: The aid group said it was leaving six hospitals because the Saudi-led military coalition could not provide assurances they would not be bombed again.
2016-08-18.snippet: The aid group said it was leaving six hospitals because the Saudi-led military coalition could not provide assurances they would not be bombed again.
2016-08-18.lead_paragraph: SANA, Yemen — Doctors Without Borders announced on Thursday that it would evacuate its staff from six hospitals in northern Yemen because it could not get assurances that its hospitals would not be bombed again.
2016-08-18.headline_main: Doctors Without Borders Is Pulling Staff After Hospital Bombings in Yemen

2016-08-18.abstract: As Uber pushes ahead with autonomous taxis, and trucking considers going driverless, too, millions of Americans’ driving jobs are at risk.
2016-08-18.snippet: As Uber pushes ahead with autonomous taxis, and trucking considers going driverless, too, millions of Americans’ driving jobs are at risk.
2016-08-18.lead_paragraph: Uber is steering its driverless vehicle technology toward a crash between robots and jobs. The private ride-hailing company, which was worth s $66 billion on Thursday, said that it had bought the autonomous big-rig start-up Otto and that it was unleashing driverless taxis in Pittsburgh. Putting computers instead of humans behind the wheel could save lives, but it would automate a task that employs millions of American workers. America’s safety net is ill-prepared for such a job-destroying juggernaut.
2016-08-18.headline_main: Uber Speeds Toward a Driverless Future, Putting Jobs in Danger

2016-08-18.abstract: A health official confirmed that the newly identified infections were contracted through suspected local transmission of the mosquito-borne virus.
2016-08-18.snippet: A health official confirmed that the newly identified infections were contracted through suspected local transmission of the mosquito-borne virus.
2016-08-18.lead_paragraph: MIAMI BEACH — A cluster of Zika cases most likely transmitted by local mosquitoes has been identified in Miami Beach, and federal and state officials are considering whether to advise pregnant women to avoid traveling to the city and possibly even all of Miami-Dade County, a health official said Thursday.
2016-08-18.headline_main: Miami Beach Zika Cases May Prompt Call to Avoid City

2016-08-18.abstract: Ms. Schumer, a champion of women’s causes, is being criticized for comments about women from Kurt Metzger, a contributor to her television show.
2016-08-18.snippet: Ms. Schumer, a champion of women’s causes, is being criticized for comments about women from Kurt Metzger, a contributor to her television show.
2016-08-18.lead_paragraph: In recent years, Amy Schumer has emerged as one of comedy’s biggest stars, a performer and writer who has used her visibility and Emmy Award-winning sketch series, “Inside Amy Schumer,” to call attention to a wide range of social issues that were once considered too uncomfortable to joke about, be they the chauvinistic depiction and discussion of women’s bodies in the media or the public’s unwillingness to believe sexual assault charges made against Bill Cosby.
2016-08-18.headline_main: A Writer for ‘Inside Amy Schumer’ Becomes a Thorn for the Star

2016-08-18.abstract: These digital anthologies will be sold on Pottermore, as well as on Amazon and other digital retailers, and will cost $2.99.
2016-08-18.snippet: These digital anthologies will be sold on Pottermore, as well as on Amazon and other digital retailers, and will cost $2.99.
2016-08-18.lead_paragraph: At the recent premiere in London of the play “Harry Potter and the Cursed Child,” J. K. Rowling insisted that she is really, truly, done with writing about Harry Potter.
2016-08-18.headline_main: J.K. Rowling Announces E-Book Series, ‘Pottermore Presents’

2016-08-18.abstract: This documentary focuses on the role of the National Rifle Association in blocking legislation to tighten gun laws.
2016-08-18.snippet: This documentary focuses on the role of the National Rifle Association in blocking legislation to tighten gun laws.
2016-08-18.lead_paragraph: Try watching a 4-year-old recount the night when his enraged father shot the little boy’s mother and grandfather in front of him. If there’s a stronger word than heartbreaking, it would be apt for that story and for the others told in “Making a Killing: Guns, Greed and the N.R.A.”
2016-08-18.headline_main: Review: In ‘Making a Killing,’ Guns Do Slay People, Children Included

2016-08-18.abstract: Dani Dayan, Israel’s consul general in New York, discusses his differences with Benjamin Netanyahu, his work with United States groups and the 2016 election.
2016-08-18.snippet: Dani Dayan, Israel’s consul general in New York, discusses his differences with Benjamin Netanyahu, his work with United States groups and the 2016 election.
2016-08-18.lead_paragraph: Dani Dayan is articulate and charming, a lively and provocative conversationalist. An immigrant from Argentina and a Spanish speaker, he is an Israeli settler from the West Bank, and the controversial former head of the settler movement.
2016-08-18.headline_main: Israel’s New Man in New York

2016-08-18.abstract: The film follows the West German prosecutor whose efforts to track down fugitive Nazi war criminals was often obstructed by superiors and underlings.
2016-08-18.snippet: The film follows the West German prosecutor whose efforts to track down fugitive Nazi war criminals was often obstructed by superiors and underlings.
2016-08-18.lead_paragraph: Fritz Bauer is a mass, and a mess, of contradictions: crafty yet principled, loyal yet friendless, brooding yet driven. Sometimes he charges ahead, other times he bumbles along, usually engulfed in a cloud of tobacco smoke. Burghart Klaussner, playing him in “The People vs. Fritz Bauer,” delivers a masterly performance as this complicated man.
2016-08-18.headline_main: Review: Treasonous Play for Justice in ‘The People vs. Fritz Bauer’

2016-08-18.abstract: Chronicling the tensions facing a Korean-American teenager, Andrew Ahn’s first feature contemplates the anxieties of outsiders trying to find their place in America.
2016-08-18.snippet: Chronicling the tensions facing a Korean-American teenager, Andrew Ahn’s first feature contemplates the anxieties of outsiders trying to find their place in America.
2016-08-18.lead_paragraph: Because David Cho (Joe Seo), the glum, bashful 18-year-old protagonist of “Spa Night,” is struggling with homosexual desire, it would be easy to categorize this cool, exquisitely observant first feature by the Korean-American filmmaker Andrew Ahn as a gay movie. But it is much more. The film is a contemplation of the loneliness, tension and anxiety of outsiders pursuing a piece of the American dream.
2016-08-18.headline_main: Review: Wrestling With Gay Identity and Parental Wishes in ‘Spa Night’

2016-08-18.abstract: Werner Herzog interviews experts and others about the internet, robots, artificial intelligence and other aspects of our technology-driven world.
2016-08-18.snippet: Werner Herzog interviews experts and others about the internet, robots, artificial intelligence and other aspects of our technology-driven world.
2016-08-18.lead_paragraph: “Lo and Behold, Reveries of the Connected World” is Werner Herzog’s documentary about the internet. For some readers, that sentence will be sufficient. One of our most intellectually ambitious filmmakers — a self-professed seeker of ecstatic truths, a tireless foot soldier of cinema — tackles what he calls “one of the greatest revolutions” humanity has experienced. The combination of Mr. Herzog’s doggedly curious sensibility and the mysteries of the digital universe seems both improbable and irresistible.
2016-08-18.headline_main: Review: ‘Lo and Behold,’ the Danger, and Potential, of the Digital Revolution

2016-08-18.abstract: The Justice Department cited a decline in federal prisoners and a critical recent report about safety and security problems in for-profit facilities.
2016-08-18.snippet: The Justice Department cited a decline in federal prisoners and a critical recent report about safety and security problems in for-profit facilities.
2016-08-18.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — The Obama administration said on Thursday that it would begin to phase out the use of private for-profit prisons to house federal inmates. The Bureau of Prisons had resorted to such prisons to ease overcrowding as the incarceration rate soared, but the number of federal inmates has been dropping since 2013.
2016-08-18.headline_main: U.S. to Phase Out Use of Private Prisons for Federal Inmates

2016-08-18.abstract: Two plays, Tom Holloway’s “And No More Shall We Part” and Wendy Wasserstein’s “An American Daughter,” close this theater festival’s season.
2016-08-18.snippet: Two plays, Tom Holloway’s “And No More Shall We Part” and Wendy Wasserstein’s “An American Daughter,” close this theater festival’s season.
2016-08-18.lead_paragraph: WILLIAMSTOWN, Mass. — A woman’s right to choose — how to live her life, or how to end it — provides an oblique theme linking the two plays that close the Williamstown Theater Festival season, which ends on Sunday.
2016-08-18.headline_main: Review: Women’s Hard Choices, Cutting Deep at Williamstown Festival

2016-08-18.abstract: Times readers debated the treatment of prisoners in America in response to a series of lawsuits against prisons without air-conditioning.
2016-08-18.snippet: Times readers debated the treatment of prisoners in America in response to a series of lawsuits against prisons without air-conditioning.
2016-08-18.lead_paragraph: For many Americans, the way prisoners are treated is a reflection of the national character.
2016-08-18.headline_main: Readers React: Should Air-Conditioning Be a Right for Prisoners?

2016-08-18.abstract: Timur Bekmambetov’s adaptation of the sword-and-sandals spectacle offers a rip-roaring chariot race but is largely devoid of pious posturing.
2016-08-18.snippet: Timur Bekmambetov’s adaptation of the sword-and-sandals spectacle offers a rip-roaring chariot race but is largely devoid of pious posturing.
2016-08-18.lead_paragraph: For any filmmaker foolhardy enough to embark on a remake of “Ben-Hur,” the kitschy 1959 sword-and-sandals epic that captured 11 Oscars and elevated Charlton Heston to Hollywood sainthood, the first order of business is to create a bigger and better version of that movie’s climactic chariot race.
2016-08-18.headline_main: Review: ‘Ben-Hur’ Is a Savage Update for a New Generation

2016-08-18.abstract: This new documentary series looks at bull riding through the 2015 season of a competitive league.
2016-08-18.snippet: This new documentary series looks at bull riding through the 2015 season of a competitive league.
2016-08-18.lead_paragraph: Superlatives fall like thudding hooves in the Netflix documentary series “Fearless,” available on Friday. Bull riding is “definitely the most dangerous sport in the world.” It’s “the fastest-growing sport in America.” Professional Bull Riders, whose 2015 season the series chronicles, is “a global phenomenon.”
2016-08-18.headline_main: Review: Netflix’s ‘Fearless’ Explores the World’s ‘Most Dangerous Sport’

2016-08-18.abstract: The count has long been long viewed as a measure of China’s rising global power, and an uneven showing in the Rio Games has smarted.
2016-08-18.snippet: The count has long been long viewed as a measure of China’s rising global power, and an uneven showing in the Rio Games has smarted.
2016-08-18.lead_paragraph: BEIJING — Even before the Olympic flame is extinguished in Rio de Janeiro, China is deep in debate about its showing in the Summer Games. Many Chinese are asking if the nation’s once insatiable appetite for medals has hit a limit.
2016-08-18.headline_main: Lower Medal Count in Rio Rattles China’s Olympics Obsession

2016-08-18.abstract: The future of the race, long organized by NYC Swim, was in question after this year’s scheduled event never happened. But another group stepped in to fill the void.
2016-08-18.snippet: The future of the race, long organized by NYC Swim, was in question after this year’s scheduled event never happened. But another group stepped in to fill the void.
2016-08-18.lead_paragraph: Just before 7 a.m. Monday, David Barra hopped onto a rock on the shoreline of the Hudson River to address an eager group of swimmers. Nearby, cars trickled across the George Washington Bridge, Amtrak trains rumbled past, and a faint breeze carried the sour scent of spilled beer from the patio of a waterfront bar.
2016-08-18.headline_main: Swim Around Manhattan Is Saved From a Future as Murky as Its Waters

2016-08-18.headline_main: Jill Soloway of ‘Transparent’ Aims to Challenge With ‘I Love Dick’ on Amazon

They were family members of Oscar Morel, the man charged with first-degree murder in the execution-style attack on an imam and his assistant on a sidewalk on Saturday afternoon.
2016-08-18.headline_main: Family of Man Charged in Killing of Queens Imam Insists He Is Innocent

2016-08-18.snippet: Physical clashes involving young refugees have become a focal point in state elections, and a test of the chancellor’s push for integration.
2016-08-18.lead_paragraph: ROSTOCK, Germany — As Germany grapples with integrating refugees, it seemed like a good idea: Take 15 newly arrived, unaccompanied minors, mix them in with German teenagers and scatter them in groups of two or three through empty apartments in revamped Communist-era housing blocks on the edge of this Baltic port city.
2016-08-18.headline_main: Far-Right Party Trades on Merkel’s Refugee Policies in Her Home State

2016-08-18.snippet: Though the charges against Brown were dropped, the N.F.L.’s personal conduct policy states a conviction is not required for a player to be disciplined.
2016-08-18.lead_paragraph: Giants kicker Josh Brown said Thursday he had been suspended for one game by the N.F.L. because of a domestic-violence arrest after an incident at home with his wife in 2015. Although the charges were dropped in the case, the N.F.L.’s personal-conduct policy states that a conviction is not required for a player to be disciplined by the league.
2016-08-18.headline_main: Giants Kicker Josh Brown Says Domestic-Violence Arrest Led to Suspension

2016-08-18.headline_main: Italian Banks Continue to Lend to Stagnant Companies as Debt Pile Mounts

2016-08-18.headline_main: Judge Overturns Uber’s Settlement With Drivers

2016-08-18.abstract: French officials should address the real terrorist threat, and not try to dictate to Muslim women what they may not wear.
2016-08-18.snippet: French officials should address the real terrorist threat, and not try to dictate to Muslim women what they may not wear.
2016-08-18.lead_paragraph: After bans on full-face veils, head scarves in schools and rules about students’ skirt lengths, France’s perennial problem with Muslim women’s attire has taken its most farcical turn yet with a new controversy over the “burkini,” body-covering swimwear whose name is an amalgam of burqa and bikini. As of Thursday, five French mayors had banned the burkini, calling it, variously, a threat to public order, hygiene, water safety and morality, tantamount to a new weapon of war against the French republic. Thierry Migoule, an official with the city of Cannes, the first to ban the burkini, declared the swimwear “clothing that conveys an allegiance to the terrorist movements that are waging war against us.”
2016-08-18.headline_main: France’s Burkini Bigotry

2016-08-18.lead_paragraph: The American economy is finally creating more middle-income jobs, according to a new analysis released Thursday by the Federal Reserve Bank of New York, in a turnabout from the feast-and-famine pattern earlier in the recovery, when hiring was strongest at the bottom and top of the wage scale.
2016-08-18.headline_main: Middle-Income Jobs Finally Show Signs of a Rebound

2016-08-19.abstract: Mayor Bill de Blasio said the spending was an effort to combat an unequal system in which parks in poorer neighborhoods were disregarded.
2016-08-19.snippet: Mayor Bill de Blasio said the spending was an effort to combat an unequal system in which parks in poorer neighborhoods were disregarded.
2016-08-19.lead_paragraph: Mayor Bill de Blasio on Thursday announced that he would spend $150 million to upgrade five large New York parks — $30 million to one in each borough — in what he called an effort to combat an unequal system in which parks in wealthier parts of the city were well financed while those in poorer neighborhoods were neglected.

While Phelps adhered to a regimented existence in the athletes’ village in Beijing, Lochte made himself sick gorging on free Big Macs.

2016-08-19.lead_paragraph: The emotional high point of “The Nightly Show With Larry Wilmore” on Thursday night — the moment that resonated — belonged to the host’s former boss, Jon Stewart. Dropping by to support Mr. Wilmore on the final episode of his Comedy Central series, which was abruptly canceled this week, Mr. Stewart said, “What you were tasked to do, you have done and done beautifully.” This, Mr. Stewart said, was to provide a forum for “underserved voices.”

Bowe Bergdahl, who is accused of being an Army deserter and is being prosecuted in military court, and Nasean Bonie, a former building superintendent in the Bronx who was recently convicted of killing a tenant, have little in common. 2016-08-19.lead_paragraph: Yesterday, the waves on the lake were as muscular, as quick, as white-capped as any I’ve seen in the five summers we’ve been renting a house in Douglas, Mich., on the state’s southwestern shore. The vast blue expanse of Lake Michigan can be especially daunting on a windy day, here at the edges. Forbidding, even.

2016-08-19.abstract: After a disappointing London Olympics, the triathlete Gwen Jorgensen began working on her mental race, adopting visualization techniques, mindfulness exercises and other mental strategies to prepare her for the Rio Olympics.
2016-08-19.snippet: After a disappointing London Olympics, the triathlete Gwen Jorgensen began working on her mental race, adopting visualization techniques, mindfulness exercises and other mental strategies to prepare her for the Rio Olympics.
2016-08-19.lead_paragraph: When the Olympic triathlete Gwen Jorgensen was competing in London four years ago, an unexpected flat tire at mile 13 rattled her to the core. Her hands were shaking as she rushed over to the mechanical pit, and it took her a moment to calm down and explain the situation before getting the repair and jumping back in the race. A medal contender at the start, she settled for a devastating 38th-place finish.
2016-08-19.headline_main: For the Olympian Gwen Jorgensen, the Triathlon is a Mental Race

2016-08-19.abstract: Reveal everything. Keep your romantic interests American.
2016-08-19.snippet: Reveal everything. Keep your romantic interests American.
2016-08-19.lead_paragraph: “Withholding information from us will not work in your favor,” says Ronald S. Patrick, deputy director of talent development at the Central Intelligence Agency, which receives up to 150,000 résumés a year. Applicants who are offered a job go through a monthslong security clearance, including an intense background check. To pass, you can’t have been convicted of a felony (“That’s a showstopper for us”); also, no recent illegal drug use. You will be asked about drugs in the application. Tell the truth. “We don’t expect you to be shockingly, squeaky clean,” Patrick says. “We expect you to have lived a life, to have exercised bad judgment, to have gone through adolescence and made mistakes.”
2016-08-19.headline_main: How to Pass a C.I.A. Background Check

2016-08-19.abstract: Edward Cheserek came to the United States from Kenya with hopes of competing in the Olympics — if only he could become a citizen.
2016-08-19.snippet: Edward Cheserek came to the United States from Kenya with hopes of competing in the Olympics — if only he could become a citizen.
2016-08-19.lead_paragraph: On a blustery Sunday in late March, Edward Cheserek reclined in a leather chair and narrated his journey through the aftermath of a Kenyan monsoon. We were sitting in a corner athletic-department conference room at the University of Oregon, Eugene, overlooking Hayward Field, which steamed in the rain, as track and field’s Fenway Park ought to. The room was carpeted in Ducks green and everywhere decorated with the competitive grimaces of Oregon’s many famed distance runners. Across from me was its latest star, a 22-year-old senior from Kenya, who sat pecking at his iPhone, a leg dangling over the chair arm.
2016-08-19.headline_main: Why Is the Country’s Most Dominant Distance Runner Not in Rio?

2016-08-19.abstract: How my daughter’s admiration of Olympic brawn made me finally embrace my own.
2016-08-19.snippet: How my daughter’s admiration of Olympic brawn made me finally embrace my own.
2016-08-19.lead_paragraph: On Day 3 of the 31st Olympiad, I sat on the couch with my 11-year-old daughter and watched the Hungarian swimmer Katinka Hosszu — a.k.a. the Iron Lady — roll out onto the pool deck like the assassin that she is. The woman is tough as nails, in her body and her mind. She knifed into the water; her back and shoulders exploded; she won gold in the 100-meter backstroke. Among her mottos is this: “The problem is not the problem. The problem is your attitude toward the problem.”
2016-08-19.headline_main: Seeing What My Muscles Can Do

2016-08-19.abstract: Market shifts and exits of large insurers are leaving Obamacare customers with no-frills plans that limit their choices of doctors and hospitals.
2016-08-19.snippet: Market shifts and exits of large insurers are leaving Obamacare customers with no-frills plans that limit their choices of doctors and hospitals.
2016-08-19.lead_paragraph: When Obamacare was developed, one goal was to allow middle-class Americans to use the new marketplaces to buy the same kind of health insurance they had at their jobs. People could retire early, or quit a corporate job and become a freelancer, and still have the great care and financial protection that come with high-end plans.
2016-08-19.headline_main: Think Your Obamacare Plan Will Be Like Employer Coverage? Think Again

2016-08-19.abstract: A publishing professional’s plan to pursue a manual trade is hampered when the boss is dealt a personal blow that requires extra support in the office.
2016-08-19.snippet: A publishing professional’s plan to pursue a manual trade is hampered when the boss is dealt a personal blow that requires extra support in the office.
2016-08-19.lead_paragraph: I have a two-part question, related to a major career shift. Specifically, I want to leave the publishing business to pursue a manual trade. It’s something I’ve wanted to do for a long time, but I’ve been scared because of cultural pressure to stick with a more staid, office-based career. And I still wonder: Is this a crazy change to make?
2016-08-19.headline_main: When Loyalty Delays a Career Change

2016-08-19.abstract: A chance conversation about love in Melbourne.
2016-08-19.snippet: A chance conversation about love in Melbourne.
2016-08-19.lead_paragraph: From the age of 39 to 51, I have worked as a kitchen hand. It hasn’t been such a bad way to make a living. It has afforded me time to walk about, meet people, write, read, listen to music, watch movies, practice my golf swing. It has always been my wish that one day I might have a companion in life, but as yet that hasn’t happened.
2016-08-19.headline_main: The Plum Eater

2016-08-19.abstract: The architecture critic Blair Kamin’s new project explores the history and meaning of the 25 gates surrounding Harvard Yard in Cambridge, Mass.
2016-08-19.snippet: The architecture critic Blair Kamin’s new project explores the history and meaning of the 25 gates surrounding Harvard Yard in Cambridge, Mass.
2016-08-19.lead_paragraph: To Blair Kamin, the Pulitzer Prize-winning architecture critic of The Chicago Tribune, the wrought-iron gates that ring the campus green at Harvard University in Cambridge, Mass., are more than decorative. They are storytellers through design and time capsules of university history, which he and the students he taught as a fellow at the school’s Nieman Foundation for Journalism explore in the book “Gates of Harvard Yard” (Princeton Architectural Press). Its thoughtful essays examine the 25 gates surrounding the yard, popular with tourists as well as students, alumni and staff. The following are excerpts from an interview with Mr. Kamin, the editor of the book.
2016-08-19.headline_main: The Gates at Harvard Have Stories to Tell

2016-08-19.lead_paragraph: How different are whisky and coffee? Yes, one gets you drunk, and the other wakes you up. But they also linger in different ways.

2016-08-19.abstract: Residents voted to move Shishmaref from a barrier island that has been disappearing because of erosion and flooding attributed to global warming.
2016-08-19.snippet: Residents voted to move Shishmaref from a barrier island that has been disappearing because of erosion and flooding attributed to global warming.
2016-08-19.lead_paragraph: Residents of a small Alaskan village voted this week to relocate their entire community from a barrier island that has been steadily disappearing because of erosion and flooding attributed to climate change.
2016-08-19.headline_main: Reeling From Effects of Climate Change, Alaskan Village Votes to Relocate

2016-08-19.abstract: I reject our unquestioned alignment with the G.O.P.
2016-08-19.snippet: I reject our unquestioned alignment with the G.O.P.
2016-08-19.lead_paragraph: Many well-intentioned evangelicals have been drawn to the Republican Party platform with the hope of making an impact on culture and voting their values. But instead of actually helping fill in “the hole in our gospel,” as Richard Stearns describes in his book of the same title, this focus has had the opposite effect, helping to create the imploding black hole of evangelical politics we are seeing now in the Republican party. As painful as this has been to watch, this may be the best thing that has happened to American evangelism in a long time.
2016-08-19.headline_main: A Challenge To My Fellow Evangelicals

2016-08-19.lead_paragraph: RIO DE JANEIRO — Ryan Lochte, the 12-time Olympic medal winner who claimed to have been robbed here last weekend by men identifying themselves as police officers, issued an apology on Friday “for my behavior” in an episode that has cast a pall over the Games.
2016-08-19.headline_main: Ryan Lochte Apologizes ‘for My Behavior’ After Rio Robbery Claim

2016-08-19.snippet: Lochte apologized for not being more candid in how he described an altercation at a gas station over the weekend in Rio. The American swimmer is accused of making false claims.
2016-08-19.lead_paragraph: RIO DE JANEIRO — The American swimmers Ryan Lochte, Jimmy Feigen, Jack Conger and Gunnar Bentz left a lavish Olympics party hosted by the French authorities early Sunday morning. They got into a taxi for the ride across Rio de Janeiro to their lodgings in the athletes’ village. What happened next has been the subject of intense police scrutiny, diplomatic debate and widespread criticism — first for Rio’s crime problems, and then for the behavior of the four American athletes.

2016-08-19.lead_paragraph: ROME — Roberto Saviano’s best-selling 2007 book, “Gomorrah,” his reportage about the Neapolitan crime syndicate the Camorra, was dark. Matteo Garrone’s award-winning 2009 film adaptation  was darker. And the hit Italian television series of the same name is by far the darkest.

2016-08-19.abstract: Several stories in this issue make the case for having fewer things — not on economic or environmental grounds, but for reasons of aesthetics.
2016-08-19.snippet: Several stories in this issue make the case for having fewer things — not on economic or environmental grounds, but for reasons of aesthetics.
2016-08-19.lead_paragraph: A desire to have fewer things in our lives can be seen in phenomena as diverse as the decline in luxury spending and the cult success of the decluttering superstar Marie Kondo. Whether we’re buying fewer things or just bidding thanks and adieu to things we already own that fail to “spark joy” in us, we seem, collectively, to feel we need less. Which, of course, is true.

They want to play handball. They need to play handball.

2016-08-19.abstract: Also, an employee with body odor, disrespectful customers and dealing with wedding catering that has gone very wrong.
2016-08-19.snippet: Also, an employee with body odor, disrespectful customers and dealing with wedding catering that has gone very wrong.
2016-08-19.lead_paragraph: I am about to be a senior in high school, and I’m gay. No one knows except my best friend, a straight girl. She keeps telling me to come out, saying it’s the courageous thing to do. But my parents, unlike hers, are extremely conservative and religious. (I’ve heard my mother say that gay people can change if they want to.) I want to be brave, and I know the world is better now for gay men and lesbians. But I don’t want to be thrown out of the house. What should I do?
2016-08-19.headline_main: Coming Out to His Conservative Parents: Is It Time?

2016-08-19.abstract: In Michael Koryta’s latest nightmare, a self-anointed messiah is preparing to shut down the electrical grid supplying energy to half the country.
2016-08-19.snippet: In Michael Koryta’s latest nightmare, a self-anointed messiah is preparing to shut down the electrical grid supplying energy to half the country.
2016-08-19.lead_paragraph: Welcome to Michael Koryta’s latest nightmare. In RISE THE DARK (Little, Brown, $26), Eli Pate, a self-anointed messiah capable of calling up a homegrown army of “more than 200 heavily armed and deeply paranoid white men,” is preparing to shut down the electrical grid supplying energy to half the country. (“Good night, Seattle. Good night, Portland.”) Very few, very brave linemen have the nerve and technical skills to pull off this feat. One of them is Jay Baldwin from Red Lodge, Mont., and to ensure his participation Eli’s confederates are holding Jay’s wife hostage. “When darkness fell, chaos would reign,” and Eli intends to be “the man who controlled the chaos.”
2016-08-19.headline_main: The Latest and Best in Crime Fiction

2016-08-19.abstract: With little more than two months until Election Day, three of the top five spots on the hardcover nonfiction list are occupied by anti-Clinton books.
2016-08-19.snippet: With little more than two months until Election Day, three of the top five spots on the hardcover nonfiction list are occupied by anti-Clinton books.
2016-08-19.lead_paragraph: Election Fever Dream: If Hillary Clinton did not exist, conservative writers would have to invent her — if, that is, they wanted to continue churning out best sellers. With little more than two months until Election Day, three of the top five spots on the hardcover nonfiction list are occupied by anti-Clinton books: Gary J. Byrne’s “Crisis of Character” (with Grant M. Schmidt) at No. 5; Dinesh D’Souza’s “Hillary’s America” at No. 4; and “Armageddon,” by Dick Morris and Eileen McGann, at No. 3. Morris, of course, was Bill Clinton’s political adviser and chief campaign strategist during the 1990s, and he and McGann, his wife, have written other negative treatises about the Clintons with the zeal of converts. Morris resigned from Bill Clinton’s 1996 re-­election campaign after a tabloid revealed Morris’s affair with a prostitute; he has since become the chief political commentator and correspondent for The National Enquirer.
2016-08-19.headline_main: Inside the List

2016-08-19.abstract: Composers are now often asked to respond to an old master’s work with one of their own. Not everyone is happy with the growing practice.
2016-08-19.snippet: Composers are now often asked to respond to an old master’s work with one of their own. Not everyone is happy with the growing practice.
2016-08-19.lead_paragraph: “Composers have always wanted to fondle the pieces that they love,” John Adams, of “Nixon in China” fame, said in a recent interview. They have long borrowed from their predecessors: quoted them, evoked them, effaced them, mocked them. They have transcribed them, orchestrated them, built sets of variations from their seeds. They have tried to build on them, forget them, ignore them.
2016-08-19.headline_main: Got a Classic Piece? Here Comes the Sequel.

2016-08-19.abstract: The unbearable sluggishness of conventional economic wisdom.
2016-08-19.snippet: The unbearable sluggishness of conventional economic wisdom.
2016-08-19.lead_paragraph: Larry Summers has a very nice essay that takes off from a new paper by John Williams at the San Francisco Fed, which is noteworthy because Williams is the highest-placed Fed official yet to suggest that maybe the inflation target should be higher. It’s not a new argument – see, for example, my paper for the ECB in 2014, but seeing it come from a senior official is news.
2016-08-19.headline_main: Slow Learners

2016-08-19.abstract: Amid a housing crisis, the Lower Manhattan businesses serve as an unlikely safety net, where people pay as little as $7 a night for a roof over their heads.
2016-08-19.snippet: Amid a housing crisis, the Lower Manhattan businesses serve as an unlikely safety net, where people pay as little as $7 a night for a roof over their heads.
2016-08-19.lead_paragraph: At the beginning of the millennium, the internet cafe was a beacon of the future. But now, amid a lack of affordable housing and a surge in homelessness in New York City, these vestiges of the dot-com boom have become an unlikely safety net, where people pay as little as $7 a night for a roof over their heads. On any given evening in the few remaining 24-hour cybercafes in Manhattan’s Chinatown, chairs are filled with the exhausted bodies of those who have lived there for weeks or months — or by some accounts, even years.
2016-08-19.headline_main: New Flophouses: Chinatown’s Internet Cafes

2016-08-19.abstract: A white 19-year-old college student was arrested after being accused of killing two strangers and chewing on one victim’s face. But activists say if the suspect were black, he would not have survived.
2016-08-19.snippet: A white 19-year-old college student was arrested after being accused of killing two strangers and chewing on one victim’s face. But activists say if the suspect were black, he would not have survived.
2016-08-19.lead_paragraph: While investigators in Florida are struggling to understand what prompted an attacker to approach two strangers this week, stab and beat them to death, and then chew on one victim’s face, many activists see racial bias in the way the police treated the suspect, a white 19-year-old college student.
2016-08-19.headline_main: Activists See Racial Bias in Suspect’s Treatment After Gruesome Florida Killing

2016-08-19.abstract: Mr. Varella and Ms. Junqueira spend some time relaxing with their two sons, but most of their day is devoted to running their Brazilian eatery, Beach Bistro 96.
2016-08-19.snippet: Mr. Varella and Ms. Junqueira spend some time relaxing with their two sons, but most of their day is devoted to running their Brazilian eatery, Beach Bistro 96.
2016-08-19.lead_paragraph: The sweethearts of the Rockaway food scene this summer, Carlos Varella and Andressa Junqueira, run the Brazilian restaurant Beach Bistro 96 out of a spruced-up shanty virtually within earshot of the surf. Their corner often resembles a cocktail party for the scantily clad, as guests wait for orders, or a seat inside. “Everyone likes to be there. The music is very nice. We play bossa nova,” said Ms. Junqueira, 33. She and Mr. Varella, 42, are Brazilian but met in Mexico City while working as models (Ms. Junqueira is still a model). The couple live with their sons, Nicolas, 8, and Kalani, 8 months, in an apartment near the restaurant. For this interview, Ms. Junqueira did the talking.
2016-08-19.headline_main: How Carlos Varella and Andressa Junqueira, Rockaways Restaurateurs, Spend Their Sundays

2016-08-19.abstract: The showy and delicate Queen Anne’s lace, also known as wild carrot, may bloom best after furious thundershowers on a hot and muggy day.
2016-08-19.snippet: The showy and delicate Queen Anne’s lace, also known as wild carrot, may bloom best after furious thundershowers on a hot and muggy day.
2016-08-19.lead_paragraph: In the intense heat of midsummer, abandoned fields and untrimmed roadsides sometimes quite unexpectedly burst into flower. Perhaps it is August’s furious thundershowers that provide the environmental cue, but many plants put on their best show when it is 90 degrees and muggy. Even heat-stressed New Yorkers stop to stare at these free pop-up shows. And from their expressions, it is quite likely the first time they have noticed a particular forsaken lot in its profuse bloom.
2016-08-19.headline_main: Queen Anne’s Lace: New York’s Midsummer Snowflakes

2016-08-19.abstract: Vernon Benjamin’s anecdotal travelogue has a rich cast of characters, including Tawana Brawley, the Rosenbergs, the Gish sisters and Grandma Moses.
2016-08-19.snippet: Vernon Benjamin’s anecdotal travelogue has a rich cast of characters, including Tawana Brawley, the Rosenbergs, the Gish sisters and Grandma Moses.
2016-08-19.lead_paragraph: Think of “The History of the Hudson River Valley From the Civil War to Modern Times” (The Overlook Press, $45) less as a commonplace chronological history than as a thematic collection of illustrative postcards sent by Vernon Benjamin, a former journalist who has lectured at Bard and Marist Colleges.
2016-08-19.headline_main: The Majestic Hudson and Its Valley’s Colorful Denizens

2016-08-19.lead_paragraph: A few weeks before she was to be married, Terri Nowak, her sister and a cousin left Duluth, Minn., for a bachelorette weekend to the Boundary Waters Canoe Area  in the northern part of the state, a place with lakes with names like Saganaga, Fall, Sucker, Moose and Newfound. Their journey’s focus was Basswood Lake, a choice Ms. Nowak said had been inspired by an old photo of their paternal grandfather in which he stands before what is believed to be the oldest tree in the state.
2016-08-19.headline_main: Working Through Their Issues, One Lake at a Time

2016-08-19.snippet: Rebuffing an offer from Enterprise Products all but invites two investors to lobby again to oust Alan Armstrong, the Williams chief executive.
2016-08-19.lead_paragraph: Ignoring an approach from a pipeline rival could stir an activist hornets’ nest at the Williams Companies. The company, a $21 billion pipeline operator fresh off a failed merger with Energy Transfer, chose not to respond to an offer from the larger Enterprise Products Partners this summer, Reuters reported on Thursday. The rebuff all but invites two investors who joined a board exodus in June to lobby again to oust Alan Armstrong, the Williams chief executive.
2016-08-19.headline_main: Rejection of Takeover Bid at Williams May Stir Up Activists

2016-08-19.lead_paragraph: It was a simple gesture captured in a photograph: Malcolm Turnbull, the prime minister of Australia, leaning over and placing money in the paper cup of a homeless man in Melbourne this week.

2016-08-19.abstract: A “red gene” that originated from dinosaurs gives some birds and turtles special color vision, allowing them to see differences in shades that aren’t detectable to humans.
2016-08-19.snippet: A “red gene” that originated from dinosaurs gives some birds and turtles special color vision, allowing them to see differences in shades that aren’t detectable to humans.
2016-08-19.lead_paragraph: You may see red, but you can’t see it like some birds and turtles or the ancient “eagle-lizards” from which they came. According to a study published this month in Proceedings of the Royal Society B, a “red gene” that originated from dinosaurs isn’t just responsible for the red patterns on some birds and some turtles. It also gives them special color vision, allowing them to see differences in shades of red that aren’t detectable to humans.
2016-08-19.headline_main: Some Turtles See Red Better Than You Do

2016-08-19.abstract: Their parents sing for Australian finches when they are about to hatch, and it somehow helps them thrive in high temperatures.
2016-08-19.snippet: Their parents sing for Australian finches when they are about to hatch, and it somehow helps them thrive in high temperatures.
2016-08-19.lead_paragraph: Though some overachieving parents read and play Mozart to their unborn babies, there is little scientific evidence to suggest that children gain long-term benefits if you expose them to certain sounds before birth.
2016-08-19.headline_main: Bird Song Found to Somehow Protect Babies From High Temperatures

2016-08-19.abstract: Even after a series of deadly attacks that killed Yemeni civilians, Washington’s support remains unwavering.
2016-08-19.snippet: Even after a series of deadly attacks that killed Yemeni civilians, Washington’s support remains unwavering.
2016-08-19.lead_paragraph: In the span of four days earlier this month, the Saudi Arabia-led coalition in Yemen bombed a Doctors Without Borders-supported hospital, killing 19 people; a school, where 10 children, some as young as 8, died; and a vital bridge over which United Nations food supplies traveled, punishing millions.
2016-08-19.headline_main: Saudi Arabia Kills Civilians, the U.S. Looks the Other Way

2016-08-19.abstract: Our chief classical music critic on the Mostly Mozart Festival’s concert performances of “Idomeneo” and “Così Fan Tutte.”
2016-08-19.snippet: Our chief classical music critic on the Mostly Mozart Festival’s concert performances of “Idomeneo” and “Così Fan Tutte.”
2016-08-19.lead_paragraph: Over the last few summers, Lincoln Center’s Mostly Mozart Festival has become an innovative presenter of staged opera. There were miraculously inventive productions of Mozart’s “Don Giovanni” and “Le Nozze di Figaro” directed and conducted by Ivan Fischer, featuring his crack Budapest Festival Orchestra. Last summer, the festival gave the American stage premiere of George Benjamin’s “Written on Skin,” the most important new opera in years.
2016-08-19.headline_main: Who Needs Sets or Fancy Costumes for These Mozart Operas?

2016-08-19.abstract: Artists and collectors flock to Guild Hall’s summer gala, while a new benefit helps Asian elephants.

2016-08-19.abstract: Few places in America offer such a simple electoral calculus as West Virginia, where voters support Mr. Trump for his promise to “bring back coal.”
2016-08-19.snippet: Few places in America offer such a simple electoral calculus as West Virginia, where voters support Mr. Trump for his promise to “bring back coal.”
2016-08-19.lead_paragraph: POWELLTON, W.Va. — Deep in the belly of an Appalachian mountain, a powerful machine bored into the earth, its whirring teeth clawing out a stream of glistening coal. Men followed inside the Maple Eagle No. 1 mine, their torches cutting through the dank air. One guided the machine with a PlayStation-like controller; others bolted supports in the freshly cut roof.
2016-08-19.headline_main: Alienated and Angry, Coal Miners See Donald Trump as Their Only Choice

2016-08-19.abstract: Artists and collectors flock to Guild Hall’s summer gala, while a new benefit helps Asian elephants.
2016-08-19.snippet: Artists and collectors flock to Guild Hall’s summer gala, while a new benefit helps Asian elephants.
2016-08-19.lead_paragraph: There’s something new on the Hamptons charity circuit. Trunks of Love, benefiting Asian elephants and spotlighting the work of Veterinarians International, honored Christie Brinkley and Richard Lair on Aug. 12 at the Baker House. Also that night, Guild Hall drew artists like Chuck Close and Cindy Sherman to its gala. The action migrated from the arts center to nearby Mulford Farm, where the dancing went late.
2016-08-19.headline_main: Christie Brinkley, Cindy Sherman and Chuck Close Take to the Hamptons Circuit

2016-08-19.abstract: The talks underline how difficult it has become to operate in the ride-hailing market, where people can book rides from drivers through a smartphone app.
2016-08-19.snippet: The talks underline how difficult it has become to operate in the ride-hailing market, where people can book rides from drivers through a smartphone app.

2016-08-19.abstract: After the killing of an imam and his assistant, District Attorney Richard A. Brown had to file defensible charges while also addressing the anxieties and fears of the Muslim community.

2016-08-19.lead_paragraph: In a brief statement this week about the still mysterious murders of a Bangladeshi imam and his assistant, the Queens district attorney, Richard A. Brown, captured, perhaps unwittingly, the dueling imperatives a prosecutor faces in a case that strikes at an entire community.
2016-08-19.headline_main: Detached but Sympathetic: Prosecutor’s Dual Response to Imam’s Killing

2016-08-19.abstract: The actor and his girlfriend, Emily Smith, live in a one-bedroom near Lincoln Center.
2016-08-19.snippet: The actor and his girlfriend, Emily Smith, live in a one-bedroom near Lincoln Center.
2016-08-19.lead_paragraph: New York apartments are notoriously short on space. A dedicated guest room is a luxury few can afford; the default solution is a sofa bed. It’s generally an afterthought, it’s generally uncomfortable, and maybe that’s exactly the point.
2016-08-19.headline_main: Steve Guttenberg’s Little Home in the Sky

2016-08-19.snippet: Even 1-year-olds know that our food choices depend on our social or cultural group.
2016-08-19.lead_paragraph: You may not be surprised to learn that food preference is a social matter. What we choose to eat depends on more than just what tastes good or is healthful. People in different cultures eat different things, and within a culture, what you eat can signal something about who you are.
2016-08-19.headline_main: Babies Watching People Eat

2016-08-19.abstract: Madelyn Gould, a Columbia University professor, is hoping to stem the tide of a major public health threat to young people.
2016-08-19.snippet: Madelyn Gould, a Columbia University professor, is hoping to stem the tide of a major public health threat to young people.
2016-08-19.lead_paragraph: Madelyn Gould is a preternaturally sunny person. She has a broad, easy smile, a charming Brooklyn accent and an infectious laugh. When she talks about herself, she often starts with the personal: She is the mother of three sons — identical twins who are 35, and one who is 27. She is the grandmother of a 2-year-old boy, and has been married to her husband, a pediatric neurologist, for 38 years.
2016-08-19.headline_main: A Suicidologist’s New Challenge: The George Washington Bridge

2016-08-19.lead_paragraph: ST. AMANT, La. — If Donald J. Trump were looking for those fed up with the national media and the Obama administration, he had some fertile ground in flood-wrecked southern Louisiana.

2016-08-19.abstract: This online music site known for its equitable treatment of artists is one of the greatest underground-culture bazaars of our time.
2016-08-19.snippet: This online music site known for its equitable treatment of artists is one of the greatest underground-culture bazaars of our time.
2016-08-19.lead_paragraph: A lesser-known artist you love makes a new recording — say, the hip-hop group Clipping or the Chicago punk band Mace or the electronic composer Kaitlyn Aurelia Smith. You feel you have to graft it onto your life. How does that go for you these days? Does streaming from Spotify, Apple Music or Tidal answer your needs in terms of audio quality and how well the artist is paid? Do you have a good record store nearby, and does it sell cassettes and vinyl, too? Do you only buy new records directly from artists, with a cash transaction and a handshake? Do you love spending time on iTunes?
2016-08-19.headline_main: Is Bandcamp the Holy Grail of Online Record Stores?

2016-08-19.abstract: Another theater critic roves through the festival, finding an ambitious revival here and many a hapless drama there.
2016-08-19.snippet: Another theater critic roves through the festival, finding an ambitious revival here and many a hapless drama there.
2016-08-19.lead_paragraph: If you learn one thing at the New York International Fringe Festival, it’s not to trust the program’s blurbs. And yet what else is there to help make a decision?

2016-08-19.abstract: A look at how airlines and hotels are responding to the C.D.C.’s suggestion that tourists postpone trips to Miami Beach.
2016-08-19.snippet: A look at how airlines and hotels are responding to the C.D.C.’s suggestion that tourists postpone trips to Miami Beach.
2016-08-19.lead_paragraph: The Centers for Disease Control and Prevention is suggesting that pregnant women and their partners postpone trips to Miami-Dade County after five people, three of them tourists, were diagnosed with Zika that was transmitted from mosquitos in Miami Beach, the second reported area in the United States where transmissions have occurred. At least fourteen people have contracted the virus from mosquitoes in Miami’s Wynwood area, prompting the C.D.C to issue its first call for pregnant women to steer clear of a section in Miami. Here is what travelers need to know if they are in Miami or plan to travel there.
2016-08-19.headline_main: Headed to Miami? Here’s What You Need to Know About Zika

But on Monday it came crashing to earth when it disclosed an accounting problem, delayed its full-year financial report and said it probably wouldn’t meet its earnings guidance for 2016.

2016-08-19.abstract: The government says tens of thousands of people are enrolled in Medicaid even as they receive federal subsidies under the Affordable Care Act.
2016-08-19.snippet: The government says tens of thousands of people are enrolled in Medicaid even as they receive federal subsidies under the Affordable Care Act.
2016-08-19.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — The Obama administration is moving to end duplicate coverage for tens of thousands of people who are enrolled in Medicaid and simultaneously receiving federal subsidies to help pay for private health insurance under the Affordable Care Act.
2016-08-19.headline_main: U.S. Officials Move to End Duplicate Health Care Coverage

2016-08-19.abstract: Thirty-six people have caught the Zika virus in southern Florida, but no one knows how large an area is affected or how long the danger will last.
2016-08-19.snippet: Thirty-six people have caught the Zika virus in southern Florida, but no one knows how large an area is affected or how long the danger will last.
2016-08-19.lead_paragraph: Zika transmission has been confirmed in two neighborhoods in the Miami area, and pregnant women have been advised to avoid both locations. Federal health officials have also suggested that pregnant women and their sexual partners consider avoiding the entire Miami area. Zika infections are also occurring in Puerto Rico and in Latin American and Caribbean countries.
2016-08-19.headline_main: What We Know and What We Don’t Know About the Zika Cases in South Florida

2016-08-19.abstract: Days after acknowledging its role in Haiti’s deadly cholera outbreak, the United Nations is weighing who will pay for the infrastructure necessary to end the epidemic.
2016-08-19.snippet: Days after acknowledging its role in Haiti’s deadly cholera outbreak, the United Nations is weighing who will pay for the infrastructure necessary to end the epidemic.
2016-08-19.lead_paragraph: Just days after the United Nations acknowledged playing a role in a cholera outbreak in Haiti, and a day after it was ruled immune from related lawsuits by a United States court, Secretary General Ban Ki-moon on Friday called on the organization’s member states to provide the money and resources needed to end the epidemic and help Haiti recover.
2016-08-19.headline_main: U.N. Leader Urges Member States to Fund Haiti’s Cholera Recovery

2016-08-19.abstract: Germany took control with two goals early in the second half, cracking open a Swedish defense that had eliminated the top-ranked United States and host Brazil in its last two matches.
2016-08-19.snippet: Germany took control with two goals early in the second half, cracking open a Swedish defense that had eliminated the top-ranked United States and host Brazil in its last two matches.
2016-08-19.lead_paragraph: RIO DE JANEIRO — Pia Sundhage’s impressive Olympic adventure came to an end on Friday when her upstart Swedish team ended up with the silver medal in women’s soccer while Germany grabbed the gold.
2016-08-19.headline_main: Germany Defeats Sweden to Win First Soccer Gold

2016-08-19.abstract: Roland Scahill was arraigned on charges of a fraudulent investment scheme, promoting a supposed production about Kathleen Battle starring Lupita Nyong’o.
2016-08-19.snippet: Roland Scahill was arraigned on charges of a fraudulent investment scheme, promoting a supposed production about Kathleen Battle starring Lupita Nyong’o.

2016-08-19.abstract: The national passenger railroad, which plans to build a tunnel under the Hudson River, said on Friday that Charles W. Moorman would become its chief executive.
2016-08-19.snippet: The national passenger railroad, which plans to build a tunnel under the Hudson River, said on Friday that Charles W. Moorman would become its chief executive.

2016-08-20.abstract: The ruling ensures that the issue of the private email server will continue to dog Mrs. Clinton’s presidential campaign until the eve of the election.
2016-08-20.snippet: The ruling ensures that the issue of the private email server will continue to dog Mrs. Clinton’s presidential campaign until the eve of the election.
2016-08-20.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — A federal judge on Friday ordered Hillary Clinton to provide written testimony under oath about why she set up a private computer server to send and receive emails while secretary of state, ensuring that the issue will continue to dog her presidential campaign until the eve of the election.
2016-08-20.headline_main: Judge Orders Written Testimony From Hillary Clinton on Emails

2016-08-20.snippet: Warships in the Mediterranean Sea fired cruise missiles days after Russia began bombing runs from a base in Iran.

2016-08-20.abstract: Professor Nolte, a respected German scholar of fascism, suggested in a 1986 essay that Nazism had been a logical response to the “existential threat” of the Russian Revolution.
2016-08-20.snippet: Professor Nolte, a respected German scholar of fascism, suggested in a 1986 essay that Nazism had been a logical response to the “existential threat” of the Russian Revolution.
2016-08-20.lead_paragraph: Ernst Nolte, a German revisionist historian who broke academic taboos by equating Nazism with Bolshevism and who was denounced as an apologist for Hitler and even the Holocaust, died on Thursday in Berlin. He was 93.
2016-08-20.headline_main: Ernst Nolte, Historian Whose Views on Hitler Caused an Uproar, Dies at 93

2016-08-20.abstract: Mr. Trump, in his first ad buys of the general election, has reserved nearly $5 million in ads in four battleground states — compared with Mrs. Clinton’s $13 million.
2016-08-20.snippet: Mr. Trump, in his first ad buys of the general election, has reserved nearly $5 million in ads in four battleground states — compared with Mrs. Clinton’s $13 million.

2016-08-20.abstract: A struggling media empire, still aching from a legal war involving Sumner M. Redstone, must focus on winning the peace.
2016-08-20.snippet: A struggling media empire, still aching from a legal war involving Sumner M. Redstone, must focus on winning the peace.
2016-08-20.lead_paragraph: In the summer of 1987, Sumner M. Redstone wrested control of Viacom in a hostile corporate takeover that left scorched relationships with the company’s management. Still bitter, executives sent Thomas E. Dooley, Viacom’s 30-year-old treasurer, to greet Mr. Redstone when he visited the Viacom office, the new boss wearing a plaid jacket bought on his way, the Filene’s Basement price tag still visible.
2016-08-20.headline_main: At Viacom, Now Comes the Hard Part

2016-08-20.abstract: New rules have gone into effect eliminating a mandatory English proficiency exam for taxi drivers. Now, the test for a license is available in several languages.
2016-08-20.snippet: New rules have gone into effect eliminating a mandatory English proficiency exam for taxi drivers. Now, the test for a license is available in several languages.
2016-08-20.lead_paragraph: Hail a yellow taxi in New York City, and there is a good chance the driver is from another country. Passengers are regularly exposed to a range of languages that span the globe, from Spanish to Bengali to Urdu.

2016-08-20.abstract: A U.N. adviser criticizes the organization for its "morally unconscionable, legally indefensible, and politically self-defeating" response to the epidemic.

2016-08-20.snippet: The organization has acknowledged its role in an epidemic that has killed thousands. But it has much further to go to truly make amends.
2016-08-20.lead_paragraph: This week, a phrase came out of United Nations headquarters that I thought I would never hear. A spokesman for Secretary-General Ban Ki-moon referred to the organization’s “own involvement” in the 2010 outbreak of cholera in Haiti.
2016-08-20.headline_main: The U.N.’s Cholera Admission and What Comes Next

2016-08-20.abstract: Mr. DeLuca was an ad man who had a crucial part in persuading Congress to approve a $1.5 billion federal loan guarantee package for the automaker in 1980.
2016-08-20.snippet: Mr. DeLuca was an ad man who had a crucial part in persuading Congress to approve a $1.5 billion federal loan guarantee package for the automaker in 1980.

He was 91.

2016-08-20.abstract: Grabbing people’s attention seems to be his real objective, and it might provide a good payoff.
2016-08-20.snippet: Grabbing people’s attention seems to be his real objective, and it might provide a good payoff.
2016-08-20.lead_paragraph: AMAGANSETT, N.Y. — People run for the presidency for all sorts of reasons. But Donald J. Trump may be the first to run because he sees a presidential campaign as the best way to attract attention to himself. There seems to be no other driving passion in him, certainly not the passion to govern.

2016-08-20.lead_paragraph: Usain Bolt made it a triple-triple, leading Jamaica to victory in the 4x100 meter relay on Friday night and winning a third gold medal for the third consecutive Olympics. The United States crossed the finish line third but was later disqualified.

2016-08-20.abstract: He established more than a thousand temples around the world for BAPS, the Bochasanwasi Akshar Purushottam Swaminarayan Sanstha sect.
2016-08-20.snippet: He established more than a thousand temples around the world for BAPS, the Bochasanwasi Akshar Purushottam Swaminarayan Sanstha sect.
2016-08-20.lead_paragraph: MUMBAI, India — Pramukh Swami Maharaj, the spiritual leader who engineered the global expansion of a socially conservative Hindu sect that grew to be the largest in the United States, died on Aug. 13 in Sarangpur, a village in the state of Gujarat in western India. He was 94.

2016-08-20.abstract: Dr. Mark Diehl will see you now.
2016-08-20.snippet: Dr. Mark Diehl will see you now.
2016-08-20.lead_paragraph: SATURDAY PUZZLE — Thank goodness for fill-in-the-blank clues. On a Saturday, they can be life savers. Generally the easiest type of clue because your brain loves filling in missing information, even the fill-in-the-blanks are tougher on a Saturday, but they can also provide us with a much-needed toehold in an otherwise impenetrable puzzle. I got started in Mark Diehl’s puzzle in just this way, filling in “The ODESSA File,” Edmond DANTES, and ANSON Williams right off the bat.
2016-08-20.headline_main: Wet Blanket

2016-08-20.abstract: The former Harvard forward signed a two-year contract with the Rangers, four years after the Nashville Predators selected him in the third round of the N.H.L. draft.

2016-08-20.lead_paragraph: As an Olympic qualifier, Caster Semenya of South Africa has had to face not only her competitors on the track but also critics around the world who claimed she wasn’t really female. Now the 25-year-old Ms. Semenya, who is favored to win gold in the 800 meters on Saturday, finds herself at the center of a debate about who gets to compete as a woman.
