2016-08-20.abstract: This win-win helps to raise earnings now and increase productivity over the long term while enriching the lives of children.
2016-08-20.snippet: This win-win helps to raise earnings now and increase productivity over the long term while enriching the lives of children.
2016-08-20.lead_paragraph: Of the 24 million children under 6 in the United States today, some 12 million need day care, because both parents work or a single parent is the breadwinner. Yet most working families can’t afford good care — if they can even find it in the first place. In 2006, a federal study gave a “high quality” rating to only 10 percent of the nation’s child care programs, and the proportion today is almost certainly smaller, since government financing for child care has declined in the past decade.

She swayed to some internal music as she waited to step onto the podium.

2016-08-20.snippet: Working at home with noise, renting out a co-op and waterproofing a shower.
2016-08-20.lead_paragraph: Our backyard abuts a rowhouse that operates a day care center, which also has a yard. When the weather is nice, the children are outside — crying, shouting and screaming — most of the day. The noise is constant and intolerable. My wife works from home and would like to sit in her yard, working and talking (quietly!) to colleagues and clients on the phone. That is impossible. Is there any way to force the owners to limit the noise? We have called the  center, but the owners say, “We are a day care; kids cry,” and hang up on us. What can we do?
2016-08-20.headline_main: A Day Care Center Draws Noise Complaints

But perhaps sarcasm isn’t the best response to those who blame me for writing only bad things about my country, ruining the image of our beloved land of samba and caipirinhas.
2016-08-20.headline_main: I Criticized the Olympics. That Doesn’t Make Me a Traitor.

2016-08-20.abstract: New rules on heavy-truck emissions show that regulators and industry can, in fact, produce a mutually acceptable result.
2016-08-20.snippet: New rules on heavy-truck emissions show that regulators and industry can, in fact, produce a mutually acceptable result.
2016-08-20.lead_paragraph: With most of President Obama’s efforts to combat climate change tied up in litigation, it is heartening, if not downright astonishing, to see an industry targeted by an aggressive rule to reduce greenhouse gases welcoming that rule. It is also heartening to be able to provide proof to a reflexively hostile Congress — whose members yap incessantly about “job-killing regulations” and “executive overreach” — that regulators and industry can, in fact, produce a mutually acceptable result.
2016-08-20.headline_main: A Rare Agreement on Climate Rules

2016-08-20.abstract: Online realms make us safer, but sometimes stunted.
2016-08-20.snippet: Online realms make us safer, but sometimes stunted.
2016-08-20.lead_paragraph: SINCE the 1990s, we’ve seen two broad social changes that few observers would have expected to happen together.
2016-08-20.headline_main: The Virtues of Reality

2016-08-20.abstract: Zika could threaten my generation’s ability to have healthy children.
2016-08-20.snippet: Zika could threaten my generation’s ability to have healthy children.
2016-08-20.lead_paragraph: I am a millennial; half my peers are single and on Tinder, half are getting ready to start families. I’m also a scientist, working toward a master’s degree in bioethics. And I am more and more worried about Zika.
2016-08-20.headline_main: Zika: The Millennials’ S.T.D.?

2016-08-20.abstract: The message of hatred and paranoia that is inciting millions of voters will outlast the messenger.
2016-08-20.snippet: The message of hatred and paranoia that is inciting millions of voters will outlast the messenger.
2016-08-20.lead_paragraph: Donald Trump is heading to November like a certain zeppelin heading to New Jersey, in a darkening sky that crackles with electricity. He is fighting crosswinds and trying new tacks — hiring the head of Breitbart News to run his campaign, trying on a new emotion (regret) in a speech on Thursday night, promising to talk more this week about immigration, his prime subject. There’s still no telling what will happen when the gasbag reaches the mooring.
2016-08-20.headline_main: How Can America Recover From Donald Trump?

2016-08-20.abstract: Who’s sorry now? Believe it or not, the Donald. He offers his apologia in an open letter.
2016-08-20.snippet: Who’s sorry now? Believe it or not, the Donald. He offers his apologia in an open letter.
2016-08-20.lead_paragraph: To Whom It May Concern:
2016-08-20.headline_main: An Open Letter From Mr. Trump

2016-08-20.abstract: My mother and father survived with two different views of the world. Which one is right?
2016-08-20.snippet: My mother and father survived with two different views of the world. Which one is right?
2016-08-20.lead_paragraph: My childhood was privileged and fortunate. My mother was a court stenographer in criminal court, and my father was a professor of sociology at Syracuse University, who had written his doctoral thesis on British colonialism in Kenya. My parents divorced when I was young. But they each happily remarried, and in any case, when I was growing up in Syracuse in the 1970s and ’80s, it was the kids of non-divorced parents who were weird. I was on the cross-country team, the math team. And my mother and my father survived the Holocaust.
2016-08-20.headline_main: My Parents’ Mixed Messages on the Holocaust

2016-08-20.abstract: How the Christian right came to support the most openly profane Republican presidential nominee in a generation.
2016-08-20.snippet: How the Christian right came to support the most openly profane Republican presidential nominee in a generation.
2016-08-20.lead_paragraph: As the number of Republican politicians and conservative pundits who renounce Donald J. Trump continues to rise, one important contingent remains steadfast in its support: conservative white evangelicals.
2016-08-20.headline_main: Why Values Voters Value Donald Trump

2016-08-20.abstract: An analysis of judges’ decisions poses a puzzling question: Was their dismissal just an empty gesture or the rooting out of corruption?
2016-08-20.snippet: An analysis of judges’ decisions poses a puzzling question: Was their dismissal just an empty gesture or the rooting out of corruption?
2016-08-20.lead_paragraph: RIO DE JANEIRO — The International Boxing Federation has tried to calm the furor over several controversial bouts last week by tossing out a handful of their judges and reassigning an executive in charge of supervising them.
2016-08-20.headline_main: Dismissal of Rio Boxing Judges Robed in Secrecy

2016-08-20.abstract: His message resonates with voters who feel guns are all they have.
2016-08-20.snippet: His message resonates with voters who feel guns are all they have.
2016-08-20.lead_paragraph: LEXINGTON, Ky. — “The Second Amendment people have tremendous power because they are so united.” So said Donald J. Trump in North Carolina on Aug. 9, in an interview that followed controversial comments he’d made earlier that day. Warning his audience of the danger of Hillary Clinton’s choosing new Supreme Court justices, he seemed to suggest that gun rights activists could take action to stop her.
2016-08-20.headline_main: Donald Trump Takes Aim

2016-08-20.abstract: Across the country, state-level campaigns fight the influence of big money and gerrymandered congressional districts.
2016-08-20.snippet: Across the country, state-level campaigns fight the influence of big money and gerrymandered congressional districts.
2016-08-20.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — In this tumultuous election year, little attention has focused on the groundswell of support for political reform across grass-roots America. Beyond Bernie Sanders’s call for a political revolution, a broad array of state-level citizen movements are pressing for reforms against Citizens United, gerrymandering and campaign megadonors to give average voters more voice, make elections more competitive, and ease gridlock in Congress.
2016-08-20.headline_main: Can the States Save American Democracy?

2016-08-20.abstract: July wasn’t just hot — it was the hottest month ever recorded, according to NASA. And this year is likely to be the hottest year on record.
2016-08-20.snippet: July wasn’t just hot — it was the hottest month ever recorded, according to NASA. And this year is likely to be the hottest year on record.
2016-08-20.lead_paragraph: July wasn’t just hot — it was the hottest month ever recorded, according to NASA. And this year is likely to be the hottest year on record.
2016-08-20.headline_main: Think It’s Hot Now? Just Wait

2016-08-20.abstract: A new 24-hour weekend service opened to the delight of late-night crowds. “People were cheering, ‘Night Tube!’ It seems to be the buzz,” a Tube worker said.
2016-08-20.snippet: A new 24-hour weekend service opened to the delight of late-night crowds. “People were cheering, ‘Night Tube!’ It seems to be the buzz,” a Tube worker said.
2016-08-20.lead_paragraph: LONDON — The London Underground, the world’s oldest subway system, opened a new chapter in its storied history on Friday night and Saturday morning: For the first time, trains on two lines kept operating all night.
2016-08-20.headline_main: ‘Night Tube,’ a First for London, Brings All-Night Service to Two Subway Lines

2016-08-20.abstract: Infections have surged, and an out-of-whack ecosystem may be to blame.
2016-08-20.snippet: Infections have surged, and an out-of-whack ecosystem may be to blame.
2016-08-20.lead_paragraph: Every year, at least 30,000 people — and possibly 10 times that — are infected with the bacterium that causes Lyme disease, most in the Northeast and upper Midwest. Symptoms can include fatigue, joint pain, memory problems and even temporary paralysis. In a small minority of cases, the malaise can persist for many months.
2016-08-20.headline_main: A Natural Cure for Lyme Disease

2016-08-20.abstract: Cursive is a useless practice, and someday all printing may be, too.
2016-08-20.snippet: Cursive is a useless practice, and someday all printing may be, too.
2016-08-20.lead_paragraph: I thought politicians had enough to fight over. Apparently not: Legislatures around the country are now debating the future of cursive penmanship.
2016-08-20.headline_main: Handwriting Just Doesn’t Matter

2016-08-20.abstract: Enough with 2,600 years of tradition. Japan needs to let women rule.
2016-08-20.snippet: Enough with 2,600 years of tradition. Japan needs to let women rule.
2016-08-20.lead_paragraph: Tokyo — “A parasite who lives off taxpayers’ money.” That was how my father disparaged the emperor of Japan. Back then, our emperor was Hirohito and my father’s antipathy toward him was typical of Japanese intellectuals. I grew up thinking that the sooner the emperor was thrown out into the street, the better.
2016-08-20.headline_main: Who Wants to Marry an Emperor?

2016-08-20.abstract: The Times has been producing live video for Facebook with very mixed results. It’s time to find a better way.
2016-08-20.snippet: The Times has been producing live video for Facebook with very mixed results. It’s time to find a better way.
2016-08-20.lead_paragraph: IT’S been just over four months since The New York Times started producing live video for Facebook, but already the scoreboard is flashing. A few earned gold medals. Several others finished strong. And a lot should never have made the team.
2016-08-20.headline_main: Facebook Live: Too Much, Too Soon

2016-08-20.abstract: Countries and companies vie for the title of Rio’s Best Party, offering night life to athletes once their competitions are over.
2016-08-20.snippet: Countries and companies vie for the title of Rio’s Best Party, offering night life to athletes once their competitions are over.
2016-08-20.lead_paragraph: RIO DE JANEIRO — It was 1:30 a.m. Saturday, and Mathieu Peisson, a French water polo player, had just come through the security gates at Club France — the same Olympic gathering spot where Ryan Lochte had started a night that became a diplomatic incident.
2016-08-20.headline_main: At the Olympics, the Thrill of Victory, the Agony of Defeat and the Lure of the Dance Floor

2016-08-20.lead_paragraph: Should the United States be doing more to end the civil war, as Nicholas Kristof urges?

2016-08-20.abstract: A French architect finds inspiration in books about Paris, female singers and below the streets of New York.
2016-08-20.snippet: A French architect finds inspiration in books about Paris, female singers and below the streets of New York.
2016-08-20.lead_paragraph: Dominique Perrault is a French architect respected for his minimalist sensibility and projects that comfortably meld environment, culture and utility. He is perhaps best known for an expansion of the National Library of France and the newly completed extension to the  Pavillon Dufour at the Palace of Versailles.
2016-08-20.headline_main: Dominique Perrault

2016-08-20.abstract: Since October 2004, more than half of children who did not have lawyers were deported, while only one in 10 children who had lawyers were sent back.
2016-08-20.snippet: Since October 2004, more than half of children who did not have lawyers were deported, while only one in 10 children who had lawyers were sent back.
2016-08-20.lead_paragraph: TUCSON — After a long, scary trek through three countries to escape the gang violence in El Salvador, a 15-year-old boy found himself scared again a few months back, this time in a federal immigration court here. There was an immigration judge in front of him and a federal prosecutor to his right. But there was no one helping him understand the charges against him.
2016-08-20.headline_main: It’s Children Against Federal Lawyers in Immigration Court

2016-08-20.abstract: The funding of the sprawling philanthropy has become an Achilles’ heel for Mrs. Clinton’s White House bid and, if she is victorious, potentially her administration as well.
2016-08-20.snippet: The funding of the sprawling philanthropy has become an Achilles’ heel for Mrs. Clinton’s White House bid and, if she is victorious, potentially her administration as well.
2016-08-20.lead_paragraph: The kingdom of Saudi Arabia donated more than $10 million. Through a foundation, so did the son-in-law of a former Ukrainian president whose government was widely criticized for corruption and the murder of journalists. A Lebanese-Nigerian developer with vast business interests contributed as much as $5 million.
2016-08-20.headline_main: Foundation Ties Bedevil Hillary Clinton’s Presidential Campaign

2016-08-20.abstract: There was some worry, but not enough to dim the party atmosphere. Said one man: “Maybe it’s only a problem if there’s a big swarm. I’m pretty chill.”

2016-08-20.headline_main: The Beat, and the Bug Spray, Go On in South Beach Despite Zika Threat

2016-08-20.snippet: Aly Raisman’s photo will be on a Smuckers jelly jar, Ginny Thrasher is back at college, and Maya DiRado will start work with a consulting company.
2016-08-20.lead_paragraph: It’s become a sports cliché that when an athlete or a team wins a championship, the default response to “What’s next?” is “I’m going to Disney World!” But that’s old news for Olympic medalists. Michael Phelps did that way back when he had only eight gold medals, after Beijing in 2008.
2016-08-20.headline_main: After a Gold Medal at the Rio Olympics, Disney World? Maybe Not. Perhaps Parades. Definitely Fries.

2016-08-20.abstract: Seattle hasn’t made the postseason since 2001, the majors’ longest drought, but it’s in the wild-card hunt with the help of pitchers Hisashi Iwakuma and Edwin Diaz.
2016-08-20.snippet: Seattle hasn’t made the postseason since 2001, the majors’ longest drought, but it’s in the wild-card hunt with the help of pitchers Hisashi Iwakuma and Edwin Diaz.
2016-08-20.lead_paragraph: Jerry Dipoto was a rookie executive in 2001, the last time the Seattle Mariners reached the playoffs. Dipoto had just finished his pitching career, and his work for the Colorado Rockies kept him from visiting Safeco Field, which drew more than 3.5 million fans that season as the Mariners rolled to 116 victories.
2016-08-20.headline_main: For Seattle Mariners, Patience Plus Promise Could Equal Playoffs

2016-08-20.lead_paragraph: ENGLEWOOD, Colo. — In a parallel universe, Trevor Siemian would be working in commercial real estate, and he thinks he’d be pretty good at it, too. A torn knee ligament two years ago ended his football career at Northwestern, fostering a week or so of existential angst.
2016-08-20.headline_main: An Unusual Quarterback Vacancy, and Unlikely Candidates, for the Denver Broncos

2016-08-20.lead_paragraph: RIO DE JANEIRO — An Olympic gold medal in soccer for Brazil will not undo the embarrassment of the 2014 World Cup. Perhaps nothing will. But Saturday provided a dramatic recovery, a tense rekindling of joy where before there was national shame.

2016-08-21.snippet: The American golfer began the day two strokes off the pace but finished in a tie for 11th, 10 strokes behind the gold medalist, Inbee Park of South Korea.

2016-08-21.headline_main: One Photo of a Syrian Child Caught the World’s Attention. These 7 Went Unnoticed.

2016-08-21.abstract: From the archives of the International Herald Tribune: The former editor of Al-Akhbar received a sentence of hard labor for life in August 1966.
2016-08-21.snippet: From the archives of the International Herald Tribune: The former editor of Al-Akhbar received a sentence of hard labor for life in August 1966.
2016-08-21.lead_paragraph: CAIRO, Egypt — A former newspaper editor was sentenced to life at hard labor yesterday [Aug. 21] for passing military and other information to ‘‘a foreign country’’— the United States. Mustafa Amin, 51, former editor of the Cairo daily ‘‘Al-Akhbar,’’ reiterated his innocence when the sentence, approved by President Gamal Abdel Nasser, was handed down more than seven months after the Supreme State Security Court trial. He was acquitted of passing on defense secrets.
2016-08-21.headline_main: 1966: Ex-Editor Gets Life Sentence in Cairo

2016-08-21.lead_paragraph: DETROIT, Michigan — While half-a-dozen burly firemen and fully 500 other men looked on, five unmasked men armed with rifles and revolvers “held up” an automobile of the Burroughs Adding Machine Company here this afternoon [Aug. 21] and took $37,000 in cash. Then they escaped in an automobile.

2016-08-21.abstract: The poised soprano Joélle Harvey, during an exquisite performance of Mozart’s Mass in C minor and other works, made everyone around her look good.
2016-08-21.snippet: The poised soprano Joélle Harvey, during an exquisite performance of Mozart’s Mass in C minor and other works, made everyone around her look good.
2016-08-21.lead_paragraph: A perfect table, a cabinetmaker once told me, isn’t one that draws attention to itself: It just makes the rest of the room feel right. A similar thought came to me at David Geffen Hall on Saturday during an exquisite performance of Mozart’s Mass in C minor at the Mostly Mozart Festival when the soprano Joélle Harvey began to sing.
2016-08-21.headline_main: At Mostly Mozart, a Self-Effacing Magnetism

2016-08-21.abstract: Manet and Degas, Matisse and Picasso, Pollock and de Kooning, Lucian Freud and Francis Bacon: fraught friendships as catapults for artistic breakthroughs.
2016-08-21.snippet: Manet and Degas, Matisse and Picasso, Pollock and de Kooning, Lucian Freud and Francis Bacon: fraught friendships as catapults for artistic breakthroughs.
2016-08-21.lead_paragraph: A famous portrait of Francis Bacon brazenly stolen off a museum wall. Manet stabbing through an image of his wife painted for him by Degas. Lucian Freud declining a wedding invitation because he found himself “in the unusual position of having been involved sexually not only with the bride but also the groom and the groom’s mother.”
2016-08-21.headline_main: ‘The Art of Rivalry’ Dissects Four Jostling Pairs of Artists

2016-08-21.abstract: The actress talks about being herself in Hollywood, becoming someone else — specifically Peggy Blumquist on “Fargo” — and the joy of working with friends.
2016-08-21.snippet: The actress talks about being herself in Hollywood, becoming someone else — specifically Peggy Blumquist on “Fargo” — and the joy of working with friends.
2016-08-21.lead_paragraph: As a child actor turned Hollywood star, Kirsten Dunst has done her share of soul-searching. So to play Peggy Blumquist, a beautician on the road to self-actualization who veers off course after committing a hit-and-run in FX’s “Fargo,” she turned inward.

2016-08-21.abstract: Going into the last lap of a slow, tactical race on Saturday, he seized on an opening and never looked back, becoming the first American to win the metric mile since 1908.
2016-08-21.snippet: Going into the last lap of a slow, tactical race on Saturday, he seized on an opening and never looked back, becoming the first American to win the metric mile since 1908.
2016-08-21.lead_paragraph: RIO DE JANEIRO — When Matt Centrowitz crossed the finish line of the Olympic 1,500 meters on Saturday night, becoming the first American to win the metric mile since 1908, the look on his face was one of disbelief.
2016-08-21.headline_main: How Matt Centrowitz Won a Historic 1,500 Meters

2016-08-21.abstract: A gala performance saluting the institution Ardani Artists on its 25th anniversary included works by Vladimir Varnava, Marcelo Gomes and Maxim Petrov.
2016-08-21.snippet: A gala performance saluting the institution Ardani Artists on its 25th anniversary included works by Vladimir Varnava, Marcelo Gomes and Maxim Petrov.
2016-08-21.lead_paragraph: Ardani Artists, an institution run by the husband and wife Sergei and Gaiane Danilian and presenting ballet dancers and companies internationally, is enjoying a protracted silver jubilee. “Ardani 25” was celebrated in Moscow in 2014, in London in July 2015, and then on Friday and Saturday nights at City Center Theater in New York. London seems to have got the right age; Ardani was founded in 1990.
2016-08-21.headline_main: Review: Three Ballets at City Center Honor Two Impresarios

2016-08-21.abstract: On Saturday, Mr. Downie, who has terminal brain cancer, played what could be his last major outing with that venerable Canadian band.
2016-08-21.snippet: On Saturday, Mr. Downie, who has terminal brain cancer, played what could be his last major outing with that venerable Canadian band.
2016-08-21.lead_paragraph: In an unparalleled moment of national pride laced with sorrow, Canada stopped for a few hours on Saturday night to venerate the Tragically Hip, the band that for many has come closest to defining that country’s cultural identity.
2016-08-21.headline_main: Gord Downie, Frontman for the Tragically Hip, in His Final Act

2016-08-21.abstract: Mr. Ocean has released two new albums, a music video and an art magazine that display his musical and nonmusical talents.
2016-08-21.snippet: Mr. Ocean has released two new albums, a music video and an art magazine that display his musical and nonmusical talents.
2016-08-21.lead_paragraph: In this time of relentlessness and ubiquity, there is no art more potent, or shocking, than the art of disappearance. Silence may not be Frank Ocean’s greatest gift, but it’s one the R&B singer has wielded effectively for most of the four years since his last album, “Channel Orange.” The reactions to his evaporation from public life have been most intriguing to watch — his denial has been seen as a necessary balm against the scrutiny of fame, and then, after a while, a sort of insult, and finally, in the run-up to his just-released projects, a possible sign of failure on the horizon.
2016-08-21.headline_main: Frank Ocean Ends His Long Silence With a Variety of Works

2016-08-21.abstract: A delicious debut by Emily Carroll.
2016-08-21.snippet: A delicious debut by Emily Carroll.
2016-08-21.lead_paragraph: MONDAY PUZZLE — We’ve seen a lot of people make their New York Times Crossword debuts, but I wonder how many of those constructors took up this endeavor in their fourth year of medical school. Talk about taxing one’s brain.
2016-08-21.headline_main: Influential Sorts

2016-08-21.snippet: Donald J. Trump and Hillary Clinton could be discussing in more detail their tax plans, a serious topic on which they have clear differences.

Trump hadn’t turned the presidential campaign into an argument over who founded the Islamic State or whether there should be ideological entrance tests for foreign visitors and immigrants. Then he and Hillary Clinton could have a debate over taxes, a serious topic on which they have clear differences.

2016-08-21.lead_paragraph: As Feyisa Lilesa of Ethiopia crossed the finish line in his silver-medal marathon run at the Rio Olympics on Sunday, he raised his arms and crossed them in an X, a gesture of protest against his country’s government that he said could get him killed if he returned home.

2016-08-21.abstract: As both presidential candidates campaign against it, the White House is negotiating with Republicans in Congress to ratify the largest regional trade agreement ever.
2016-08-21.snippet: As both presidential candidates campaign against it, the White House is negotiating with Republicans in Congress to ratify the largest regional trade agreement ever.
2016-08-21.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — His successor, whether Democrat or Republican, opposes it, as does most of his party. Delegates at the Democratic National Convention waved signs saying “T.P.P.” slashed by a bold line, while the Republican Party platform opposed any vote on it in Congress this year.
2016-08-21.headline_main: Obama Readies One Last Push for Trans-Pacific Partnership

2016-08-21.abstract: There have been cost overruns and many other complaints, but the 2016 Summer Games in Rio also yielded infrastructure improvements that had been on wish lists for years.

2016-08-21.lead_paragraph: RIO DE JANEIRO — There have been cost overruns and complaints about spending billions on a mega-event when teachers have gone unpaid. Critics say upscale areas have been favored at the expense of slum dwellers. A pledge to clean up Rio de Janeiro’s polluted bay went unfulfilled, while the promise of law and order now feels like a cruel taunt in the face of rising crime.

2016-08-21.abstract: Starting in 1966, Dr. Henderson, known as D.A., led the World Health Organization’s war on the smallpox virus, and achieved success astonishingly quickly.
2016-08-21.snippet: Starting in 1966, Dr. Henderson, known as D.A., led the World Health Organization’s war on the smallpox virus, and achieved success astonishingly quickly.

2016-08-21.abstract: “You can’t worry about that stuff,” said Collins, who, at 68, finds solace in exercising and knowing his remaining time in the game is limited.

2016-08-21.lead_paragraph: SAN FRANCISCO — Away from the noise of a sputtering season, Mets Manager Terry Collins finds his solace in exercise. Collins, at 67 the oldest manager in the major leagues, arrived at AT&T Park five hours before Saturday’s game against the San Francisco Giants to jog on the treadmill.

2016-08-22.snippet: A growing homeless population on public lands has brought with it increases in emergency calls, drug overdoses, illegal fires and trash, which have put nearby residents on edge.
2016-08-22.lead_paragraph: NEDERLAND, Colo. — Gerald Babbitt lives in these woods, in a pop-up trailer on cinder blocks that he bought for $250. His toilet is a bucket, and when he and his wife need to refill their water jugs, they drive their creaky green Jeep a mile down the mountain and into town. Most people are kind, but the other day someone called them “homeless vagrant beggars,” Mr. Babbitt said.
2016-08-22.headline_main: As Homeless Find Refuge in Forests, ‘Anger Is Palpable’ in Nearby Towns

2016-08-22.abstract: Chandra’s enduring faith in Naz’s innocence and Box’s doubts of his guilt are in contrast to the questions Naz’s mother now has of her son.
2016-08-22.snippet: Chandra’s enduring faith in Naz’s innocence and Box’s doubts of his guilt are in contrast to the questions Naz’s mother now has of her son.
2016-08-22.lead_paragraph: In the classic 1955 Douglas Sirk melodrama “All That Heaven Allows,” the grown children of an affluent widow, along with her high-society friends, share the tacit expectation that she will remain a widow for the rest of her life. When she falls in love with a gardener many years her junior, these outside forces conspire to tear their relationship asunder. As a Christmas gift, the widow’s son gives her a television set, despite her earlier insistence that she had no interesting in owning one. Sirk frames her reflection in the TV like it’s a prison, confining her to a retirement of docile complacency while denying her the vibrant passion outside its borders.
2016-08-22.headline_main: ‘The Night Of’ Season 1, Episode 7: A Test of Faith

2016-08-22.abstract: This series has bypassed a political sinkhole, reminding us that in a zombie apocalypse it doesn’t matter who you are or where you come from.
2016-08-22.snippet: This series has bypassed a political sinkhole, reminding us that in a zombie apocalypse it doesn’t matter who you are or where you come from.

2016-08-22.abstract: For the past few years, researchers have been holding forums to see how people would ration limited medical resources during disasters or pandemics.
2016-08-22.snippet: For the past few years, researchers have been holding forums to see how people would ration limited medical resources during disasters or pandemics.
2016-08-22.lead_paragraph: BALTIMORE — In a church basement in a poor East Baltimore neighborhood, a Johns Hopkins doctor enlisted residents to help answer one of the most fraught questions in public health: When a surge of patients — from a disaster, disease outbreak or terrorist attack — overwhelms hospitals, how should you ration care? Whose lives should be saved first?
2016-08-22.headline_main: Whose Lives Should Be Saved? Researchers Ask the Public

2016-08-22.snippet: The cellphone game, popular with children and adults, has been added to a list of restrictions that New York State parolees must sign before being released.
2016-08-22.lead_paragraph: The list that most sex offenders must sign in order to be granted parole in New York State includes many stipulations, all written in the first person. There are promises to register with local law enforcement, to complete therapy if it is required and to not pick up hitchhikers or visit schools or playgrounds.
2016-08-22.headline_main: Concerns Over Rule Banning Sex Offenders From Playing Pokémon Go

2016-08-22.abstract: A car crossed a median and struck two other cars on the Long Island Expressway, killing Scott Martella, a former aide to Gov. Andrew M. Cuomo, and four others.
2016-08-22.snippet: A car crossed a median and struck two other cars on the Long Island Expressway, killing Scott Martella, a former aide to Gov. Andrew M. Cuomo, and four others.
2016-08-22.lead_paragraph: Five people were killed and six were injured on Sunday when a car traveling east on the Long Island Expressway crossed a median, went airborne and struck two other cars, the Suffolk County police said. Among the dead was a former aide to Gov. Andrew M. Cuomo who had recently worked as an aide to the county executive, Steve Bellone.
2016-08-22.headline_main: Ex-Cuomo Aide Is Among 5 Dead in Long Island Car Crash

2016-08-22.abstract: The Olympics were seen as a triumph by many in Brazil, and some of the worst fears were shown to be unfounded. But political polarization and economic and security concerns linger.
2016-08-22.snippet: The Olympics were seen as a triumph by many in Brazil, and some of the worst fears were shown to be unfounded. But political polarization and economic and security concerns linger.
2016-08-22.lead_paragraph: RIO DE JANEIRO — The skies opened on Sunday night over Maracanã, the stadium where Brazil bade farewell to the Rio Olympics with a spectacle celebrating everything from the giants of Brazilian music to the rock art drawn by tribesmen thousands of years ago, as if the heavens were lamenting the end of the 17-day sports extravaganza.

The governor of flood-ravaged Louisiana asked President Obama to postpone a personal visit while relief efforts were still underway. (Meanwhile, by all accounts, the substantive federal response has been infinitely superior to the Bush administration’s response to Katrina.) He made the same request to Donald Trump, declaring, reasonably, that while aid would be welcome, a visit for the sake of a photo op would not.

2016-08-22.snippet: Only 40 percent of girls and 21 percent of boys get the shots, which prevent infections with cancer-causing human papillomavirus, or HPV.
2016-08-22.lead_paragraph: You’d think that when parents are told of a vaccine that could prevent future cancers in their children, they’d leap at the chance to protect them. Alas, that is hardly the case for a vaccine that prevents infections with cancer-causing human papillomavirus, or HPV. The vaccine, best given at age 11 to 12, is currently the most underutilized immunization available for children.
2016-08-22.headline_main: The Underused HPV Vaccine

2016-08-22.abstract: As full-body bathing suits become a new source of division in France, and Germany considers restrictions on Muslim veiling, we are looking for voices from Muslims in Europe who have lived with these issues.
2016-08-22.snippet: As full-body bathing suits become a new source of division in France, and Germany considers restrictions on Muslim veiling, we are looking for voices from Muslims in Europe who have lived with these issues.
2016-08-22.lead_paragraph: As full-body bathing suits become a new source of division in France, and Germany considers restrictions on Muslim veiling, we are looking for voices from Muslims in Europe who have lived with these issues.
2016-08-22.headline_main: Are You a Muslim Woman in Europe? Share Your Thoughts on Veil Restrictions

2016-08-22.abstract: Remembering puzzle constructor Merl Reagle one year after his unexpected death.
2016-08-22.snippet: Remembering puzzle constructor Merl Reagle one year after his unexpected death.
2016-08-22.lead_paragraph: SPECIAL POST — Exactly one year ago, the puzzle world’s heart collectively broke when Merl Reagle died unexpectedly at the age of 65.
2016-08-22.headline_main: A Year Without Merl

2016-08-22.abstract: The kung fu culture that Bruce Lee helped popularize — and that gave the city a gritty, exotic image in the eyes of foreigners — is in decline.
2016-08-22.snippet: The kung fu culture that Bruce Lee helped popularize — and that gave the city a gritty, exotic image in the eyes of foreigners — is in decline.
2016-08-22.lead_paragraph: HONG KONG — Bruce Lee was 14 years old, and on the losing end of several street fights with local gang members, when he took up kung fu.
2016-08-22.headline_main: Exit the Dragon? Kung Fu, Once Central to Hong Kong Life, Is Waning

2016-08-22.abstract: When bombs go off, the generals won’t admit the presence of — or deal with — rebels in the country’s south.
2016-08-22.snippet: When bombs go off, the generals won’t admit the presence of — or deal with — rebels in the country’s south.
2016-08-22.lead_paragraph: On Aug. 11 and 12, coordinated bombings and arson attacks in tourist destinations in seven provinces of peninsular Thailand killed four people and injured 35. No group claimed responsibility, and senior officials of the military government almost immediately decided that the bombings were not acts of terrorism. They also dismissed any link to Malay-Muslim militants who have been waging a separatist insurgency for the past 13 years in the four southernmost provinces.
2016-08-22.headline_main: Can Thailand Really Hide a Rebellion?

2016-08-22.abstract: From the archives of the International Herald Tribune: Hurricane leaves trail of destruction in Jamaica in August 1916.
2016-08-22.snippet: From the archives of the International Herald Tribune: Hurricane leaves trail of destruction in Jamaica in August 1916.
2016-08-22.lead_paragraph: LONDON — A despatch from Kingston, Jamaica, to the ‘‘Morning Post’’ states that the havoc wrought by the hurricane, which swept over the island on Tuesday, August 15, greatly exceeded the first estimates. General Sir W. H. Manning, Governor of Jamaica, in a telegram to Mr. Bonar Law, Secretary of State for the Colonies, says that the whole of the banana plants have been destroyed.
2016-08-22.headline_main: 1916: Hurricane Hits Jamaica

2016-08-22.abstract: Under President Rodrigo Duterte, 712 suspects have died in police operations and 1,067 have been killed by vigilantes, the nation’s police chief says.
2016-08-22.snippet: Under President Rodrigo Duterte, 712 suspects have died in police operations and 1,067 have been killed by vigilantes, the nation’s police chief says.
2016-08-22.lead_paragraph: MANILA — Killings by the police and vigilantes in the Philippines’ war on drugs have soared to nearly 1,800 in the seven weeks since President Rodrigo Duterte was sworn into office, the nation’s top police official told a Senate hearing on Monday.
2016-08-22.headline_main: Nearly 1,800 Killed in Duterte’s Drug War, Philippine Police Official Tells Senators

2016-08-22.abstract: The Times’s deputy sports editor, Jay Schreiber, considers the grim possibility that he is “a jinx.” Does this explain why each of the Olympic teams he’s covered has been defeated?
2016-08-22.snippet: The Times’s deputy sports editor, Jay Schreiber, considers the grim possibility that he is “a jinx.” Does this explain why each of the Olympic teams he’s covered has been defeated?
2016-08-22.lead_paragraph: Times Insider delivers behind-the-scenes insights into how news, features and opinion come together at The New York Times. In this piece, Jay Schreiber, The Times’s deputy sports editor, describes his coverage of heartbreaking losses at the Rio Olympics.
2016-08-22.headline_main: ‘Heartbreak Lurks Everywhere’: Covering Losing Teams at the Olympics

2016-08-22.abstract: A pie marathon: salted-carmel apple, flambéed banana cream, blackberry with roasted hazelnut crumble, heirloom tomato with fresh ricotta and more.
2016-08-22.snippet: A pie marathon: salted-carmel apple, flambéed banana cream, blackberry with roasted hazelnut crumble, heirloom tomato with fresh ricotta and more.
2016-08-22.lead_paragraph: The pastry chef Dominique Ansel is holding a pie marathon next month, with 11 kinds of pie to sample, including a few savory kinds. Salted-caramel apple, flambéed banana cream, blackberry and gin with roasted hazelnut crumble, and heirloom tomato with fresh ricotta are a few of the choices. Homemade ice cream, warm apple cider and a sneak peek at a new treat are included: Pie Nights; Sept. 14, 15, 21, 22, 28 and 29; one-hour sessions from 7 to 10 p.m.; tickets, $45 a person starting at noon on Wednesday from daevents.tocktix.com, Dominique Ansel Kitchen, 137 Seventh Avenue South (West 10th Street).
2016-08-22.headline_main: Pie Night at Dominique Ansel Kitchen

2016-08-22.abstract: After 40 years, Kevin Zraly is teaching his last class at his Windows On the World Wine School.
2016-08-22.snippet: After 40 years, Kevin Zraly is teaching his last class at his Windows On the World Wine School.
2016-08-22.lead_paragraph: Kevin Zraly, whose verve, passion and energy as a wine instructor are unparalleled, will teach just one more course before he retires. He’s been at it for 40 years with his Windows on the World Wine School, so-called because his classes started at that legendary restaurant. Since Sept. 11, 2001, they have been in Midtown, but he has kept the name. This is your last chance to experience Mr. Zraly on his favorite subject. Grab it: Windows on the World Wine School, Mondays from Sept. 26 to Oct. 24, and Nov. 1, 7 and 14, 7 to 9 p.m., JW Marriott Essex House, 160 Central Park South (Seventh Avenue); $1,200 a person from kevinzraly.com, 845-255-1456.
2016-08-22.headline_main: A Heralded Wine Instructor’s Last Class Before Retiring

2016-08-22.abstract: The hashtag started small in mid-2013, then grew to a full-throated rallying cry on social media, a Pew study found.
2016-08-22.snippet: The hashtag started small in mid-2013, then grew to a full-throated rallying cry on social media, a Pew study found.
2016-08-22.lead_paragraph: It had existed as a phrase for some time, but it wasn’t until two black men died in the summer of 2014 that Black Lives Matter began to flicker to life as a Twitter hashtag.
2016-08-22.headline_main: How #BlackLivesMatter Came to Define a Movement

2016-08-22.abstract: This amber spirit is made from chiles that are not quite ripe.
2016-08-22.snippet: This amber spirit is made from chiles that are not quite ripe.
2016-08-22.lead_paragraph: Add a soupçon of intrigue to your next cocktail or glass of sparkling wine with a splash of poblano green chile liqueur from Mexico. It’s the new sibling of Ancho Reyes Chile Liqueur, and delivers a clean, deeply vegetal aroma and sweet but not punishing heat. The green bottle is deceptive because the spirit itself is light amber. It’s made from chiles that are less ripe than the ones used in the more toasty Ancho Reyes, a spirit that was introduced in 2014 after being developed from a Puebla recipe dating from 1927. The new version will transform a margarita: Ancho Reyes Verde Chile Liqueur, $35.99 at Astor Wines & Spirits, astorwines.com.
2016-08-22.headline_main: From a Liqueur, a Vegetal Aroma and a Sweet Heat

2016-08-22.abstract: The comments from Mr. Trump follow months of vows to build a wall on the U.S.-Mexico border and deport immigrants who have entered the country illegally.
2016-08-22.snippet: The comments from Mr. Trump follow months of vows to build a wall on the U.S.-Mexico border and deport immigrants who have entered the country illegally.
2016-08-22.lead_paragraph: Donald J. Trump, tempering the tone of his hard-line approach to immigration for a general election audience, avoided repeating his previous call for mass deportations on Monday and instead said he wants to come up with a “really fair” plan to address the millions of undocumented immigrants now in the country.
2016-08-22.headline_main: Donald Trump, Shifting Immigration Tone, Stresses a ‘Fair’ Approach

2016-08-22.abstract: One blade for soft foods, like peaches and tomatoes; another for potatoes and carrots.
2016-08-22.snippet: One blade for soft foods, like peaches and tomatoes; another for potatoes and carrots.
2016-08-22.lead_paragraph: The serrated vegetable peeler that can tackle soft foods like tomatoes and peaches was first introduced in 2003 and quickly became a favorite in my kitchen. Now there’s a new peeler, with both serrated and straight blades, an all-in-one treasure: Urban Trend peeler, $14.99 at Bed Bath & Beyond, bedbathandbeyond.com.
2016-08-22.headline_main: One Tool for Peeling It All

2016-08-22.abstract: With apple notes in the nose and on the palate, it’s well suited to serve with an apple tart.
2016-08-22.snippet: With apple notes in the nose and on the palate, it’s well suited to serve with an apple tart.
2016-08-22.lead_paragraph: The Asturias region of northern Spain produces most of that country’s cider. So it is no wonder that it’s also the source of a cheese subtly flavored through the addition of cider to the milk before the curd is finished. This plump cylinder of deep ivory cheese has apple notes in the nose and on the palate, with the kind of dry finish you get from good cider. It melts beautifully, so use it for grilled cheese with a thin slice of apple tucked inside, shave some on top of baked apples, or serve it with an apple tart: Rebollín Cider Fusion, $15.75 for a cheese, about one pound, at Despaña Foods in Manhattan 212-219-5050, and in Jackson Heights, Queens, 718-779-4971.
2016-08-22.headline_main: Spanish Cheese With a Subtle Hint of Cider

2016-08-22.abstract: A judge in Texas ruled that the Obama administration had not complied with federal law when issuing its directives on bathroom access.
2016-08-22.snippet: A judge in Texas ruled that the Obama administration had not complied with federal law when issuing its directives on bathroom access.
2016-08-22.lead_paragraph: A judge in Texas ruled that the Obama administration had not complied with federal law when issuing its directives on bathroom access.
2016-08-22.headline_main: Preliminary Injunction Order

2016-08-22.abstract: A judge in Texas said the Obama administration had not followed federal law in an attempt to expand bathroom access for transgender students.
2016-08-22.snippet: A judge in Texas said the Obama administration had not followed federal law in an attempt to expand bathroom access for transgender students.
2016-08-22.lead_paragraph: A federal judge has blocked the Obama administration from enforcing new guidelines that were intended to expand restroom access for transgender students across the country.
2016-08-22.headline_main: Federal Transgender Bathroom Access Guidelines Blocked by Judge

2016-08-22.abstract: Swordfish belly, bluefish, dogfish and mackerel, all cut with care.
2016-08-22.snippet: Swordfish belly, bluefish, dogfish and mackerel, all cut with care.
2016-08-22.lead_paragraph: A good way to kick the farmed salmon/Chilean sea bass/shrimp habit is to visit Yuji Haraguchi’s serene little fish market. There is succulent swordfish belly to grill and the freshest bluefish to set you straight about this much-maligned variety, as well as marinated dogfish, mackerel and other Atlantic fish. “I want to change how we sell and eat fish,” Mr. Haraguchi said. His manager, Luke Davin, put it this way: “We live in a city on the water, but we don’t eat a lot of local species.” Mr. Haraguchi, who owns the nearby restaurant Okonomi and financed the market through a Kickstarter campaign, works with local fishermen who learn how to care for their catch so as to inflict the least amount of damage to the flesh, enhancing the flavor and texture. Prices are moderate; that swordfish belly, so rich that you need only about three ounces a person, is about $16 a pound. There’s a kitchen in the back where the fish is cut, and classes are held daily, afternoons and evenings: Osakana Japanese Fish Market, 290 Graham Avenue (Powers Street), Williamsburg, Brooklyn; osakanabk.com.
2016-08-22.headline_main: A Japanese Fish Market in Williamsburg

2016-08-22.abstract: Help a mom out with some breakfast recommendations.
2016-08-22.snippet: Help a mom out with some breakfast recommendations.
2016-08-22.lead_paragraph: Kim Severson is filling in for Sam Sifton, who emails readers of Cooking five days a week to talk about food and suggest recipes. That email also appears here. To receive it in your inbox, register here.
2016-08-22.headline_main: Let’s Talk Breakfast (and Dinner Too)

2016-08-22.abstract: Maybe a half-million people a day watched the Olympics on live streams — an object lesson for NBC.
2016-08-22.snippet: Maybe a half-million people a day watched the Olympics on live streams — an object lesson for NBC.
2016-08-22.lead_paragraph: Something amazing may be happening: Television broadcasters may start viewing their content the way the rest of us do — as something you watch, plain and simple, without caring what screen it’s on. And as something you want to see on your terms. Now.
2016-08-22.headline_main: How Streaming Is Changing Sports Watching

2016-08-22.abstract: The social network includes an option in the settings for displaying nicer-looking versions of the pictures you upload from your phone.

2016-08-22.abstract: The music producer helped pioneer the boy-band phenomenon before he was convicted of running a $300 million Ponzi scheme and sentenced to 25 years in federal prison.
2016-08-22.snippet: The music producer helped pioneer the boy-band phenomenon before he was convicted of running a $300 million Ponzi scheme and sentenced to 25 years in federal prison.
2016-08-22.lead_paragraph: Lou Pearlman, the music executive who built a pop empire on boy bands like the Backstreet Boys and ’NSync before going to prison for running a Ponzi scheme that stole hundreds of millions of dollars from investors, died on Friday in the Miami area, where he was in federal prison. He was 62.

2016-08-22.abstract: “Billy Lynn’s Long Halftime Walk” will be shown in a new format at the New York Film Festival, but Sony is still figuring out how to best show it beyond New York.

2016-08-22.lead_paragraph: After a four-year absence from theaters, Ang Lee will return this fall with a searing film about young American war heroes that may land him in the Oscar race. But the movie, billed as a cinematic leap forward because of the digitally radical way it was shot, has faced a major question.
2016-08-22.headline_main: Ang Lee Is Embracing a Faster Film Format. Can Theaters Keep Up?

2016-08-22.abstract: Nearly five years after Canada’s largest city introduced so-called open gangway trains, riders have given the trains a ringing endorsement. Now officials in New York are embracing the design.
2016-08-22.snippet: Nearly five years after Canada’s largest city introduced so-called open gangway trains, riders have given the trains a ringing endorsement. Now officials in New York are embracing the design.

2016-08-22.abstract: A stunt by an anti-immigration activist sent tourists running for cover, knocking over chairs at restaurants.
2016-08-22.snippet: A stunt by an anti-immigration activist sent tourists running for cover, knocking over chairs at restaurants.
2016-08-22.lead_paragraph: Sporting detachable beards, the men drove a Humvee onto Old Town Square in Prague on Sunday, wielding fake submachine-style BB guns and waving an Islamic State flag. Accompanied by a camel and a goat, they shouted “Allahu akbar” and fired guns without pellets.
2016-08-22.headline_main: Fake ISIS Attack in Prague, Intended as Protest, Causes Panic

2016-08-22.abstract: Drake’s “Views” remained at No. 2, and the rapper’s collaborator PartyNextDoor debuted at No. 3.
2016-08-22.snippet: Drake’s “Views” remained at No. 2, and the rapper’s collaborator PartyNextDoor debuted at No. 3.
2016-08-22.lead_paragraph: So far, August has belonged to “Suicide Squad.” The new movie has been No. 1 at the box office for the last three weekends, and its soundtrack is now the best-selling album for a second week in a row.

2016-08-22.lead_paragraph: PARIS — What is it about the head scarf? Or the “burkini,” the head-to-ankle bathing suit that serves as a demure covering for female Muslims now lighting up the political sphere in France?
2016-08-22.headline_main: The Multifaceted ‘Burkini’ Debate

2016-08-22.abstract: After her university dismissed her for absenteeism after she was treated for ovarian cancer, Liu Lingli began selling clothes on the street to pay her medical bills.
2016-08-22.snippet: After her university dismissed her for absenteeism after she was treated for ovarian cancer, Liu Lingli began selling clothes on the street to pay her medical bills.
2016-08-22.lead_paragraph: BEIJING — She was a face that people passed on the sidewalk without noticing, a sickly young woman with red lipstick and a pile of clothes. She hawked skirts for $15 and scarves for $10, joking with passers-by about the tedium of life.
2016-08-22.headline_main: Firing of Teacher Battling Cancer Prompts an Outcry in China

2016-08-22.abstract: Mr. Assman, a Saskatchewan gas station owner made famous by David Letterman, soon saw his name on T-shirts and bumper stickers. It was always about the name.
2016-08-22.snippet: Mr. Assman, a Saskatchewan gas station owner made famous by David Letterman, soon saw his name on T-shirts and bumper stickers. It was always about the name.
2016-08-22.lead_paragraph: Dick Assman, a Canadian gas station owner who received his 15 minutes of fame — actually, about a month of it — through the “Late Show With David Letterman,” died on Monday in Regina, Saskatchewan. He was 82.

2016-08-22.snippet: A just-completed project off the coast of Rhode Island, though relatively tiny, is at the forefront of a sea-based transition to renewable energy.

2016-08-22.abstract: For the popular card game SET®, how many cards is it possible to have on the table without there being a legal play?
2016-08-22.snippet: For the popular card game SET®, how many cards is it possible to have on the table without there being a legal play?

Our current challenge is based on SET®, the highly-addictive visual perception card game.
2016-08-22.headline_main: The Problem with SET®

2016-08-22.abstract: Speedo, Ralph Lauren, Syneron Candela and Airweave announced they were cutting ties to Lochte after the swimmer’s story about being robbed at gunpoint in Rio created an international furor.
2016-08-22.snippet: Speedo, Ralph Lauren, Syneron Candela and Airweave announced they were cutting ties to Lochte after the swimmer’s story about being robbed at gunpoint in Rio created an international furor.

2016-08-22.snippet: Romanticizing, and condescending to, the “real America.”
2016-08-22.lead_paragraph: Brad DeLong writes about pundits like Niall Ferguson who fantasize about a vast class of regular people — Real Americans — who practice traditional values, don’t eat fancy food, and vote for good, family-values Republicans who promise war. I’m surprised that he doesn’t mention Andrew Sullivan after 9/11:
2016-08-22.headline_main: What Do The Simple Folk Do?

2016-08-22.abstract: From the Watching team, expert TV and movie recommendations for the next few days.

2016-08-22.lead_paragraph: Welcome to Watching, The New York Times’s what-to-watch guide. We comb through releases big and small to email readers twice a week with our timely recommendations. You can browse previous guides here, and to receive recommendations straight to your inbox, sign up here. Stay tuned for our coming website.

2016-08-22.abstract: The change comes amid rising concern across Europe about the influence of Islamist ideologues in prisons.
2016-08-22.snippet: The change comes amid rising concern across Europe about the influence of Islamist ideologues in prisons.
2016-08-22.lead_paragraph: LONDON — Convicts in British prisons who preach terrorism and extreme ideology to fellow inmates will be held in high-security “specialist units,” the government announced on Monday, amid efforts to crack down on Islamic radicalization in jails.

2016-08-22.abstract: Mr. Bernardi plays the innkeeper in “Fiddler on the Roof,” wearing the same boots his father wore as Tevye. On Wednesday, he will step into his father’s old role.
2016-08-22.snippet: Mr. Bernardi plays the innkeeper in “Fiddler on the Roof,” wearing the same boots his father wore as Tevye. On Wednesday, he will step into his father’s old role.

2016-08-22.abstract: The goal of our election unit is to help students read, watch, research and discuss in order to come to conclusions grounded in evidence about the candidates and the issues.
2016-08-22.snippet: The goal of our election unit is to help students read, watch, research and discuss in order to come to conclusions grounded in evidence about the candidates and the issues.
2016-08-22.lead_paragraph: While the 2016 presidential election, with its unprecedented level of alarming rhetoric, may feel less straightforward or easy to bring into your classroom than elections of the past, we believe that it also offers unique opportunities to engage students with real and pressing questions about our democracy and how it works.
2016-08-22.headline_main: Our Election 2016 Unit: An Overview

2016-08-22.abstract: Tehran has stopped allowing Russian planes to fly into Syria from one of its bases, complaining that the Kremlin has been too public about the deal.
2016-08-22.snippet: Tehran has stopped allowing Russian planes to fly into Syria from one of its bases, complaining that the Kremlin has been too public about the deal.
2016-08-22.lead_paragraph: BEIRUT, Lebanon — Iran on Monday annulled permission for Russian planes to fly bombing runs into Syria from an Iranian base, only a week after having granted such extraordinary access, saying that the Kremlin had been unacceptably public and arrogant about the privilege.
2016-08-22.headline_main: Iran Revokes Russia’s Use of Air Base, Saying Moscow ‘Betrayed Trust’

2016-08-22.abstract: A fossilized bone tumor in South Africa is the oldest known case of cancer, researchers say. The extent of the disease so long ago remains elusive.
2016-08-22.snippet: A fossilized bone tumor in South Africa is the oldest known case of cancer, researchers say. The extent of the disease so long ago remains elusive.
2016-08-22.lead_paragraph: Carcinogens abounded 1.7 million years ago in Early Pleistocene times when a nameless protohuman wandered the South African countryside in what came to be known as the Cradle of Humankind.
2016-08-22.headline_main: The Known: Cancer Is Really, Really Old. The Unknown: How Common It Was.

The Barrow Street Theater will be reconfigured into an imitation pie shop to host a British production of the musical “Sweeney Todd: The Demon Barber of Fleet Street.”

2016-08-22.abstract: Sudep kills an estimated 2,600 Americans a year, but most neurologists don’t bring it up. Estimating the risk is uncertain, and there are no proven ways to prevent it.
2016-08-22.snippet: Sudep kills an estimated 2,600 Americans a year, but most neurologists don’t bring it up. Estimating the risk is uncertain, and there are no proven ways to prevent it.
2016-08-22.lead_paragraph: Shena Pearson nearly froze in her seat, terrified, as she stared at a power-point slide. She was at her first meeting of an epilepsy foundation, seeking help for her 12-year-old son Trysten, when a neurologist flashed the slide about something called Sudep.
2016-08-22.headline_main: A Risk for Sudden Death in Epilepsy That Often Goes Unmentioned

2016-08-22.snippet: The politically vulnerable leaders of Germany, France and Italy met to discuss the European Union’s new direction after Britain’s vote to leave the bloc.
2016-08-22.lead_paragraph: BERLIN — Germany, France and Italy will be the three most important nations left in the European Union after Britain’s stunning decision in June to leave the bloc. Yet all are substantially weakened by nagging domestic problems at a critical moment when Europe needs a new direction.

2016-08-22.abstract: The electro-pop musician Santigold’s collaboration with the artist and the director Ari Marcopoulos came after all three sat together at a Gucci show.
2016-08-22.snippet: The electro-pop musician Santigold’s collaboration with the artist and the director Ari Marcopoulos came after all three sat together at a Gucci show.
2016-08-22.lead_paragraph: So much can happen in the front row of a Gucci show. At the men’s show this past June, Jared Leto (sitting next to Olly Alexander of Years & Years) was clearly delighted by a green coat, a reaction made instantly meme-worthy by an Instagram by the artist and Gucci collaborator Trevor “Trouble” Andrew. And at the women’s fall/winter show in February, collaboration fomented: Andrew and his wife, the electro-pop musician Santigold, sat next to their old friend, the photographer Ari Marcopoulos, as well as the artist Kara Walker. “It was the perfect double date,” Santigold remembers. “We hung out all night, and at the end of the evening, they said, ‘Let’s do a video together! We have an idea!’ and Kara snapped a silhouette photo of me in the dark as I stepped into my cab.”
2016-08-22.headline_main: An Infectious, Upbeat Music Video, With an Assist From Kara Walker

2016-08-22.abstract: A classical music critic speaks with Julia Bullock and Tyshawn Sorey, the creators of “Josephine Baker: An Intimate Portrait,” performed at the Mostly Mozart Festival on Aug. 24.
2016-08-22.snippet: A classical music critic speaks with Julia Bullock and Tyshawn Sorey, the creators of “Josephine Baker: An Intimate Portrait,” performed at the Mostly Mozart Festival on Aug. 24.
2016-08-22.lead_paragraph: Josephine Baker looms in the cultural imagination for her Gay Paree sexiness and nostalgic appeal, her slinky gowns and charismatic flair for dancing the Charleston. But for “Josephine Baker: A Personal Portrait,” an evening of Baker songs newly arranged by the young avant-jazz composer and musician Tyshawn Sorey and sung by the radiant soprano Julia Bullock, the tempo has been slowed and the mood hushed to unsettled melancholy. It’s a ritual of mourning, a reminder of Baker’s racial struggles and civil rights activism, and of the era of police brutality and Black Lives Matter in which we currently live.
2016-08-22.headline_main: Reimagining Josephine Baker’s Music in the Era of Black Lives Matter

2016-08-22.abstract: Bryant Toth had racked up quite the collection long before travel restrictions from the U.S. to Havana were relaxed.
2016-08-22.snippet: Bryant Toth had racked up quite the collection long before travel restrictions from the U.S. to Havana were relaxed.
2016-08-22.lead_paragraph: Long before travel restrictions from the U.S. to Havana were relaxed, Bryant Toth, the former membership manager at New York’s Soho House, had racked up quite a few visits — and a growing collection of contemporary Cuban art. The pieces he brought back sparked immediate interest among his friends, and before he knew it, Toth, 28, was a de facto dealer. “I didn’t have this grand vision,” he explains. “My friends just asked about the artists.” By last fall, demand was so high that Toth left Soho House to work full-time with seven of them, displaying their work mostly on his website and Instagram account, but occasionally in pop-up gallery shows, too: One he mounted at the Hotel Chelsea last November for the painter Hector Frank, a 55-year-old former electrical engineer, nearly sold out. Toth will exhibit the work of Cuban artists including Frank later this year in New York and Los Angeles.
2016-08-22.headline_main: The Man Bringing Contemporary Cuban Art to America

2016-08-22.abstract: We asked readers — without any context — to caption a photo that ran in The New York Times. Here’s how they responded.
2016-08-22.snippet: We asked readers — without any context — to caption a photo that ran in The New York Times. Here’s how they responded.

2016-08-22.abstract: Air pollution is rapidly increasing in Asian cities and not all masks protect equally.
2016-08-22.snippet: Air pollution is rapidly increasing in Asian cities and not all masks protect equally.
2016-08-22.lead_paragraph: Across Asia, hundreds of millions of motorcyclists, bicyclists and pedestrians wear face masks to protect themselves against air pollution. The masks come in many sizes and colors: Car-exhaust black is the most common, but Hello Kitty pink, Nike swooshes and Burberry tan plaid have been spotted. What has been lacking, until now, is data on whether they actually work.
2016-08-22.headline_main: That Cloth Mask for Smoggy Days? A Paper One Works Better

2016-08-22.lead_paragraph: In the tech business, you often invent the product first and find out what it’s for later. Facebook was a college social site before it became a global media hub; Amazon was a bookseller before it was, well, everything.

2016-08-22.abstract: A new report in The New England Journal of Medicine confirms what many cancer researchers have known — that an “epidemic” can be traced to overdiagnosis.
2016-08-22.snippet: A new report in The New England Journal of Medicine confirms what many cancer researchers have known — that an “epidemic” can be traced to overdiagnosis.
2016-08-22.lead_paragraph: The data in a new report on thyroid cancer was stunning. From 2003 to 2007, as many as 70 percent to 80 percent of women in the United States, France, Italy and Australia who were told they had thyroid cancer and who often had their thyroids removed actually had tumors that should have been left alone.
2016-08-22.headline_main: Got a Thyroid Tumor? Most Should Be Left Alone.

2016-08-22.abstract: Nikki Chasin embroiders, prints and hand-beads garments that appeal to a broad audience.
2016-08-22.snippet: Nikki Chasin embroiders, prints and hand-beads garments that appeal to a broad audience.
2016-08-22.lead_paragraph: Nikki Chasin can’t put her finger on the first time that she identified “fashion designer” as a profession, but she spent her girlhood in Coral Gables, Fla., practicing the basics. She remembers playing a Barbie computer game (“you could choose from her, Skipper or four other characters, pick their outfits and put them in a setting like the mall or at a sleepover — then I’d print them out and they were super-pixelated”). She and a friend started a “fashion company” called AKNC (the pair’s initials and also a nod to DKNY) that consisted of sketches of column dresses and feather boas. “We’d list the stores that sold AKNC and one day, my younger sister was drawing with us, and for one of the stores where you could buy her outfit, she put Dairy Queen,” Chasin says, laughing. She ultimately outlined her future career path in a book she made for school in fourth grade. “For the ‘about the author’ page, the last line read: ‘Nikki wants to go to FIT and then move to Los Angeles and become a fashion designer.’”
2016-08-22.headline_main: Brand to Know: A Line Worn by Grandmothers and Miley Cyrus Alike

2016-08-22.abstract: In his new book, “Play All,” the author and former Observer critic ruminates on the television landscape, in some cases turning to series that are no longer on the air.
2016-08-22.snippet: In his new book, “Play All,” the author and former Observer critic ruminates on the television landscape, in some cases turning to series that are no longer on the air.

2016-08-22.abstract: A string of global heat records continued last month. El Niño contributed to it, as did overall warming linked to greenhouse gas emissions.
2016-08-22.snippet: A string of global heat records continued last month. El Niño contributed to it, as did overall warming linked to greenhouse gas emissions.
2016-08-22.lead_paragraph: Continuing a string of global heat records, last month was the hottest July ever recorded, NASA said. But the agency added a wrinkle: Because July is always the hottest month of the year, this July was the hottest of any month since adequate record-keeping began in 1880.
2016-08-22.headline_main: How Hot Was It in July? Hotter Than Ever.

2016-08-23.abstract: The composer of “Miami Beach Rhumba” and other hits spent the last decades of his life as a New York City lounge pianist.
2016-08-23.snippet: The composer of “Miami Beach Rhumba” and other hits spent the last decades of his life as a New York City lounge pianist.
2016-08-23.lead_paragraph: There was a time in the middle of the last century when piano-playing children in certain quarters of the Bronx and Brooklyn were often asked to entertain guests with a song called “Miami Beach Rhumba,” an improbable combination of zesty Latin dance rhythms and musical inflections born of the shtetls and ghettos of Eastern Europe.
2016-08-23.headline_main: Irving Fields, Composer Who Infused Songs With Latin Rhythms, Dies at 101

2016-08-23.abstract: The most promising initial lead in the killing of Karina Vetrano — DNA evidence quite likely from the assailant — has not helped identify a suspect, a law enforcement official said.
2016-08-23.snippet: The most promising initial lead in the killing of Karina Vetrano — DNA evidence quite likely from the assailant — has not helped identify a suspect, a law enforcement official said.
2016-08-23.lead_paragraph: On the map it is just a green fringe, nestled between Jamaica Bay and Howard Beach, Queens, but for the New York City detectives investigating the murder of a jogger it has revealed itself to be a desolate wilderness. Clearing the crime scene required machetes. The police now patrol the area daily on all-terrain vehicles.
2016-08-23.headline_main: New York Police Struggle to Generate Leads in Murder of Queens Jogger

2016-08-23.abstract: Breaking from recent tradition, both nominees are proving relatively secretive and selective in providing up-to-date medical records.

2016-08-23.lead_paragraph: Donald J. Trump and Hillary Clinton have been more secretive and selective than many recent presidential nominees in providing up-to-date details about their personal health — a particularly striking departure, experts say, given the candidates’ age.

2016-08-23.abstract: Matz, who was scratched from his most recent scheduled start on Friday, had already been pitching with a large bone spur in his elbow and now has shoulder tightness.

2016-08-23.lead_paragraph: SAN FRANCISCO — Just as the Mets welcomed back key players from injuries, they sustained another blow: Tests showed that Steven Matz, one of the team’s two left-handed starters, had tightness in his throwing shoulder, and he is headed to the disabled list, the team announced Monday.

2016-08-23.abstract: The next three Games are in East Asia, half a day away on the clock. That makes for scheduling headaches even as audiences fragment.
2016-08-23.snippet: The next three Games are in East Asia, half a day away on the clock. That makes for scheduling headaches even as audiences fragment.
2016-08-23.lead_paragraph: NBCUniversal heads into the next three Olympics — all of them in Asia — faced with a critical question: Was the lower-than-expected prime-time viewership for the just-completed Summer Games in Rio de Janeiro a fluke or a harbinger of fraying audiences over the next six years?
2016-08-23.headline_main: With Audience Shrinking, NBC Looks Cautiously to Olympics in Asia

That move could imperil the career of Josh Brown, who was suspended for one game by the N.F.L. last week for a 2015 arrest on a domestic violence charge.

2016-08-23.lead_paragraph: Joyce Carol Thomas, a poet, playwright and award-winning children’s writer whose work portrayed the complexities of African-American rural life, a subject often simplified in young-adult fiction, died on Aug. 13 in Stanford, Calif. She was 78.

2016-08-23.lead_paragraph: Doris Bohrer, who as a spy for the Office of Strategic Services during World War II helped plan the Allied invasion of Sicily and traced the movement of German trains transporting prisoners to concentration camps, died on Aug. 8 in Greensboro, N.C. She was 93.

2016-08-23.snippet: As editor in chief of Emerge, Mr. Curry shifted the emphasis from entertainment to news and came up with a motto: “Black America’s Newsmagazine.”
2016-08-23.lead_paragraph: George E. Curry, who turned Emerge into a provocative, must-read newsmagazine for black readers in the 1990s and who, as the editor in chief of the National Newspaper Publishers Association, wrote a weekly column carried by more than 200 black newspapers, died on Saturday in Takoma Park, Md. He was 69.
2016-08-23.headline_main: George Curry, Journalist With a Mission to Serve Black Readers, Dies at 69

2016-08-23.abstract: Denizens and landscapes of a less-glamorized version of Los Angeles pique the interest of a photographer who is not distracted by the shine the city can so often project.
2016-08-23.snippet: Denizens and landscapes of a less-glamorized version of Los Angeles pique the interest of a photographer who is not distracted by the shine the city can so often project.
2016-08-23.lead_paragraph: Twenty-first century culture, with its social media mores, trains artists to seek out “likes” and “favorites.” Acclaim becomes the immediate goal, rather than a byproduct of good work, honed over years of dedication to craft.

2016-08-23.abstract: The sport called me, because it could punch me unstuck.
2016-08-23.snippet: The sport called me, because it could punch me unstuck.
2016-08-23.lead_paragraph: My first fight in Madison Square Garden was 17 years ago. I was 25 years old and 119 pounds, which made me a bantamweight. Merriam-Webster defines “bantam” as “any of numerous small domestic fowls that are miniatures of members of the standard breeds” or “a person of diminutive stature and often combative disposition.”
2016-08-23.headline_main: How Boxing Got Me to Face My Fears

2016-08-23.abstract: The money was a real debt and had to be paid at some point, but the United States exploited the timing so Iran didn’t delay freeing its hostages.
2016-08-23.snippet: The money was a real debt and had to be paid at some point, but the United States exploited the timing so Iran didn’t delay freeing its hostages.
2016-08-23.lead_paragraph: The first thing to know about the latest controversy over the Iran nuclear deal is that the Obama administration did not pay $400 million in “ransom” to secure the release of three American detainees. Yet that’s the story critics are peddling in another attempt to discredit an agreement that has done something remarkable — halted a program that had put Iran within striking distance of producing a nuclear weapon.
2016-08-23.headline_main: The Fake $400 Million Iran ‘Ransom’ Story

2016-08-23.abstract: The call to service is drowned out by the system’s noise, and a vocation becomes a career.
2016-08-23.snippet: The call to service is drowned out by the system’s noise, and a vocation becomes a career.
2016-08-23.lead_paragraph: We’ve clearly had a failure of leadership in this country. The political system is not working as it should. Big problems are not being addressed.
2016-08-23.headline_main: Why America’s Leadership Fails

2016-08-23.abstract: For one thing, it should stop using profile pictures before booking.
2016-08-23.snippet: For one thing, it should stop using profile pictures before booking.
2016-08-23.lead_paragraph: Washington — While planning a trip to Buenos Aires two years ago, I decided to give Airbnb a try. The idea of renting a private apartment through the online service instead of paying for a generic hotel room was intriguing. Though August marks the off-season for tourism in Buenos Aires, I was rejected by the first three hosts I contacted. One host listed the days in question as available but nonetheless claimed my request overlapped with another reservation; another declined without explanation; and a third got back to me after a long delay, claiming to have missed my request.
2016-08-23.headline_main: Does Airbnb Enable Racism?

2016-08-23.abstract: America needs to improve its standing against China. But trade agreements won’t do the job.
2016-08-23.snippet: America needs to improve its standing against China. But trade agreements won’t do the job.
2016-08-23.lead_paragraph: Washington — With both presidential candidates running on their opposition to President Obama’s proposed Trans-Pacific Partnership free trade agreement, the White House is gearing up for one last, desperate push to get the deal through Congress. The pitch, which will begin in a few weeks, will rely on what President Obama thinks is his ace in the hole: the argument that, regardless of its economic merits, the deal, as a counter to China’s rising influence, is essential to America’s national security.
2016-08-23.headline_main: Why the TPP Deal Won’t Improve Our Security

2016-08-23.abstract: Building a new food hub in the Bronx would mean a lot more local produce for people with smaller budgets.
2016-08-23.snippet: Building a new food hub in the Bronx would mean a lot more local produce for people with smaller budgets.
2016-08-23.lead_paragraph: Farmers’ markets across New York State are bulging with the season’s fleshiest tomatoes, stacks of yellow corn, and cauliflower from basic white to a startling shade of purple. Such a wealth of local produce has long been available to those with money ($6 for a dozen eggs, for example), especially at outdoor markets like the one at Union Square in New York City. Now, however, Gov. Andrew Cuomo, city officials and the nonprofit group GrowNYC have announced plans to bring a lot more local produce to people with smaller budgets.
2016-08-23.headline_main: A More Egalitarian Approach to Locavore Eating

2016-08-23.abstract: She’s not an all-caps tweetstorm kind of candidate. But she is trying to connect.
2016-08-23.snippet: She’s not an all-caps tweetstorm kind of candidate. But she is trying to connect.
2016-08-23.lead_paragraph: In 2012, Adam Smith was getting drinks with his friend Stacy Lambe and mentioned a photo he’d seen of Hillary Clinton wearing sunglasses and stoically checking her BlackBerry.

2016-08-23.lead_paragraph: Thirty years ago, the Nobel Prize-winning novelist Doris Lessing gave a series of lectures, later published in a book, “Prisons We Choose to Live Inside,” in which she reflected on the brutality in the world and asked how individuals and societies could evolve into something better.
2016-08-23.headline_main: Putting the Power of Self-Knowledge to Work

2016-08-23.snippet: Taylor Swift owns a house in a Rhode Island beach town. Sometimes she has parties there to which she invites her famous friends. How do you think you and your town or neighborhood would treat a celebrity if one lived nearby? Why?
